Person.Experience: David is Co-Head of the Global Infrastructure Group. He specialises in infrastructure related work acting for sponsors, funders and the public sector. David is recognised as a leading market practitioner. In the late 1990s, he was one of the original members of the Treasury Taskforce, the public sector team recruited from the private sector that was credited with improving the PFI process for the UK Government. He has advised on a broad range of deals across the infrastructure landscape (greenfield and brownfield) from roads to satellites.

Bartosz specialises in capital markets and derivatives law. He advises clients on all aspects of OTC derivatives transactions, repo and securities lending, including hedging various types of finance transactions as well as on the enforceability of close-out netting, set-off and collateral against all counterparty types. He also advises on structured finance transactions, issuing covered bonds and securitisation transactions. Bartosz has authored standard documentation for both derivatives and collateral arrangements on the interbank market of the Polish Bank Association. He is legal counsel to the International Swaps and Derivatives Association (ISDA) in Poland. "Bartosz Jagodzinski is 'a very sensible practitioner'" Chambers Global 2012

Godfried specialises in tax law. He serves as the head of the Amsterdam tax department. His practice focuses on advising clients on the tax aspects of real estate transactions, PPP, mergers and acquisitions and other major transactions, including spin-offs, international restructurings and corporate joint ventures. Godfried also works with clients on issues related to corporate finance and domestic and international taxation. He is admitted to the Amsterdam Bar, a member of the Dutch Bar of Tax Advisors and of the Dutch Tax Society. He regularly writes for various publications including Tax Notes International and International Tax Review and he is the editor of the Netherlands chapter in IBFD's M&A publication. The 2013 edition of Chambers Global describes him as follows: "Department head Godfried Kinnegim is particularly praised for his knowledge of the tax aspects of PPPs". ' He always takes the time to explain things in a way I understand', says a client. Another reports: 'He knows what he's talking about and what to look for'. The 2013 edition of the Legal 500 states: 'Godfried Kinnegim, who gives spot-on tax advice and invaluable technical insights, is a fantastic negotiator'.

Gerard specialises in complex capital management and debt securities transactions such as covered bonds, CDOs and securitisations as well as (structured) swaps and derivatives. His client base includes corporates and major financial institutions. Gerard studied at the University of Leiden and obtained an LL.M degree at the University of London. He has lectured at the Grotius Academy and the University of Utrecht. The 2013 edition of Chambers Global ranks Gerard a Band 1 lawyer and he receives excellent praise for his securitisation practice. One client enthuses: "He's one of the most commercial lawyers I've ever met – he knows securitisation like the back of his hand."

Karine specialises in mergers and acquisitions, joint ventures and strategic alliances with a strong focus on private equity. Karine represents a number of private equity providers and large Dutch listed and non-listed companies on a regular basis. She has been involved in a large number of transactions for private equity houses, including 3i, Gilde, Charterhouse and NPM. As an associate Karine spent one year at Simpson Thatcher & Bartlett in New York. Karine was voted best M&A lawyer of the Netherlands in 2008. The 2012 edition of Chambers Europe describes Karine as follows: "Karine Kodde is widely respected for her M&A capacities." and "Karine Kodde is a dedicated deal maker, admired by all who encounter her. 'She's clever and commercial, and great at finding creative solutions,' says a client." The 2011 edition of Chambers Europe describes Karine as follows: "Karine Kodde is considered a committed negotiator who 'does an excellent job at getting her clients what they want'."

Person.Publications: Bookbuilding on the Dutch Market, Ondernemingsrecht, 1999 Delisting, Ondernemingsrecht, 2003 Nieuwe Wmz een kort leven beschoren, in: TOP nr. 1, 2006 Hedge funds en marktmanipulatie, in: Onderneming & Financiering nr. 73, 2006 Market Abuse: "Disclosure of price-sensitive information", Kluwer, 2008 Handboek Openbaar Bod: "Het Fusieprotocol", Kluwer, 2008 Public offers in the Netherlands: "The merger protocol”, Kluwer, 2009 Financial Law in the Netherlands: "Listing and Delisting", Kluwer, 2010 Onderneming en Aandeelhouder: "De Overheid als Aandeelhouder", Kluwer, 2011 Handboek Beursgang: "Hoofdnorm: art. 5(1) Prospectusrichtlijn", Kluwer, 2011 Handboek Beursgang, Kluwer, 2011 (editor) Various annotations on Dutch case law in the corporate law journal “JOR” Aandeelhouders missen een vuist: Management Scope nr. 12, 2012

Person.Experience: Justin has a broad corporate practice, focussing primarily on private equity and private M&A. He advises frequently on both the buy and sell side of controlled auctions and has significant carve out experience. Justin has worked extensively in both the TMT sector, including for KPN, Tele2, LGI and Talpa, and in the commodities sector, where he frequently acts for Cargill. In private equity he works with a number of our key clients, including Apax, 3i, Bencis and Parcom. He also represents management teams in buy-out situations. Chambers ranks Justin a Band and is praised by clients as "energetic, knowledgeable and solution oriented".

Joint Ventures in the Netherlands', part of the Practising Law Institute's, 14-volume Course Handbook

Person.Experience: Peter specialises in all aspects of government regulation of business, advising clients on legislation, liaising with regulatory authorities, and representing clients in regulatory and court proceedings. He also advises on transactional work in regulated sectors, focusing specifically on the financial services, communications and healthcare sectors. His practice also covers contractual work, civil litigation and arbitration for regulated industries.

Paul heads the Competition department in Amsterdam. He specialises in EC and Dutch competition law and regulation as well as general EU law. Paul has ample experience in assisting major corporate clients when they are under investigation by regulators and prosecutors, as well as extensive experience in the field of merger control and cartel cases. He has represented a large number of domestic and international clients in proceedings before the European Commission, the European Court of Justice, the Dutch competition and regulatory authorities and the Dutch courts. Paul frequently litigates cases both in the Dutch and the EU courts and is viewed as one of the top five competition lawyers in the Netherlands. He is also a regular speaker at conferences on competition law. The 2011 edition of Chambers Europe ranks Paul a Band 1 lawyer and describes him as follows: "Team leader Paul Glazener 'is central to the practice,' observers say. Clients describe him as 'very accessible and knowledgeable' and peers agree that he is 'clearly one of the best' competition lawyers in the country." The 2011 edition of Legal 500 ranks Paul a Leading Individual and describes him as follows: "Paul Glazener has 'a good feel for the political side of things'."
Person.Publications: A great number of articles and annotations in his field of practice in both Dutch and international magazines, such as: Sociaal Economische Wetgeving, the Nederlands Juristenblad, IER, the Bijblad Industriële Eigendom, the Common Market Law Review, Mediaforum, Leiden Journal of International Law and Markt & Mededinging.

(2013) Terug de polder in: pleidooi voor een werkende arbeidsmarkt, Amsterdam: Bert Bakker (2010) "A Twist of the Equality Logic: The Directive on Working Conditions for Temporary Agency Workers and Dutch Law", European Labour Law Journal, Vol 1, 3 (2009) Employment Law and Works Councils in the Netherlands, Deventer: Kluwer (also published in Mandarin) (2006) The end of the Affair on the ménage à trois of employment, contract and termination, Deventer: Kluwer (2003) Equal pay for temporary agency workers, Taking a closer look at the draft directive on working conditions for temporary agency workers, Deventer: Kluwer (1999) "Competitive Activities by Employees", in: Wernemersconcurrentie, Deventer: Kluwer List of publications in Dutch is available on request.

Person.Experience: Herald specialises in outsourcing, technology transactions, strategic relationships and mergers and acquisitions. He has particular expertise in leading complex multi-jurisdictional projects, in technology and in the financial industry. Chambers Europe and Legal 500 consistently rank Herald in the top ten and describe him as follows: "Herald Jongen is one of the few who is able and, more to the point willing, to deliver what we ask for on time and in the form we need." "The sheer depth of his market knowledge leaves a lasting impression on clients, who speak of his openness, accessibility and creativity." "Market sources see him as a major deal maker who knows where to focus his attention". "Clients appreciate his no-nonsense and practical mentality, whilst peers admire him for his skill in complex outsourcing transactions." "A pleasure to work with."
Person.Publications: Many articles on information technology issues. The latest publication is a loose-leaf on Outsourcing in Europe and Asia (Wolters Kluwer).

Person.Experience: Maarten specialises in mergers and acquisitions joint ventures and strategic alliances, all involving both private and public companies. He is particularly experienced in public bids and has advised on friendly and hostile bids for bidders and for targets and on numerous private transactions. Maarten regularly advises on general corporate matters, corporate governance and strategic issues. Maarten regularly advises DSM, Heijmans and Van Lanschot on various corporate matters. He teaches on the subject of public offers in the Grotius Lectures Series.
Person.Publications: Author of various articles on corporate law

Person.Experience: Christiaan specialises in corporate law and notarial related law. He has experience in advising on a wide range of corporate issues including mergers and acquisitions, private equity, corporate governance, corporate structures, IPOs, and anti-takeover devices. His field of expertise also includes corporate and structured finance transactions, incorporation of companies and partnerships, voting trusts, share transfers, capital contributions, share buy-back programmes, employee participation plans as well as the setting up and regulatory aspects of investment institutions. Christiaan has been with Allen & Overy since January 2000. Prior to that he worked at Loeff Claeys Verbeke from 1998. He graduated in 1988 from the Free University of Amsterdam and completed postgraduate studies in European Law both at the Centre Européen Universitaire de Nancy and at the University of Nancy II, Nancy, France (1989). In 1999 he worked for an American law firm in Chicago.
Person.Publications: On the editorial staff of V&O ('Vennootschap & Onderneming').

Person.Experience: Gerbrand specialises in various aspects of notarial corporate law such as corporate restructuring, mergers, acquisitions, demergers, share issues and spin-offs. His specialism furthermore relates to the legal aspects of refinancing, rights issues and anti take-over mechanisms. He also has wide experience in advising publicly-held utilities companies on privatisations and subsequent transnational mergers. Furthermore he advises several listed companies and other large non-listed companies with regard to the Dutch Corporate Governance Code as amended from time to time and the implementation of the Code in board rules. The recent demerger of Vereniging VU was done under his supervision, as well as the split of TNT into TNT Express and PostNL. He is a member of the Allen & Overy Amsterdam pension fund team. Gerbrand gives professional training to civil law notaries and is a lecturer at the Grotius Academy.

Dominique specialises in civil, commercial and public law, as well as in procedural matters and in construction law. He also gained considerable experience with European and Luxembourg public tender procedures. He has more than 15 years of post-qualification experience in these areas. He regularly advises Luxembourg public authorities and the Ordre des Architectes et Ingénieurs Conseils (OAI).

Marc heads the Luxembourg corporate practice. He specialises in private equity, mergers and acquisitions, securities and stock exchange-related work, takeovers and joint ventures. He has more than 25 years of experience advising clients across all sectors, particularly financial institutions, private equity, insurance, energy, communications, media and technology. Marc is a member of the American Chamber of Commerce in Luxembourg (AMCHAM), the American Business Association of Luxembourg, the Business Association Luxembourg – Russia, the Luxembourg Banking Lawyers Association (ALJB), the International Bar Association (IBA) and a founding member of the Luxembourg Arbitration Association. He is also a board member of the Luxembourg Private Equity and Venture Capital Association (LPEA) and a member of the training committee of the Luxembourg Directors' Institute (ILA). Marc acted from 2000 to 2008 as Managing Partner of the Luxembourg office of Allen & Overy and is currently its Senior Partner.

Katia heads the IP & TMT department in the Luxembourg office. She focuses on both contentious and non-contentious IP matters. She has considerable experience in trademark, copyright and patent issues, including litigation before the General Court of the European Union. Katia also specialises in distribution law, advertising, trade practices, e-commerce and TMT law, including data protection. Katia is active in several working groups advising and lobbying on IP-related issues and is a regular speaker at conferences. Katia is the former president of the 600 member strong Benelux Association for Trademark and Design Law (BMM), as well as a former member of the Association's board and legislative committee. She is a member of the Harmonisation Committee of the European Community Trademark Association (ECTA), of the International Trademark Association (INTA) and of the International Association for the Protection of Intellectual Property (AIPPI). She has also been re-appointed as a member of the Benelux Council for Intellectual Property, an advisory body to the Benelux Office for Intellectual Property.

Person.Experience: André specialises in private banking activities and in the setting up, restructuring and merging of banks. He also heads the Luxembourg labour law department, which deals with all employment issues including individual and collective dismissals, complementary pension arrangements and the negotiation of collective bargaining agreements. In addition, he has extensive experience in real estate development and transactions (asset and share deals). He has 25 years of experience working in these areas. André is a member of the Banks and Investment Firms Committee of the Luxembourg supervisory authority for the financial sector (CSSF). He is also a member of the Human Resources Committee of the American Chamber of Commerce (AMCHAM). André serves at the Board of Directors of the ABBL, the Luxembourg Bankers' Association.

Person.Experience: Jean heads the Luxembourg tax practice and is also a member of Allen & Overy’s global tax board, the firm-wide management body of the Tax department. He advises various international investment banks on tax structured finance schemes (including securitisations) and has extensive experience in advising institutional investors and private equity funds in cross-border investments all over Europe. He has significant expertise in advising clients on tax aspects for Luxembourg investments and in relation to the structuring of international acquisitions via Luxembourg regulated and non-regulated vehicles. He has more than 20 years of experience as a tax lawyer and has written several books on Luxembourg and international taxation. He is a member of the scientific board of the Luxembourg chapter of the International Fiscal Association (IFA), a member of the International Bar Association (IBA) and has been elected as a member of the Luxembourg Bar Council.

Person.Experience: Pierre specialises in finance, restructuring and regulatory matters. He has substantial experience in advising on regulatory aspects and the structuring of regulated and unregulated investment funds, with a particular focus on structured funds, private equity funds and real estate funds. He also regularly advises on regulatory insurance and reinsurance matters. In addition, Pierre has significant expertise in advising clients on cross-border financings and restructurings, including in distressed situations. He has more than 15 years of experience working in these areas. Pierre was formerly the president of the Luxembourg Young Bar Association (2004-2005) and a member of the Luxembourg Bar Council (2008-2010). He is a member of several technical committees of the Association of the Luxembourg Fund Industry (ALFI).

Person.Experience: Henri is the managing partner of Allen & Overy Luxembourg and the partner in charge of the banking and capital markets department. He specialises in capital markets (including issues of debt and equity securities, securitisations and repackagings, derivatives and structured finance) and international banking work (including syndicated lending, investment grade and leveraged acquisition finance, debt restructuring and financial services regulatory matters). He has more than 20 years of experience working in these areas. He regularly publishes articles on banking and finance issues and represents Luxembourg on the advisory board of the Capital Markets Law Journal (published by Oxford University Press). He is a member of the Consultative Working Group of the Corporate Finance Standing Committee of the European Securities and Markets Authority (ESMA). Henri is also a member of committees of the Luxembourg supervisory authority of the financial sector (Comission de Surveillance du Secteur Financier - CSSF).

Person.Experience: Caroline has expertise in national and cross-border transactions involving corporate law matters especially acquisitions, restructurings and joint ventures.

Person.Experience: Eric is a US-qualified counsel in the international capital markets department of our Singapore office. He has extensive experience representing corporate and sovereign issuers and investment banks in a variety of corporate finance transactions, including primarily Rule 144A and Regulation S debt and equity transactions, tender offers and privatizations. Eric has closed capital markets transactions for sovereign, quasi-sovereign and corporate issuers in the Philippines, Hong Kong, China, Korea, Thailand, Singapore, Malaysia, Indonesia, India and Sri Lanka. Highlights of his work include advising on initial public offerings for Thai Air Asia, Tesco Lotus PFPO, Hutchison Port Holdings Trust, PT Borneo Lumbung Energi & Metal Tbk, Cebu Air, The Link REIT, Shui On Land, Sunway REIT, San Miguel Brewery, GMA Network, Inc. and PTT Public Company Limited and advising on global bond offerings for Hutchison Whampoa Limited, PTT Public Company Limited, PTT Exploration and Production Plc., The Siam Commercial Bank Plc., The Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka, National Power Corporation of the Philippines and The Link REIT.

Jetty specialises in capital markets, securities, public and private M&A and corporate restructurings. She advised listed and private companies and has a wide range of experience in initial public offerings, private placements, rights issues, accelerated bookbuild offerings, mergers and acquisitions and joint ventures. She focuses particularly on the commercial and economic drivers of deals. She joined Allen & Overy in 2000 and has worked in our Amsterdam and London offices. She is a member of the Dutch Trade Law Association (Vereeniging Handelsrecht).

James has a wide range of experience across many different banking transactions and structures, including project, real estate, leverage and acquisition finance transactions, acting for both lenders and borrowers. Recently he has worked on a number of large restructurings again acting for both lenders and borrowers. Specific transactions include advising the Mecom and Monier groups in respect of their recent financial restructurings.

Tim has considerable experience in the project finance sector, with a particular focus on energy and infrastructure projects. He advises sponsors, project companies and lenders in relation to the development and financing of a number of projects in Europe, Africa and Central and Eastern Europe and the Middle-East.
Person.Publications: Scales. T, Beaton. S, (2008) "Impact of Fuel Subsidies on IPP Project Financing", African Energy Forum

Person.Experience: Marc has significant experience acting for clients from numerous sectors in connection with a wide variety of commercial and financial disputes including in particular in the field of financial derivatives. He also has significant and extensive experience in all contentious matters and situations arising from insolvency. These often complex, high value and multi-party disputes have arisen in diverse industrial, commercial and financial sectors and have been conducted in various jurisdictions including London, Hong Kong and Bermuda. Marc speaks French fluently. Marc is ranked as a leading individual for banking litigation in the UK Legal 500. He has either been part of or led teams recognised for litigation awards. He led the Allen & Overy LLP team that was recognised as “stand-out” at the FT innovation awards 2010 for dispute resolution. Chambers UK 2014 (Banking Litigation) comment that he “has an outstanding reputation in the field and is adept at handling complex disputes …He is praised as ‘clear thinking’ and ‘strategic’, with one source commenting: ‘He is very dedicated, very practical and able to see the solution in big litigation’”.

Stephen specializes in tax planning for multi-national corporations, investment funds, and financial institutions, and has extensive experience in cross-border acquisitions, divestitures and joint ventures and in the development and negotiation of tax-based structured financings.

Will specialises in mergers & acquisitions, private equity, TMT and general commercial work. He regularly acts on M&A transactions in Greater China across a range of sectors, and on TMT and outsourcing transactions in the Asian region. Will is qualified in Hong Kong, England and Australia.

Zoltán has been advising on corporate and capital market transactions and mergers and acquisitions, for almost 20 years and he is head of the Hungarian Corporate Law Team in the Budapest office. Zoltán regularly advises leading Hungarian and international companies such as MOL, OTP Bank, BorsodChem, AES, ExxonMobile, Eni, and Randstad concerning their operations in Hungary. Zoltán is consistently recommended in the major legal directories, and he was part of the team which was awarded "Hungarian Law Firm of the Year" by IFLR 2011.

Person.Experience: Adam specialises in US and international capital markets transactions and has approximately 20 years experience advising issuers, underwriters and arrangers in connection with US, Euro and global offerings of debt and equity securities. The debt offerings that Adam advises on run the full spectrum from investment grade to high yield as well as structured products, comprise both stand-alone offerings and debt issuance programmes (such as medium-term note and commercial paper programmes) and include all manner of offerings, from SEC registration to Rule 144A and Regulation S exempt to traditional private placements. He also advises a number of non-US companies in relation to on-going SEC and other public reporting. In addition, he has extensive experience in other types of capital markets and other corporate finance transactions, particularly tender and exchange offers and bridge financing.

Person.Experience: Peter has extensive experience in the areas of general banking law, corporate lending, restructuring and insolvency law, as well as property financing. He heads the German Real Estate Group. Before joining Allen & Overy in 2000 he worked for more than 10 years in various roles for a major German banking group in Berlin, Luxembourg, Frankfurt and Cologne.

Person.Experience: Whether it is a strategic employment issue, a highly sensitive crisis or risk management problem, or complicated litigation, Karen Seward is the person to know. Her expertise ranges from boardroom business to social media challenges in the workplace. She is highly regarded by her peers and clients, which span financial institutions, global corporates, blue chip multinationals and law firms. Chambers UK 2013 comments that she “is ‘fantastic in combat’, ‘tough, commercial and client focused’,” and she was named by Legal Business as the top employment lawyer to call in a crisis in 2008. Last year Chambers 2012 observed that “Karen is recognised in the market for her pragmatic approach and is said to be an ‘excellent strategist’ and a ‘person you go to to get results’.”

Jaya is a PSL Counsel and Head of the London Corporate Know-How Team. She has extensive experience of public and private M&A and corporate advisory work. Jaya has special expertise in public takeovers, often performing an advisory role on these types of transactions and on other complex instructions.
She also frequently advises clients on the latest developments in her specialist areas and on the impacts for them. Jaya is a member of Allen & Overy's Corporate Opinions Committee and is also a member of a number of Law Society working parties including those on takeovers, corporate governance, market abuse and narrative reporting. She is a regular speaker at conferences and other training events and contributes to various legal publications. Jaya is qualified in Scotland and England and Wales.
Person.Publications: Recent presentations given September 2007 Institute of Chartered Secretaries and Administrators: The new rules on directors' duties, derivative claims and certain other miscellaneous rules (Part 1 & 2). 2007 - 2008 ICSA: Companies Act 2006: directors' duties and derivative claims. June 2009 ICSA: Implications of the Companies Act 2006 for company directors. September 2010 ICSA: The UK Stewardship Code. March 2011 The Law Society: The Role of the Director. Recent articles published 2006 Practical Law Company Journal: Takeovers Directive: a new era for takeover regulation in the UK. 2007 Practical Law Company Journal: Companies Act 2006 and AGMs: food for thought. Practical Law Company Journal: Takeovers Directive: a second bite at the cherry. Practical Law Company Journal: Companies Act 2006: changes ahead for the business review. 2008 Practical Law Company Journal: Financial assistance: life after the whitewash. 2010 Practical Law Company Journal: New UK codes: corporate governance takes centre stage. 2011 International Financial Law Review: Evolution, not revolution. (Takeovers) 2012 ICSA: Buyer Beware.

Person.Experience: Patrick specialises in international and corporate tax law. He advises clients on the tax aspects of private equity transactions and international real estate investments, as well as the structuring of regulated and unregulated investment funds. He also has extensive experience in securitisations, structured finance and capital markets. He has more than 10 years of experience working in these areas. Patrick regularly publishes articles on tax topics and is a member of the editorial board of Kluwer's Luxembourg magazine ACE (accountancy, tax, audit and corporate law). Patrick is a member of the private equity working group within the Association of the Luxembourg Fund Industry (ALFI), a member of the executive committee and the co-chairman of the tax committee of the Luxembourg Private Equity & Venture Capital Association (LPEA) as well as a founding member and former President of Young IFA (International Fiscal Association) Luxembourg. Patrick taught corporate tax law at the University of Luxembourg between 2003 and 2006.
Person.Publications: "Les commandites en droit luxembourgeois", Limited Partnership Book, LPEA and Larcier, September 2013 (co-author) "Finance islamique: Le traitement fiscal des Murabaha et Sukuk au Luxembourg", ACE Magazine, December 2010 (co-author) "Real Estate Murabaha Structures in Luxembourg", European Taxation, November 2010 (co-author) "Is there a permanent establishment?", report for the IFA Congress in Vancouver, Cahiers de droit fiscal international, 2009 (co-author) "Résidence fiscale et substance, Droit fiscal luxembourgeois", Livre jubilaire de l'IFA Luxembourg, 2008 (co-author) "Income from French Real Estate Taxable in Luxembourg Court Rules', Tax Notes International, Volume 46, Number 9, 2007 "Chronique de jurisprudence fiscale luxembourgeoise' and 'L'arrêt de la CJCE dans l'affaire Cadbury Schweppes, Commentaire", Bulletin Droit & Banque n° 39, 2007 (co-author) "L'impact de l'arrêt Abbey National sur l'industrie des fonds d'investissement luxembourgeoise", Bulletin Droit & Banque n°38, 2006 (co-author) "Réflexions sur la notion de domicile fiscal - La résidence fiscale des sociétés de capitaux", Annales du droit luxembourgeois, Volume 13, Editions Bruylant, 2004

Person.Experience: Gordon specialises in private equity. He has extensive experience of advising a wide range of clients on numerous cross border and domestic buy-outs and exits. Regular clients include Apax Partners, Exponent Private Equity and OMERS Private Equity. Gordon has been recognised in Legal 500 for Private Equity and praised for his excellent client skills.

Vimal is a tax partner and co-head of the UK tax practice. He advises on corporate tax generally with an emphasis on finance related tax including structured financing, regulatory capital, securitisation and the taxation of financial instruments. Vimal Tilakapala is praised for his ability to provide "advice which is always commercial and sensible, clear and robust." Sources say that "he has a good understanding of our risk appetite and will reflect that in his views." Chambers UK 2014 Sources say he is "very approachable, personable and deals with all matters in a timely basis." Chambers UK 2013 "Clients are quick to voice their support of Vimal Tilakapala's impressive reputation". Chambers UK 2012

Hans-Christoph has broad experience in domestic and cross-border M&A and equity capital markets transactions and mainly advises on stock corporation, transformation, takeover and capital markets law. He has published widely on corporate and capital markets law and is a member of the German Bar Association's standing committee on commercial law.

Person.Experience: Manunya specialises in corporate and capital market practices. Her experience includes m ergers and acquisitions, securities and exchange law (SEC/SET). She has extensive experience in public companies and securities and exchange laws and advised various Thai public companies in connection with their listing on the Stock Exchange of Thailand. She was on the team that carried out legal due diligence on a major telecoms M&A transaction; and advised Bangkok Dusit Medical Services Pcl on its acquisition of stake in Prasit Patana (the operator of three Phyathai hospitals) and on its merger with Samitivej Hospital; leaded in advising Grand Canal Land PCL on its backdoor listing on the SET.

James is head of the Central European English law banking and finance group. He has experience in a wide range of banking and finance transactions including syndicated lending, leveraged finance and project finance. He regularly acts for banks and borrowers. James also has experience in real estate securitisation transactions. He previously worked in the London and Amsterdam offices. James was part of the team which was awarded "Hungarian Law Firm of the Year" by IFLR 2011 and has been named as a "rising star" by IFLR.

Andrew is a counsel leading the arbitration practice in Allen & Overy's Singapore office. He specialises in international arbitration, and his experience includes both commercial arbitration and investment treaty arbitration. He also has experience of litigation before English and other courts, including anti-suit injunctions in support of arbitration. Andrew has acted in arbitrations held under a wide variety of rules (ICC, LCIA, SIAC, SCC, AAA, Swiss Rules, UNCITRAL, ICSID), in London, Singapore, Stockholm, The Hague, Washington DC and Zurich. His experience includes acting for clients in Asia, Europe and South America across a variety of business sectors, including finance, energy, defence, utilities, steel, manufacturing, brewing and media. Andrew's recent experience includes acting for banks in claims against Indian counterparties under ISDA Master Agreements; acting for a consortium of industrial companies in a claim relating to the termination of a long-term contract; and a dispute against an Asian state concerning oil and gas production sharing contracts. In 2010, Andrew was appointed by the European Commission to its Group of Experts providing advice on arbitration and the reform of the Brussels I Regulation. He holds a Diploma in International Commercial Arbitration (with Distinction) and has previously undertaken a secondment with the LCIA casework team. Andrew is one of the co-chairs of ASA's (Swiss Arbitration Association) below 40 group, a member of the Chartered Institute of Arbitrators and a member of the LCIA's Young International Arbitration Group. He is a solicitor admitted in England and Wales.

"TMM Division Maritima SA de CV v. Pacific Richfield Marine Pte Ltd [2013] SGHC 186", Commentary Article, Mealey’s International Arbitration Reporter, October 2013 "Casenote: AJU v AJT – Singapore Court of Appeal clarifies scope of public policy review of arbitral awards", 2011, Mealey's International Arbitration Report, Vol. 26, No.11, Andrew Pullen and Rick Gal, 2011 "The rise of arbitration in financial transactions: key issues for users and practitioners", Newsletter of the International Bar Association Legal Practice Division, Vol 16 No 2 September 2011, pg 36 - 39, Andrew Pullen and Hi Chong (Sylvia) Ko, 2011 The International Arbitration Review, Law Business Research Ltd, Jagusch, S. and Pullen, A., Chapter 7: England & Wales, in Carter, J.H. 'The Reform of the Brussels Regulation: A Crossroad for arbitration in Europe', published on Practicallaw.com, Pullen, A., 2009
"A confused industry," International Financial Law Review (May 2011), with Vinod Aravind.

Person.Experience: Dr Artur Nowacki specialises in corporate and commercial law. He advises on a wide range of corporate and capital markets transactions, including acquisitions of shares and enterprises, privatisation schemes, IPOs, public tenders as well as joint ventures. Artur is also an Assistant Law Professor at the Commercial Law Department of the Law Faculty of the Warsaw University, where since 2001 he has been lecturing corporate and commercial law both on the LL.M. and post-LL.M. courses.

Karen, a solicitor qualified in English and Scots law, joined Allen & Overy LLP in 2000 as an associate in the Frankfurt office. She has a wide range of experience in banking transactions, including syndicated lending,leveraged finance and restructuring, and is fluent in German.

Silvie has twelve years of experience in cross-border and domestic banking and finance law. She advises a number of large banks and borrowers on a variety of matters on a regular basis, including in the area of syndicated, club and bilateral corporate loans and acquisition, export, real estate and project financings, as well as advising on debt capital markets issues and in relation to structured products.

Renátus heads the Banking and Finance practice in Bratislava. He specialises in advising domestic and foreign financial institutions on bankruptcy and restructuring, corporate finance, acquisition finance, project finance and real estate finance transactions. Renátus has participated in the preparation of key legislation on restructuring, bankruptcy and collateral in Slovakia. "Renátus Kollár has very intensive understanding for banks and the lender's side in general." IFLR1000 2012

Robert has advised a large number of clients (including arrangers, facility agents, security agents, lenders, borrowers, shareholders, sponsors and guarantors) in a wide range of cross-border and domestic banking and finance transactions, in particular in the area of syndicated, club and bilateral corporate loans and acquisition, export, real estate and project financings. Robert David is praised by sources for his finance-focused practice. Commentators say “he can provide a very good insight into financing transactions“, and is “a bright, very intelligent and technically adept lawyer“. Chambers Europe 2012

Person.Publications: Constitutional Infirmities of the Harbor Maintenance Tax on Exports, U.S. ShoeCorp. v. The United States', 50 The Tax Lawyer 419, 1997.

Person.Experience: Sigrid specialises in restructuring and workouts. Sigrid has represented companies, including private equity investors, and financial institutions in a wide range of domestic and cross border corporate and multi-bank debt restructurings. She also has particular expertise in corporate finance, secured lending, (financial) collateral arrangements and distressed debt trading. Sigrid became partner in May 2012. On qualifications, she joined the firm's employment department in 2000, transferring to the banking department in 2002. Sigrid spent three years with Fortis Bank in Curacao where she worked as inhouse lawyer and relationship manager. Sigrid is a member of the International Association of Insolvency Lawyers (INSOL) and the Dutch Association of Insolvency Lawyers (INSOLAD). The 2012 edition of Legal 500 recommends Sigrid and describes her as "looks for a consensus but is tough when required". The 2012 edition of IFLR1000 recommends Sigrid as a Leading Lawyer and describes her: "Sigrid Jansen is "very pleasant to work with and very good.""

Person.Publications:
'Due diligence rapporten: plicht tot overleggen?' (Due diligence reports: duty to submit?), Vennootschap & Onderneming, November 2005.
'Twee uitspraken over de ontvankelijkheid van een vordering tot een vergoeding naar billijkheid ondanks een reeds toegekende vergoeding wegens ontbinding arbeidsovereenkomst op grond van artikel 7:685 BW' (Note to two court rulings about formal rules of proceedings), Tijdschrift Ondernemingsrecht 10, November 2002.
'Van de werkgever en de collega's van de arbeidsongeschikte werknemer mag in redelijke mate worden gevergd dat zij de arbeidsongeschikte werknemer in staat stellen passende arbeid te verrichten, (…)' (Note to court ruling about duties of employer and employees to assist a disabled employee), Tijdschrift Ondernemingsrecht 3, August 2002.
'Twee uitspraken over de arbeidsongeschikte directeur en de betekenis van de raadgevende stem van artikel 2:227.4 BW' (Note to two court rulings about a disabled managing director), Tijdschrift Ondernemingsrecht 16, December 2000.

Person.Experience: Jochem specialises in (EU) environmental law, spatial planning law and general administrative law. He advises and litigates for US, European and multi-national corporations on all aspects of environmental and spatial planning law. Jochem advises on environmental (operating) permit and zoning issues and has a broad experience in assisting his clients in permit application procedures and subsequent legal redress procedures. Recent experiences include various energy and industrial projects, including wind farms and petro-chemical industry sites. Besides, as a member of Allen & Overy's global REACH and WEEE & RoHS teams, Jochem has substantial experience advising on compliance matters affecting the chemicals and electronics industries. Whilst on secondment at Allen & Overy's New York office, Jochem teamed up with the U.S. Department of Commerce for a REACH roadshow. Jochem is an assistant-professor at the VU University (Vrije Universiteit) Amsterdam, lecturing environmental law, and holds a Ph.D in environmental law. He regularly publishes on environmental and spatial planning law, annotates environmental case-law for the Journal for Administrative Jurisprudence (Kluwer) and is a co-author for the Tekst & Commentaar on Environmental law (Kluwer). Jochem is a member of the Netherlands Association for Environmental Lawyers, the Netherlands Association for Environmental Law, the Netherlands Association for Building Law and the Netherlands Association for Public Law. In the latest edition of the Which Lawyer? section of PLC’s Environment handbook, he is recognised for his environmental law work.

Xenia joined Allen & Overy in 2001 and is a Counsel in our International Capital Markets practice. Her experience includes representing issuers or underwriters in international debt and equity offerings and advising on privatisations and cross-border mergers and acquisitions. She has been involved in a number of global security offerings and her experience includes: advising, among others, the underwriters in the offerings of two leading Greek mobile telephony operators, Panafon and Cosmote; the Hellenic Republic, Public Power Corporation and The Hellenic Postal Savings Bank on their respective rounds of privatisation and offering of shares; a number of the international debt and equity offerings of the National Bank of Greece, a number of security transactions for Emporiki, Piraeus Bank and Alpha Bank, including its €986 million rights offering as well as the first REIT IPO in Greece of Eurobank Properties. In addition, she has worked on security offerings for companies in France, Spain, Portugal, Italy and Sweden, including in France the privatisation of Air France and the initial public offerings of Canal +, Image, Riber and exchangeable bond issues by France Telecom. She has also worked on the various rounds of privatisation of Portugal Telecom, on the equity offerings of Portugal Telecom Multimedia and Jazztel, on a rights offering by Telefonica in Spain and on high yield issues by Tele 1 in Sweden. Xenia has also been involved in the registered debt offering by the Region of Lombardy in Italy.

Anne-Laurence advises French and international clients on all aspects of employment law. She has extensive experience advising in respect of restructuring projects and collective redundancy exercises. Anne-Laurence also specialises in individual and collective employment litigation.
Person.Publications: "L'exercice d'un mandat social en exécution d'un contrat de travail : un choix de politique de groupe", La Gazette du Palais, 12 May 2012, co-authored with Norbert Thomas

Person.Experience: Dumnern has broad corporate and litigation experience and is considered one of the leading experts on Thai bankruptcy, rehabilitation, Administrative Court and telecom law. He has advised on many major litigation claims for clients including Alphatec Electronics Public Company Limited, Nakornthai Strip Mill Public Company Limited, PricewaterhouseCoopers Group, Standard Chartered Bank (Thai) Public Company Limited, TPI Polene Public Company Limited, TT&T Public Company Limited and Total Access Communication Public Company Limited.
Person.Publications: Columnist on Business law of Krungthepthurakit since 1995 Securities Regulations The Act on Establishment of Administrative Courts and Administrative Court Procedure The Administrative Court Act The Thai Constitution and the Bankruptcy Act

Person.Experience: Dirk is the head of the Belgian competition law department. He specialises in Belgian and EU competition law as well as general EU law. He advises and assists clients in administrative and judicial procedures, both before national and European authorities and courts. Dirk has particular experience within the energy, media, chemical, retail and automobile sectors. He represents clients in cartel investigations conducted by both the Commission as well as the Belgian competition authority, and advises on merger control cases. Dirk is a member of the editorial board of Tijdschrift voor Belgische Mededinging (TBM) and a founding member of the Belgian Association of Competition Lawyers. Dirk has worked as a research assistant at the Institute for European Law of the KULeuven before serving as a Référendaire (legal secretary) in the General Court. He teaches Judicial Protection in the EU at the Vrije Universiteit Brussel and a yearly introductory course at the College of Europe in Bruges. Together with Koen Lenaerts, judge of the Court of Justice, he has written the leading treatise "Procedural law in the European Union" (Sweet & Maxwell, London).

Person.Experience: Christian advises and litigates on a broad range of employment and pension law matters. He has particular expertise and experience in the areas of workforce restructuring, the optimisation of employee benefits and occupational pensions, employment issues relating to business reorganisations (outsourcing and M&A), the employment of directors and executives, employee representation and (European) works councils, collective bargaining, multi-jurisdictional employment matters and employment discrimination. Christian is recommended by both Legal 500 and Chambers, who say that he has "great academic and practical knowledge about labour law" and describe him as "the guy to trust when things get complex. He can be contacted whenever and will provide the needed support."

Person.Experience: Fabian has extensive experience in corporate law, mergers and acquisitions, private equity, joint ventures and equity capital markets across all sectors, in particular insurance and reinsurance, financial institutions and media and telecom. He is a member of the Luxembourg, Brussels and New York Bars. Fabian regularly publishes articles and speaks at seminars on a broad range of topics, including recently on public takeover bids, directors’ duties and M&A trends. He chaired the IFE Seminar on M&A in Luxembourg in 2010 and 2011.
Person.Publications: He has published several articles and has been a speaker at many recent seminars, on a broad range of topics, including: 'Preserving the interest of companies and of their owners in estate planning', 'Holding companies as a controlling tool', 'From the letter of intent to the final sale and purchase agreement: What are the important legal aspects?' and 'Directive on Take-over bids: What changes should be expected'.

Person.Experience: Peter specialises in acquisition finance, secured transactions, restructuring and workouts, asset finance and international financial transactions, private equity, leveraged and management buyouts. He is author of the chapter 'Financing the Acquisition', in M&A in Belgium, published in 2001 by Kluwer Law International. Before joining the firm, he spent five years with Cleary, Gottlieb, Steen & Hamilton in New York and Brussels. Peter was named a Leading Individual in Chambers Europe in 2009, 2010 and 2011.

Author of the chapter 'Financing the Acquisition', in M&A in Belgium (W. Dejonghe and W. Van de Voorde, eds.), published in 2001 by Kluwer Law International.

Person.Experience: Joost specialises in litigation and complex contracts, and has a particular interest in energy and white-collar crime. He also deals with international trade and product liability, covering both dispute resolution and advisory work. In January 2008, Joost was appointed as one of the four members of Allen & Overy's Global Litigation Steering Committee, with responsibility for Continental Europe. In June 2010, he was elected as a member of the Council of the Brussels Bar. He heads Allen & Overy's Belgian energy practice and white collar & investigations practice. Joost is recommended by Chambers Europe 2010 as: 'Joost Everaert is sought after for his experience in handling complex contract law issues'.

He specialises in the contentious and international aspects of commercial litigation, including arbitration. He has a wide experience in acting for major players in the international construction industry and in the aviation industry. Werner is consistently recommended by Legal 500 and Chambers for litigation and arbitration.

Person.Experience: Daniel specialises in corporate and property law, real estate transaction including project development and financing transactions, mergers and acquisitions, joint ventures and mortgages. Many of his clients are major banks and investment funds. He features in Euromoney's Guide to the World's Leading Real Estate Lawyers and as a recommended real estate lawyer in the European Legal 500.

Geert is chairman of the Global IP Group and specialises in IP and ICT law. He conducts litigation, advises on non-litigious matters and assists in negotiating and drafting agreements and transactions. Geert has litigated landmark IP cases before the European, Benelux and Belgian courts and has co-ordinated several multi-jurisdiction conflicts. He is also a key member of our Life Sciences sector team. He is a former chairman of the Benelux Trademark Association and a former member of the Board of Directors of the International Trademark Association. Geert is the chairman of the Benelux Council for Intellectual Property (BCIP) which advises the Benelux Office for Intellectual Property (BOIP) on all aspects of IP legislation. He has also recently been appointed by the Belgian Federal Minister of the Economy to the Belgian Council for Intellectual Property. He has advised the World Intellectual Property Organisation (WIPO) on IP issues related to the Internet and is an accredited WIPO and ICC arbitrator. Geert chaired the Committee involved with reviewing the .be rules. Geert is consistently recommended by the directories as a leading IP/ICT and Life Sciences attorney. Who's Who Legal rates him among "the most highly regarded individuals" in his field. Chambers 2011 praises him as "one of the best and brightest IP lawyers in Belgium today who continues to impress with his intellectual rigour and top-notch negotiation skills". Moreover he is characterized as being "energetic and enthusiastic with a thoughtful attitude, fair and reasonable in his conclusions as to how to resolve complicated issues, understanding the risks to which clients are exposed and always finding the right solutions for them". In Legal 500 Geert is lauded for "his excellent understanding of legal issues, his 'can do' attitude, good negotiation skills and likeable personality".

Several articles on telecom, media, trademark and patent law and scientific contributions.

'Registrability of Community Trade Marks' 'Gyngell & Poulter, editors)

Person.Experience: Hans practises corporate law and has a broad experience in the full range of M&A transactions (public and private acuiqisitions and disposals, joint ventures). He was seconded to our London office in 2001.

Sylvia practises in areas including capital markets, banking and financial services and regulation. She advises on capital markets transactions and financial instruments, structured finance transactions, covered bonds, securitisations and trade receivables finance, regulation of banking activities and financial services, corporate reorganisations, corporate finance and bank lending.

Person.Experience: Tom has extensive court litigation and (national and international) arbitration experience. His commercial litigation practice covers a broad range of post M&A and contractual (including real estate related) disputes. Tom specialises in anti-trust damages actions and insurance litigation; he heads our cross-practice insurance sector team. Having a specific interest in the energy markets, Tom regularly advises clients on energy regulation, energy projects and energy disputes; he also lectures on energy contracts at the University of Leuven (KUL).

Person.Experience: Patrick is the head of the Belgian tax department. Patrick specialises in financial tax, M&A tax, incentives tax, tax risk management and tax dispute resolution. He is the author of a manual on financial tax. Chambers Europe 2012 mentions that the "brilliant" Patrick Smet stands out for his expertise in corporate and finance matters.

Filip is the head of the Belgian banking and finance practice and co-leads the Belgian projects group. He specialises in banking and finance law, in particular, transaction based financing, banking and finance regulations and debt capital markets. He advises on financial matters, including project and acquisition finance, corporate finance, public private partnership, trade finance, restructuring, financial instruments and banking (including secured and non-secured lending and syndicated lending), factoring and multi jurisdictional trade receivables financing and securitisation. Filip regularly lectures and publishes on various banking and finance topics. Filip is year on year mentioned in Legal 500, Chambers and IFLR 1000: New practice head Filip Tanghe has a 'service-oriented approach and broad network'- Legal 500, 2012 Filip Tanghe is extremely visible in the areas of PPP, project finance and corporate lending, but his practice ecompasses a wide range of matters - Chambers & Partners, 2012

Person.Experience: Inge specialises in the full range of law involving employment, employee benefits and incentives. She has published and lectured on various aspects of employment law and incentives, including restructuring, outsourcing, incentive schemes, discrimination and privacy issues, and multi-jurisdictional employment matters. Inge is an active member of our Global Benefits Group. She is a member of the Board of the Brussels "Labour Law Association" (a group comprising in-house counsel, practising lawyers, magistrates and judges, all specialising in employment law) and a member of the European Employment Lawyers Association (EELA).
Person.Publications: Het sociaal plan vervat in een CAO: belangrijkste voor- en nadelen voor de werkgever, HR World, HR Today, 2009. De managementvennootschap, reeks Fiscale Wenken, CED Samsom, 2000.

Person.Experience: Greet has experience in advising on financial transactions, including general corporate lending, acquisition finance, restructuring, real estate financing and multi-jurisdictional trade receivables financing. Greet has spent a one year secondment in our London Global Loans Department.

Udomsak's practice has involved a number of cases in relation to business laws including civil dispute, construction, labour, bankruptcy and rehabilitation, and insurance. He has advised on general business and contractual matters. He also has extensive experience in the arbitration process.

Eleanor Ley is a Senior Professional Support Lawyer in the International Capital Markets department, advising on general debt capital markets matters. Eleanor is involved in maintaining online services such as Allen & Overy's Prospective Directive and Transparency Directive websites and also has a focus on internal training. As an associate Eleanor gained experience in advising managers and issuers on a range of capital markets transactions including EMTN programmes, stand-alone bond issues, index-linked issues and other structured products. Eleanor is a fluent German speaker and spent two years in Allen & Overy's Frankfurt and Hamburg offices, which included six months in the German capital markets practice.

Vojtech specialises in corporate, M&A, projects and real estate law. He has advised on a number of major transactions including mergers, acquisitions, disposals and restructurings. His experience also covers all aspects of real estate sales and purchases, construction, property developments and commercial leases as well as all aspects of major energy projects. "Vojtech Pálinkáš makes a strong impression on clients, with one describing him as 'extremely knowledgeable – a tour de force attorney'." Chambers Europe 2012 "Sources point to senior associate Vojtech Pálinkáš's M&A prowess, solution-driven approach and ability to push deals forward." Chambers Europe 2013

Pascal works principally on securitisation, factoring, asset and structured finance law matters. He has experience in French ship tax leasing transactions, including in a restructuring context. Pascal also worked on the French aspects of aircraft ECA financings. He spent four months in secondment at the structured finance department of a major French bank (2006).

Tom works on a broad range of debt capital markets transactions, including standalone bonds, EMTN Programmes and liability management. He has acted for both lead managers and issuers in relation to bonds issued by financial institutions, corporates and sovereigns. Tom's practice has a particular emphasis on the raising of regulatory capital.

Christopher advises on all aspects of commercial real estate transactions, including investment property sales and purchases, the financing of property acquisitions and developments, and indirect investments, funds and structures. He has particular expertise in advising funders, investors and developers on real estate joint ventures, limited partnerships and unit trusts. Christopher has also acted for several major financial institutions on their relocation to new headquarters premises. In Chambers & Partners 2011 Christopher was described as an "intellectual heavyweight offering hands-on, sensible advice.” Legal 500 2011 says he is "extremely commercial and very clever."

David specialises in derivatives and structured finance transactions. He has advised banks on Lehmans and other recent crises, on the integration or disposal of derivatives businesses, the clearing of derivatives and on the consequences of counterparty credit rating downgrades on structured transactions. David has also advised on CPPI products, CDS products, hedge fund-linked products, repos, stock loans, equity financings, secured funding transactions and on hedging aspects to securitisations and project financings. He has advised on the interpretation of the credit and equity derivatives definitions and has been a member of various ISDA working group committees, including with respect to fund derivatives, rating agency criteria applicable to securitisation hedging and a "master master"set-off agreement for use in clearing. David has advised leading financial institutions on their Eurozone crisis contingency planning. David devised Default Management, an on-line tool which helps manage major counterparty defaults, and OpinionNet, an on-line tool for the delivery of netting opinions. These were ranked "highly commended" and "commended" (respectively) in the FT Innovative Lawyers Awards. He was also picked as a "Rising Star" of up-and-coming executives under 40 in finance by Financial News, a Dow Jones publication and is ranked by leading legal publications.

Matt advises financial institutions, investment banks and other clients regarding a wide range of private and regulatory disputes. Matt joined Allen & Overy in March 2003 and was seconded to Allen & Overy's Hong Kong office from 2006-2009 where he gained local qualification. He was subsequently seconded to a major investment bank in London where he gained particular experience dealing with regulatory investigations. In September 2012 Matt transferred to Allen & Overy's Hong Kong office to join the litigation and contentious regulatory team there. Matt advises clients in respect of contentious regulatory investigations and private causes of action. In the regulatory space, he has particular experience advising clients in the context of potential cross border market abuse, systems and controls concerns and self reporting obligations. Outside of the regulatory sphere, Matt has particular experience in advising clients in the context of disputes arising from derivative, syndicated loan and asset management complaints. Matt also has extensive trial experience, having acted among other matters for six former non-executive directors of Equitable Life in defending one of the largest claims ever brought before the Commercial Court.

Person.Experience: Franz advises on a broad range of capital markets transactions, with a focus on structured finance and products. His structured finance practice covers CDOs and CLOs (whether cash, synthetic or hybrid, and across all asset classes) and the establishment and use of repackaging and collateralised funding platforms, whilst his structured products experience extends to credit, fund and equity-linked products and other derivative securities. He advises on bespoke funding, liquidity and regulatory capital structures involving both securitisation and derivatives technology. In the CLO market, Franz has advised on the establishment of CLOs managed by Apollo, GSO Blackstone, Cohen & Co, Santander, Barclays, Sumitomo Mitsui, Och-Ziff, Halcyon, Taberna, Credit Suisse Asset Management, Calyon, WestLB, Deutsche Asset Management, Invesco and Caja Madrid. Franz also advised on the establishment of collateralised funding platforms for each of Morgan Stanley, Barclays and RBS and advised on the StatECA ECA-backed funding platform for Barclays, the DanFin sovereign-backed repackaging platform for BoA Merrill Lynch, and a number of funding CLOs including Olimpo, Heta Funding, Setter, Somerset and QVS. Franz is listed as a leading lawyer in Chambers & Partners for both Securitisation and Structured Finance & Derivatives.
Person.Publications: A number of articles and contributed to legal and industry publications in the structured capital markets field.

Person.Experience: Tim advises on deals across a broad range of structured finance work both in the bank and bond markets, with a particular emphasis on infrastructure, project bonds, Islamic finance, whole business structures and CLOs of infrastructure/asset-backed loans. His infrastructure experience includes deals in the energy, defence, accommodation, healthcare and transport sectors. He has also advised on auto securitisations, covered bonds and residential and commercial mortgage structured financings. Tim has been recognised as a leading lawyer by Chambers UK 2011.

Francesca is specialised in advising on the legal aspects of financial and insurance products, including contentious matters. She acts as counsel for a number of leading Italian insurance companies. Her main areas of practise include drafting prospectuses and relevant insurance policies relating to Ramo I, Ramo III and Ramo V life insurance products; structuring transactions and/or products in connection with the issue of life insurance policies; advising on day to day legal and regulatory issues regarding insurance companies and their businesses; and liaising with the competent authorities such as CONSOB and IVASS. Francesca also has significant experience in the area of structured finance, both the national and international markets, and in derivatives litigation involving Italian territorial and local entities.

Dave has significant experience in domestic and international tax planning, corporate mergers and acquisitions, private equity transactions, domestic and international joint ventures and global capital markets transactions. He has advised on the U.S. federal income tax aspects of structuring and implementing: global mergers and acquisitions, spin-offs, divestitures, restructurings and bankruptcies, private equity and real estate fund formations and investments, global security offerings, asset securitizations and cross-border financing. He also has significant experience advising on general tax aspects of financial instruments and derivatives and in advising on global tax planning and cross-border structural analyses.

Andrew is Co-Head of the Global Banking Practice. He has extensive experience in a wide range of banking and finance transactions. His broad experience includes project finance, leveraged and investment grade finance, structured finance, workouts, restructurings and distressed debt transactions. He has advised on major transactions worldwide including many of the emerging markets. He was managing partner of Allen & Overy's Singapore office from 2002 to 2004.

Marianne specialises in corporate law, with a focus on private and public cross-border mergers & acquistions. Previously, Marianne has worked in the Real Estate practice group, in the field of civil property law and construction law. Her experience includes advising on and drafting of concession and PPP contracts. Furthermore, she has worked in the Employment practice group and has extensive experience in advising and litigating on all aspects in this area. She graduated from the University of Utrecht end of 2000 and completed the prestigious postgraduate Grotius Academy on Mergers & Acquisitions in 2009 (cum laude). In March 2001 she joined at Allen & Overy.

Iñigo has over 20 years experience advising on capital markets transactions, including debt and equity, and in corporate finance and corporate transactions, specially in cross-border mergers & acquisitions and in numerous public take-overs. He has taken part in some of the largest transactions arranged in Spain over the last years in these areas. He is a professor of Corporate Law at Universidad Complutense de Madrid and is author of various research publications. Iñigo is consistently recommended in the major legal directories such as Chambers & Partners, Legal 500, IFLR 1000 and Best Lawyers.

Person.Experience: Somporn has extensive experience working on corporate, acquisition matters, foreign investment and listing the securities in the Stock of Exchange of Thailand for both Thai and foreign corporations including advising on the due diligence and execution. She has extensive experience in various joint ventures for both private and public companies, and has particular expertise forign business law, investment law and company law.

Richard Kim is a corporate partner in Allen & Overy's Shanghai office. Richard is the Head of our China Real Estate Practice and also a member of our China Financial Institutions Group. He has extensive experience advising leading financial institutions, private equity houses and corporate clients on cross-border mergers and acquisitions, real estate investments, private equity investments, corporate restructurings, and equity and debt capital market transactions. He is qualified in New South Wales, Australia, and England and Wales. Richard is cited as a leading lawyer in The Legal 500 2013 Edition in both corporate and real estate categories.

Helge has wide experience advising on a range of international commercial transactions, mergers and acquisitions, venture capital, joint ventures, MBOs and international corporate restructuring. He is Head of the Corporate Practice in Germany.

Person.Experience: Karine has a wide range of corporate law experience and advises on mergers and acquisitions and related matters, joint ventures and refinancing, involving both domestic and international companies, and in particular US, British, German and Dutch groups. Her industry expertise focuses notably on Financial Institutions, media and healthcare. She also has experience in litigation matters before the labour, commercial and civil French courts. IFLR 1000 ranks Karine in Mergers & Acquisitions in its 2013 edition.

Paul specialises in employee equity incentives and executive remuneration. He acts for companies (both publicly listed and private) on all aspects of employee equity incentives, including design, the tax and cost implications, shareholder communication, corporate governance and best practice. Paul has extensive corporate transactional experience and advises on the share plan issue arising from IPOs, mergers and acquisitions. He also deals with high level recruitment and terminations. He has specialised in this area for over 22 years, and has acted for various companies extending their employee share plans internationally. Paul also advises on the establishment, operation and tax implications of limited liability partnerships. Paul has recently been advising extensively on the impact of the disguised remuneration legislation on companies' deferred remuneration/offshore trust arrangements. He is a regular speaker at conferences and contributes to publications on employee share incentives. He is a member of the Share Schemes Lawyers Group. Paul McCarthy "applies real-world answers," "always responds and has great client awareness." Chambers UK 2014 Paul McCarthy is "extremely knowledgeable with a huge amount of experience” – UK Legal 500 2012

Sylvie specialises in employee share incentives and executive remuneration. She acts for companies (both publicly listed and private) on all aspects of employee share incentives, including the design aspects, shareholder communication and corporate governance aspects of these arrangements, and their tax and cost implications. She has wide experience of advising in connection with flotations, mergers and acquisitions and has acted for UK and non-UK companies extending their employee share plans internationally. She is a regular speaker at conferences and has published various articles on employee share incentives. She is a member of the Share Schemes Lawyers Group and a Board member, PLC Share Schemes and Incentives Service. “Sylvie Watts has a "huge level of expertise" and advises on a full range of incentives matters including transactional, tax and implementation considerations” – Chambers UK 2014 Sylvie Watts "makes herself available" and clients praise her "good turnaround times." UK Legal 500 2012

Ken is Head of the U.S. restructuring group. He concentrates on multi-jurisdictional business reorganizations and financial restructurings, including chapter 11 proceedings, cross border proceedings under chapter 15 of the U.S. Bankruptcy Code and out-of-court restructurings. In addition, Ken regularly advises clients on insurance and reinsurance matters and the insolvency aspects of derivative products, acquisitions, and corporate, project and structured financings. Ken is listed in Chambers USA as a notable practitioner and in Chambers Canada as an Expert Based Abroad - the only person to have been ranked in the category in 2012.

Person.Experience: Florence has significant experience in the areas of French and European competition law (mergers, anti-trust and state aid issues) and has developed a specific expertise in distribution law matters. She regularly assists companies with their French, EU and multi-jurisdictional merger notifications. She also represents companies in competition law litigations before Competition authorities and national courts (cartel investigations, abuse of dominance, State aid and private enforcement). She has developed a specific expertise in the energy and financial sectors as well as in the consumer goods sectors and has been advising various operators in these areas. Florence regularly advises French and international companies such as, inter alia, Adisseo, Caisse des Dépôts et Consignations, Expedia, Fox Pathé Europa, Procter & Gamble, Société Générale, Symantec and Vicat.

Person.Experience: Conrad specialises in all aspects of infrastructure and utility financings and acquisitions. He has significant experience advising on regulated utilities and project financings and has advised in a number of energy and infrastructure sectors.

Bianca, a German Rechtsanwältin, joined the Frankfurt banking and finance department of Allen & Overy LLP in 2010. Before joining Allen & Overy, Bianca worked for several years in major international law firms in the banking & finance sector. Bianca has gained wide experience in national and international acquisition finance, leveraged finance, investment grade and general corporate finance as well as ship finance. Bianca advises national and international credit institutions as well as borrowers and private equity investors.

Person.Experience: Richard is an English and Hong Kong qualified lawyer and joined the Hong Kong office of Allen & Overy in 2004. Richard advises banks, borrowers and insolvency practitioners on all aspects of financial restructurings and non-litigious aspects of formal insolvency proceedings. Recent market-leading experience includes advising company side on the restructuring of a worldwide supplier to the construction industry and a major international shipping group, advising the special PPP administrators of Metronet and advising the steering committee of creditors on the restructuring of Dubai World and the ongoing restructuring of a number of significant South East Asian entities.

Sally advises on a large number of financing transactions, including covered bonds, RMBS (including master trust), various CMBS (including conduit financings), auto-financings (retail, including conditional sale, leasing and dealer floorplan), whole business securitisations and trade receivables. She has experience of UK, European (including various pan-European securitisations) and international transactions. Relevant experience
Establishment of and issuance under numerous covered bond programmes in the UK including Bank of Scotland, Coventry, Lloyds, Barclays, RBS, HSBC, Skipton, Yorkshire, Britannia, Co-Op, Chelsea, Principality and Norwich & Peterborough.
Westpac Banking Corporation on the establishment of its USD20bn global covered bond programme and the first issuance there under.
Brass No. 1, No. 2 and No. 3 plc, Accord and Yorkshire Building Society on each stand-alone residential mortgage-backed securitisation of loans originated by Accord.
OneSavings Bank on a residential mortgage-backed securitisation of a pool of acquired mortgages which had been originated by a number of different entities. The mortgage-backed notes were issued by Rochester Financing No.1 plc. This was OneSavings Bank's debut securitisation.
Precise Mortgages on its debut RMBS securitisation transaction.
Advised on numerous private auto loan transactions funded via ABCP conduits including a recent deal advising three conduit banks on a securitisation of UK auto hire purchase and conditional sale receivables.
LeasePlan (Bumper 3 and 5) on an innovative securitisation of a UK portfolio of lease receivables and residual value claims originated by LeasePlan UK Limited and certain associated companies.
HSBC as arranger of Turquoise Card Backed Securities plc, a USD10bn securitisation of HSBC Bank plc's credit card portfolio. The securitisation used a master trust structure and was the first credit card securitisation undertaken by HSBC.
Santander Auto on a securitisation of UK hire purchase auto receivables.

Chris advises on bank taxation, tax related financing transactions (including securitisations and capital market issues) and the taxation aspects of corporate transactions (including mergers, acquisitions, joint ventures and reconstructions).' Joe has extensive experience with a broad range of secured and unsecured financing structures utilized in connection with corporate finance and big ticket asset finance (including aircraft, rail cars, satellites, vessels, offshore drilling rigs, containers, equipment and infrastructure assets). He regularly represents hedge funds, multi-lateral and government agencies, banks, airlines, manufacturers, leasing companies and other corporate clients, providing him with an invaluable 360° perspective of transactional issues. Joe is a true cross border transaction specialist, having closed transactions involving, in the aggregate, parties based in more than 70 different jurisdictions.

Stephen has experience in a wide range of commercial and corporate finance transactions, including mergers and acquisitions, joint ventures, private equity transactions and equity issues. He frequently advises on cross-border as well as UK-based transactions and has also spent 18 months on secondment to Allen & Overy's Tokyo office. Stephen also has particular expertise relating to transactions involving financial institutions and transactions involving partnerships and LLPs. Regular clients include BAE Systems, RSA, Thames River Capital, Mitsubishi Corporation and Mitsui & Co. Stephen is recommended in Chambers and Partners for partnership work and in Legal 500 for corporate and regulatory insurance work.

Person.Experience: Eric is head of the firm's U.S. M&A practice. He is also a member of the firm's Global Corporate Board. Eric specializes in public and private mergers and acquisitions. He is also experienced in negotiating joint ventures and strategic alliances. Eric is an Adjunct Professor of Law at Fordham Law School. He is a Life Fellow of the American Bar Foundation and a former member of the Association of the Bar of the City of New York's Mergers and Acquisitions Committee and the Association's Corporation Law Committee. Eric has been recognized as one of the top M&A lawyers in New York in Chambers USA since 2008: '''I would go to him with anything,' say clients of Eric Shube, adding: 'On the technical front, he is one of the best I have ever worked with, and has a low-key style, which is most effective'." In their 2014 edition, The Best Lawyers in America recognized Eric as a leading M&A lawyer in New York. Eric was named Dealmaker of the Week by the American Lawyer in August 2010 for his work advising Novartis on its $52 billion acquisition of NYSE-listed Alcon, Inc.

Dr Oliver Seiler, LL.M. (Cornell University) and a German Rechtsanwalt, is a partner in Allen & Overy LLP. Person.Experience: Elizabeth Baker is counsel in the Derivatives and Structured Finance group and her practice includes debt capital markets, derivatives and structured finance. Elizabeth has worked on structured note, warrant and certificate programmes, repackagings and a wide range of structured products, including credit, commodity, equity, index and fund-linked securities.

Angeline specialises in international arbitration and public law. She advises on both commercial arbitrations as well as those brought under investment treaties and has experience of arbitrations conducted under the UNCITRAL, LCIA, ICC and ICSID rules. Angeline has particular expertise in court proceedings related to arbitration disputes including anti-suit injunctions and the enforcement of arbitral awards. Angeline advises on a wide range of public law issues and has advised on judicial review and constitutional challenges before the English courts as well as courts elsewhere in the Commonwealth, including the English Supreme Court, the Privy Council and the Caribbean Court of Justice. She has advised on a number of interventions in the English Supreme Court including the recent ICC intervention in Jivraj v Hashwani. She also acted as counsel in the 2009 landmark case in the Privy Council on implied terms in contracts (Attorney General of Belize v Belize Telecom Limited). Recent market recognition "The "really excellent" Angeline Welsh continues to attract praise for her expertise in international arbitration, and offers experience in both advising and advocating under a range of arbitral rules. She has a well-respected practice focusing on disputes against states."
