According to one appreciative client: "She has a very practical approach to things. She is straight to the point and that is why she is so successful."" Simon has experience of a wide range of cross-border public and private M&A transactions, joint ventures, corporate reorganisations and equity capital markets transactions. Simon served as interim General Counsel at News International (now News UK) from August 2011 to April 2012. He also completed a secondment at Barclays in 2005 as part of the bank's corporate legal team, where he worked on the integration of the bank's African business with Absa Bank. Simon is a member of the firm's TMT Steering Group.

Grant is Senior Partner of Allen & Overy in Australia and brings a depth of experience (domestically and internationally), commerciality and client service. He has extensive experience in the Asia Pacific region with particular expertise in leveraged finance, project and infrastructure financing, public private partnerships, syndicated financing, leveraged finance and privatisations. Grant is also experienced in advising private equity investors investing into Australia. Grant has been voted by peers as one of Australia's Best Lawyers in each year 2008 to 2012 in Banking & Finance and Project Finance & Development. Chambers Global notes “he is very easy to work with” and Chambers Asia Pacific 2012 ranks Grant in the area of corporate finance: "sources say 'he is commercial and creative, looks after the interests of clients, has strong leadership skills and understands the global perspectives'." The Asia Pacific Legal 500 2012 recommends Grant and the "excellent" banking and finance team, which is "commended generally for its 'quality advice and depth of market knowledge'."Grant is recognised as a leading Banking, Lending and Borrowers lawyer by IFLR 1000 2010. PLC Which Lawyer? 2010 endorses Grant as a leading lawyer in the Banking and Finance and the Project Finance categories.

Francesco focuses on banking, capital market, derivatives, structured finance, M&A and LBO transactions, advising on VAT, financial and corporate tax, inbound/outbound international tax matters. He is a qualified tax lawyer with a diversified academic and professional background in industrial and finance tax matters: in-house lawyer, accounting firms, tax boutiques and voluntary lecturer at Rome University. He has published various articles and has lectured on international tax topics. Francesco, as Partner of the Italian tax department, contributes to Allen & Overy's Global Pension Group, consisting of over 60 lawyers across the firm's international offices. Francesco has worked on a number of cross-border transactions and is often involved in transactions concerning retirement benefit liabilities and insurance policies. Person.Experience: Ellen Braun, LL.M. (UC Berkeley), is a German Rechtsanwältin and head of our German antitrust practice. She specialises in EU and German competition law. She has an active practice representing clients in competition proceedings before the EU Commission, the German Federal Cartel Office and the courts. Her broad practice covers the full breadth of antitrust law including advising on long-term competition and antitrust strategies; complex merger control cases including worldwide multiple filings; structuring of cooperation, joint venture and distribution agreements; compliance advice, audits and design of compliance programs; EU and German cartel investigations including leniency applications; as well as actioning and defending private enforcement cases in court. Her long-standing client relationships encompass all industry sectors, with a particular focus on food, consumer products, general industry, construction, infrastructure and energy, media and entertainment, as well as financial services. Recent highlights include advising Bell AG in two cartel investigations; a German national brewery in a cartel and a vertical price fixing investigation; Cheminova in its design and implementation of a global antitrust compliance management system; Colfax Corporation regarding a new pricing model in one of its businesses; CTS Eventim AG in several merger control cases including an attempt by the competition authority to enforce a de-merger; several clients, among them Bilfinger Berger SE, H.C. Starck, Gruner + Jahr AG, and Pubbles (both from Bertelsmann Group), in cooperation and joint venture arrangements; Novo A/S in EU and German merger control matters; a number of clients, among them Bergmann Automotive, Harke Pharma, Samsung Germany, and Villeroy & Boch AG, in antitrust aspects of their distribution agreements; Rosneft in several EU and German merger control matters; P&G (Purity) and Scania (Trucks) on the German aspects of EU cartel investigations; TTS Tooltechnic Systems in a price maintenance investigation; Villeroy & Boch AG in a German leniency application (Tableware) and an EU cartel investigation (Bathroom); an international consumer products company on recourse claims against its board members based on antitrust infringements; a global consumer electronics company in several compliance audits and in a defense against a customer complaint based on alleged vertical price fixing; several clients, among them Rexam and WAS , in refusal to supply and private damage claims before the civil courts. Ellen is recognised by all the principal legal directories, including Chambers Europe 2012 who say she "regularly demonstrates the ability and willingness to go the extra mile." She regularly speaks and publishes on EU and German antitrust law issues. Her publications include the chapters on horizontal agreements under EU law, on horizontal and vertical agreements under German law, and on energy antitrust law and competitor co-operation, all in the Langen/Bunte, the leading German language commentary on EU and German antitrust law. She holds an LLM from UC Berkeley and a doctorate in antitrust law from the University of Hamburg. She is also admitted to the New York Bar. She previously worked as an associate at a leading German antitrust practice. Ellen is German mother tongue and speaks English fluently as well as French. Allen & Overy's antitrust and competition team comprises over 100 specialists located across Asia Pacific, Europe and the United States. We advise corporates and financial institutions on their global antitrust policies, litigation and regulatory strategies and have acted on some of the most high-profile and complex cases in recent years.

He advises on all aspects of real estate investment projects, including the choice of vehicle, financing, complex lease negotiations and authorisation requirements.

Person.Experience: Jeroen specialises in international capital markets transactions, with an emphasis on structured finance transactions such as RMBS transactions, covered bonds and trade receivables securitisations. During 2010, Jeroen worked in the ICM department of Allen & Overy in London. He graduated from Leiden University, cum laude in 2000 and obtained a M.Jur. degree from Oxford University in 2001.

Ahmed specialises in outsourcing, IT and data protection. He leads the Paris TMT Group and is the head of the Allen & Overy Global Technology Group. He has developed renowned experience in a wide range of information technology and e-commerce matters –setting up of electronic trading platforms, system integration agreements, electronic banking, software licensing etc. He has also developed an expertise on multi-jurisdictional and off-shore outsourcing projects (ITO and BPO) including those for IT, telecom, finance & accounting, bank back office, CRM, and other business processes. Ahmed also regularly advises on data protection issues: data transfer, whistleblowing, compliance program, cross-border litigations involving data transfer, IT monitoring, BCR. His experience includes advising on strategic commercial transactions in the technology, energy, aerospace and pharmaceutical sectors. Sources note practice head Ahmed Baladi's ability to “understand complex and innovative projects very quickly, and to build a proposal that explores different legal areas but remains simple and clear.” CHAMBERS EUROPE 2012 – TMT: FRANCE Practice head Ahmed Baladi advises on strategic alliances and IT projects between financial institutions and technology suppliers. Person.Experience: Lydia specialises in all aspects of corporate tax, including M&A, corporate reorganisations and private equity tax. Arnondo has experience in a wide range of contentious matters including regulatory, criminal and internal investigations and disputes for financial institutions. Sara has a wide range of experience of advising corporates, financial institutions and funds on public and private mergers and acquisitions, both domestic and cross-border.

Christabel works in the Litigation Knowledge Management Team as a Professional Support Lawyer. The team is involved in knowledge management, training and business development, and provides tailored training to clients, current awareness bulletins and practical guidance on legal developments and trends. Christabel has a particular interest in conflicts of law and jurisdiction, privilege and procedural issues.
Prior to becoming a Professional Support Lawyer, Christabel advised on a wide range of banking and commercial disputes including a multi-million pound civil fraud claim relating to deposits made into accounts.

Gareth is an English qualified lawyer based in the corporate department of our Moscow office. He has broad experience in advising on a range of corporate matters including domestic and cross-border M&A, private equity investments, international and domestic joint ventures and reorganisations. He regularly advises leading international and Russian clients who are seeking to enter, expand or exit their operations in Russia and the CIS.

Kevin Young is a partner in the Structured and Asset Finance Group of the Banking department at Allen & Overy LLP.
Kevin has extensive experience in the offshore, shipping, aviation and equipment finance markets having acted for banks, financial institutions, export credit agencies, international oil companies, lessors, charterers, airlines and sponsors across a wide range of asset finance, construction and procurement transactions including on export credit backed financings, cashflow based limited recourse financings, offshore construction, chartering and procurement transactions, French tax lease financings, Japanese operating lease financings, Spanish operating lease financings, shipping company restructurings, manufacturer supported financings, PDP financings, portfolio sales and both long term and short term leasing, chartering and asset management arrangements.
Kevin is well regarded for his asset finance expertise and was recently listed as a ‘Rising Star’ in the Thomson Reuters Super Lawyers directory.

Banco Santander, S.A. Credit Industriel et Commercial and Norddeutsche Landesbank in relation to the Spanish operating lease financing of one of the offshore wind turbine installation vessels for Hochtief Solutions A.G. Barclays Bank, Bank of America Merrill Lynch and Lloyds Bank on the structured financing of a large portfolio of UK gas and electricity meters.

Helen Pattinson is a professional support lawyer for the Global Restructuring group, based in London. Anne is a Senior Tax Professional Support Lawyer, working on know how and training in the Corporate Tax Department. She is also actively involved in consultations with HMRCs on new tax legislation. Her experience was primarily in the field of corporate transactions such as corporate reorganisations and reconstructions, joint ventures, mergers and acquisitions and flotations. She also has wide experience of real estate transactions and banking transactions.

Robin specialises in domestic and cross-border acquisition finance (particularly leveraged acquisitions) as well as other forms of structured finance. He has also worked on a range of restructuring transactions. He acts for borrowers, sponsors and lenders. Kathleen has over a decade's experience in a variety of international banking and finance transactions, including debt restructuring, general lending, structured finance, pre-IPO financing, project finance, leveraged finance and acquisition finance. Having spent the last three years in Shanghai advising on some of China's largest financings, Kathleen is now spearheading Allen & Overy's China Desk in London, advising international companies, banks, funds and financial institutions in fulfulling their commercial strategies in China and advising major Chinese corporations and financial institutions in relation to their outbound investments. She is named in Chambers Asia-Pacific 2011 as an "up and coming" lawyer who is at the forefront of her generation. Kathleen is fluent in French and English and operates in three dialects of Chinese, including Mandarin, Cantonese and Hoisanese. She holds a Bachelor of Laws (LLB) from Université de Montréal and a Masters of Laws (LLM) with Merit from the London School of Economics and Political Science.

Pamela specializes in regulatory, civil and criminal litigation in the financial services area. Prior to joining Allen & Overy, Pamela was the founding Director of the Securities Arbitration Clinic at Fordham University School of Law. Previous to that position, she was a partner at Cadwalader, Wickersham & Taft. From 1982 to 1984, she served as the Chief of the Securities and Commodities Fraud Task Force in the United States Attorney's Office of the Southern District of New York. While there, she specialized in white collar criminal prosecutions, headed the unit in charge of prosecuting all securities and commodities cases, and coordinated criminal prosecutions with the Securities and Exchange Commission and the Commodity Futures Trading Commission. Pamela is recognized by Chambers USA as a top lawyer in litigation: "Pamela Chepiga is a highly regarded senior partner at the firm, and is noted for her expertise in both general commercial litigation and white-collar criminal investigations. Sources particularly highlight her 'very good and very creative' approach, and praise her as a 'forceful and zealous advocate.'" She is respected in the market and sources state that it is 'terrific working with her on a case.'" Pamela is also distinguished as a leading practitioner in the International Who's Who of Business Crime Defense Lawyers 2013 and was shortlisted as "Top U.S. Female Litigator of the Year" in the Chambers USA 2013 and 2012 Women in Law awards. Pamela has taught in trial advocacy programs at Harvard Law School, Hofstra Law School, Cardozo Law School and the New York City Corporation Counsel's Office. She has also lectured extensively on insider trading, white collar crime, and the RICO statute. Main Bio Jane Jiang is the head of the PRC regulatory group in Allen & Overy LLP, Beijing office. She qualified as a solicitor in England & Wales in 2002, and worked in London for three years with a focus on financing and derivative transactions. She joined the financial practice group at our Shanghai office in 2003 and moved to our HK office in 2004 to focus on derivatives and structured products. Jane relocated to our Beijing office in July 2007 to strengthen our China financial and regulatory practice. Jane specialises in a wide range of China-related legal and regulatory issues and is a trusted advisor for many first-tier domestic and international financial institutions. She maintains a strong relationship with the local financial regulators (including advising the central bank in China on Renminbi internationalisation) and has particular insight into the financial regulatory regime in China. Her advice is frequently sought at the structuring stage of complex financial transactions. She also providesstrategic advice on market access and platform building in China in financial services.She is a leading expert in the issues arising from the Qualified Foreign Institutional Investors (QFII) regime and Qualified Domestic Institutional Investors (QDII) regime and in the regulatory issues arising from China related cross-border debt capital markets transactions and has extensive experience in Panda bonds and Dim Sum bonds. Jane speaks fluent Mandarin, Shanghainese and English.

Sven advises domestic and International enterprises, investors and financial institutions on national and crossboarder M&A transactions as well as on complex restructuring matters and corporate questions. Sven regularly holds seminars about the questions of corporate law and insolvency, e.g. at the Bucerius Law School in Hamburg- Germany.
Person.Publications: Pruefer S., Seiler O. (2005) "Licht und Schatten der Ein-Euro-GmbH", Handelsblatt 23/03/2005

Person.Experience: Louise is a Senior Professional Support Lawyer in the Global Antitrust Group. Her responsibilities include managing the Group's know-how resources, providing current awareness briefings, and delivering training both internally and to clients. She is closely involved in the Group's business development activities. Louise has extensive experience of advising clients on how to comply with competition rules. She also regularly advises clients on complex behavioural antitrust issues such as distribution arrangements and cooperation agreements between competitors, as well as abuses of dominant position. Louise is currently the Assistant Editor of the Butterworth's Handbook on Competition Law (the "Purple Book") and on the Consulting Editorial Board for the LexisPSL online competition law guidance service.

Mark is an English-qualified lawyer who is an associate in Allen & Overy's São Paulo office, following four years' post-qualification experience as an associate in the Global Loans Group in the firm's London office. He has 3 years' further experience in the Brazilian market, and in UK market domestic and international financings; including commodities, trade and export prepayment financings, project financing, acquisition financings, demerger facilities, investment grade facilities, real estate financings and insurance facilities, acting for borrowers, sponsors and lenders. Mark is a native English speaker and fluent in Portuguese.

Ross Stewart is a consultant in Hong Kong derivatives and structured finance team, having previously spent a number of years in London. His practice covers a wide range of OTC and securitised derivatives transactions across asset classes including credit, equity, rates and FX. He has particular experience of repackaging transactions, CLOs, CDOs, structured equity solutions, CPPI transactions and a variety of OTC derivatives including CDS, total return swaps and deal contingent derivatives. Ross also advises on OTC derivatives clearing and regulatory reform as well as ISDA close-out procedures, collateral arrangements and netting opinions. Additionally, he is experienced in advising on complaints of mis-selling structured derivatives products and other derivatives disputes.

Romaric Lazerges heads the public and environmental law department in our Paris office. His expertise covers especially public contracts (PPP, concessions, public procurement), regulatory in the media, energy and telecom sectors. Romaric also advises his clients in high-profile legal proceedings before administrative courts and tribunals, including before the Conseil d’Etat and the Conseil constitutionnel, as well as before independent governmental agencies (such as the Conseil supérieur de l’audiovisuel, the Commission nationale informatique et libertés and the Autorité de regulation des communications électroniques). His clients are either public entities or related or either private partners involved, banks, sponsors and lenders. In addition to his activity, Romaric is a lecturer (maître de conferences) at Sciences Po Paris as well as one of the founding members of the Sciences Po Paris “public law club”, a think tank set up in 2010 and gathering academics, judges and practitioners.
Person.Publications: La résolution alternative des litiges dans les contrats de partenariat, l'AJDA - Noël Chahid-Nouraï and Romaric Lazerges Les institutions de la France, co-auteur, la documentation française, 2005

Person.Experience: Matthias regularly represents German and international corporates, financial sponsors and banks on domestic and cross-border mergers and acquisitions, including auction sales, bilateral transactions, public takeovers and joint ventures. He has a particular focus on private equity transactions and is a member of the German Private Equity group. Matthias also advises on corporate re-organisations as well as on corporate and securities law.

Jennifer is PSL Counsel in Allen & Overy’s International Capital Markets department. She focuses primarily on general debt capital markets matters and has a range of technical capital markets experience, including in relation to aspects of the EU Financial Services Action Plan, such as the Prospectus Directive. Jennifer is involved in various industry working groups on debt capital markets issues.

Jamie advises on a wide range of debt capital market issues, including emerging markets, regulatory capital, Islamic finance, liability management (namely exchange offers, tender offers and consent solicitations) and equity-linked transactions.

Thomas specialises in leveraged and acquisition finance and is experienced in combined loan and debt capital markets financings, advising both banks and sponsors/borrowers. He also benefits from his expertise in corporate, investment grade and take-over financings, acting for major banks and high profile corporate borrowers, as well as complex refinancings. He has been in Banking and Finance since 2003 including a temporary secondment to our London office.

Julien's main areas of expertise are structured finance (securitisation and covered bonds), restructuring and real estate finance. He has also been involved in a number of real estate restructuring transactions.

Person.Experience: Julian has experience in a wide range of banking and project finance work throughout the Middle East, much of which was gained during a two-year period spent with an international law firm in Saudi Arabia. Julian is widely considered to be the leading international lawyer practicing in Saudi Arabia. Julian reads, writes and speaks Arabic fluently and devotes most of his time to Saudi Arabian banking and projects work. Julian is ranked as a “Leading Individual” in Projects & Energy by Legal 500, 2011, Saudi Arabia. “Clients praise Johansen, one says ‘he has been very helpful in providing valuable insight in export financing and financing related issues’.” (IFLR1000, 2011, Saudi Arabia) “One of the most widely praised lawyers at the firm is Julian Johansen. He is singled out repeatedly by peers and is highlighted by clients equally.” (IFLR1000, 2011, Saudi Arabia) “Julian Johansen has earned the respect of peers and clients alike, who have ‘nothing but positive things to say’ about him.” (Chambers Global, 2011, Saudi Arabia) “The ‘very, very excellent’ Julian Johansen is another key member of the team. He is noted for his ability to build and maintain solid relationships in the region.” (Chambers Global, 2011, Saudi Arabia)

Giannis has specialised in pensions law since 1993. She joined Allen & Overy in 2004 and became a professional support lawyer in 2006.
As a fee earner, she undertook a wide range of work in the pensions field, everything from UK and cross-border transactions to scheme advisory work, deed and rules drafting, executive arrangements and Pensions Ombudsman complaints. With extensive international experience, she is a member of the Allen & Overy Global Pensions Group.
As a PSL Giannis analyses and writes briefings on current legal developments, acts as a technical consultant and provides training to, and marketing support for, her colleagues. Giannis is a member of the Legislative & Parliamentary Committee of the Association of Pension Lawyers.
Giannis has worked with: -Ericsson on its £1.2 billion acquisition of Telent/Marconi's telephony business worldwide, structured as an asset sale to leave the £2.4 billion UK pension fund with Telent -ICI Pension Fund on day-to-day advisory work
Person.Publications: Numerous eAlerts for Allen & Overy clients since 2006.

Person.Experience: Stefan, a German Rechtsanwalt, joined Allen & Overy LLP in 2004 after working with a leading German law firm and is counsel in our banking department. He gained broad experience in all aspects of debt financing and gained particular expertise in real estate, acquisition, leveraged and project financings as well as restructuring loans and granting of debts in stress scenarios. A substantial part of these transactions concerned major banks as well as private equity houses. He speaks and writes fluently in both German and English.

Matthew advises on a range of international capital markets transactions, from ECP, CD and MTN programmes to hybrid capital issues. He has been involved in debt securities offerings ranging from senior and subordinated issues to asset-backed issues and project bonds across various jurisdictions, including emerging markets. Matthew also has experience of tax-driven structures, capital issues for UK building societies and corporate reorganisations.

Elizabeth performs a dual role as PSL Counsel and as Head of London Corporate Training. As a PSL, she advises on a wide range of company law issues with expertise in areas such as cross-border mergers, universal succession and capital maintenance. She also tracks market practice, for example in relation to the terms of M&A deals. Elizabeth is a member of the Law Society Company Law Committee and of Allen & Overy's Corporate Opinions Committee. On the training side, Elizabeth regularly lectures and teaches intensive courses to clients and lawyers around Allen & Overy's global network. Prior to taking up her current role, Elizabeth gained extensive experience, both in London and in Sydney, of advising on a wide range of corporate transactions including private M&A and private equity deals, public takeovers, joint ventures, restructurings and IPOs.

Bob is a partner in the banking and project finance group in the New York office. He heads the Project Practice in New York and has overall responsibility for our São Paulo office. He has worked for over 20 years—roughly equally for lenders and for borrowers—in financings, restructurings and infrastructure development, including a significant focus on the emerging markets (particularly Brazil and Latin America, Russia and the Middle East). Bob has done this both as a lawyer representing lenders and equity investors, and as the head of an independent power producer’s Latin American development group.
Representative Transactions (Lender Roles):
Deutsche Bank in a transaction with Petrobras involving a gas-fired power plant in Brazil.
BNPP as lead arranger in its refinancing of the TEG (a 260 MW (gross) pet coke-fired, 'self-generation' facility in Mexico) debt.
Calyon as lead arranger in its refinancing of the TEP (a 260 MW (gross) pet coke-fired, 'self-generation' facility in Mexico) debt.

The project sponsors in connection with the development and financing of two pet coke-fired generation facilities in Mexico (520 MW) with a capital cost of US$700 million financed with the participation of COFACE, ECGD and the IDB (this transaction was named 'Deal of the Year' in its category by Project Finance Magazine).
GE Energy Financial Services in connection with its bid for a hydroelectric plant in Panama and on various other bids for water projects in the Middle East.

Sociedad Concesionaria Vespucio Norte Express S.A., project company, and its sponsors (Hochtief Projektentwicklung GmbH and Actividades de Construcción y Servicios S.A. Dragados) with a US$424 million project bond, guaranteed by monoline insurer MBIA, to finance the construction of an electronically-tolled urban ring road in Santiago, Chile.
Camargo Correa and Andrade Gutierrez as sponsors in connection with the US$115 million financing by IFC of the Dutra toll road in São Paulo, Brazil.
The sponsors in relation to specific contractual matters for the Damietta port project in Egypt.
Grupo México in the structuring of its RFP for a 400 MW coal-fired self-generation facility.
Marubeni in its acquisition of the Miravalles geothermal power plant in Costa Rica.
Project sponsors on the 1000 MW Tamazunchale bid sponsored by CFE in Mexico.
TECO Power in the development of a 90 MW gas-fired power project in Guatemala (the emergency project using LM 6000's was initially financed on an all-equity basis and later refinanced through OPIC).
Bob speaks Portuguese, Spanish, French, Russian and English.

Person.Experience: David is an English qualified lawyer. He specialises in antitrust, state aid, trade law and general EU law. He has extensive experience of working on complex behavioural cases. He regularly represents companies before the European Commission in major cartel and abuse of dominance investigations as well as in merger proceedings. The cases David advises on often involve multiple investigations across different jurisdictions. David also regularly represents companies involved in EU anti-dumping and anti-subsidy investigations. He has acted for EU producers as well as overseas companies in a range of industries, including chemicals and electronics. He has extensive knowledge of the EU and UK Institutions as he previously worked as an official at the UK Office of Fair Trading and the European Commission (DG Competition). He was also a legal adviser on EU matters at the Confederation of British Industry (CBI).
Person.Publications: U.S. and EU Antitrust Enforcement: What Role in a More Heavily Regulated Financial Sector? The Emerging Practice of EU Cartel Settlement

Person.Experience: Alexandre is a counsel in the Intellectual Property and Litigation department at Allen & Overy Paris. He regularly advises companies in the pharma, high tech, media and entertainment industries. He is specialised in intellectual property law and deals with IP litigious and non-litigious matters, as well as with regulatory matters in the pharmaceutical industry. Alexandre was seconded part-time to Novartis in France for 6 months in 2010.

Person.Experience: Matúš specialises in banking and finance. Before joining Allen & Overy he worked for four years for one of the leading Slovak banks, and for two years was head of the department providing legal services in corporate banking activities. He has experience advising on various transactions including general corporate finance, project finance, real estate finance and financial leasing. He has advised clients during formal and informal solutions for the financial difficulties of debtors, including work-outs, formal restructurings and bankruptcies.

Wijnanda specialises in pensions law. She has over 20 years' experience, specifically as a pensions lawyer, including six years as a senior legal consultant at a global actuarial firm. Wijnanda's pension experience includes advising employers, pension funds, insurance companies, unions and works councils on national and international issues including the establishing, merging, outsourcing and winding-up of pension schemes as well as pension fund governance. In 2008 Wijnanda was appointed as deputy justice in the Higher Court of Amsterdam. In addition she is the treasurer of the international pension law association IPEBLA and is a member of the board of advice and the editorial board of PBM. Wijnanda publishes on a regular basis in the international quarterly journal of IPEBLA (International Pension and Employee Benefits Lawyers Association) and in the Dutch journal for managers of pension funds 'Pensioenbestuur & Management' (PBM). In addition she has published articles in several other Dutch employment and corporate journals and is a frequent speaker at seminars. The 2011 edition of Chambers Europe describes Wijnanda as follows: "Wijnanda Rutten is a counsel and a highly respected specialist in pensions." The 2012 edition of Chambers Europe says: "Wijnanda Rutten specialises in pensions. She represented AAR in a years-long dispute with pension fund PME, which was settled in 2011."

Prokop focuses on corporate law, contract law and mergers and acquisitions. He also specializes in the sector of telecommunications, media and technologies and the area of personal data protection, including regulatory matters. In the past, Prokop worked on a number of mergers and acquisitions, representing sellers and buyers, and acted as a legal advisor on a number of international transactions in Central and Eastern Europe. Prokop is noted as “a technically skilled lawyer“. He specialises in M&A and corporate law in the field of TMT and data protection. CHAMBERS EUROPE 2013

Allie has a broad range of experience advising on environmental and regulatory compliance in M&A, capital markets, lending and real estate transactions, U.S. and EU environmental requirements, anti-corruption, sanctions, and national security matters. She has experience advising some of Allen & Overy's largest financial institution and corporate clients regarding compliance with U.S. and international anti-terrorism sanctions, with a particular focus on sanctions administered by OFAC, the U.S. Department of State and the United Nations. Allie has substantial experience drafting compliance policies and advising on compliance questions arising on a stand-alone basis and in transactions. Prior to joining Allen & Overy Allie clerked for the Honorable Alvin K. Hellerstein, District Court Judge, United States District Court for the Southern District of New York.
Person.Publications: Note, Providing Protection from 'Unofficial' Torture: A New Approach to the State Action Requirement of the Convention Against Torture, 70 BROOK.L.REV. 33 (2004).

Person.Experience: Robert has extensive experience with various forms of financing, derivatives transactions and related regulation. Recently he has been focusing on dispute resolution. Robert has represented financial institutions and corporations in disputes, settlement negotiations and administrative proceedings. His recent work includes disputes from derivatives trades heard by court and in arbitration proceedings, sanction proceedings by the Czech National Bank, settlement regarding environmental damage and participation in a creditors' committee in insolvency proceedings involving a dispute for damages against the debtor's sole member. Clients describe Robert as “pleasant to work with, technically strong, and a knowledgeable adviser”. CHAMBERS 2013

In addition, Andre advises on compliance questions, the German law of limited liability companies and on the German law of foundations.

Person.Experience: Vanessa has wide experience in domestic and international financial transactions including leveraged finance, corporate finance and structured finance. In addition she has also been involved in several debt restructuring transactions effected in the last few years. Additionally, Vanessa has experience in derivative transactions, with a particular focus on OTC derivatives and collateral arrangements and advice on regulatory issues, including bank regulations and regulation of the securities and derivatives markets. In 2008, Vanessa undertook a secondment in the securitisation department in Allen & Overy London. Vanessa is recommended for her excellent work in Chambers & Partners, since 2010 until today.

Thales is a senior associate in the litigation & contracts department of Allen & Overy in Brussels. He specializes in insolvency-related matters (both contentious and non-contentious) and commercial arbitration, both local and international. Thales is a regular lecturer, and has published on the Vienna Sales Convention, and on various insolvency-related topics.

Karel is a Senior Associate in the Brussels offi ce of Allen & Overy LLP. His practice focuses on EU and Belgian competition law. He has represented a number of international clients before the European Commission in merger control and cartel cases including one of the fi rst cartel cases that resulted in a settlement decision. He has also been involved in several merger control, cartel and abuse of dominance investigations by the Belgian Competition Authority. He has recently spent three months with an Indian law firm to help develop their antitrust capability. Karel is the author of a number of legal publications in the field of Belgian and EU competition law and is a guest lecturer in competition law at the Hogeschool – Universiteit Brussel (HUB).

She has a degree in occupational pensions from the Belgian Pension Academy. She has published on pensions of internationally mobile employees, equal treatment, outsourcing and employment law restructuring and regularly speaks on topics related to outsourcing, equal treatment, privacy at work and termination of employment contracts. Person.Experience: Anna is a Senior Associate in the Banking Department in Allen & Overy's London office. She has advised on a wide range of domestic and cross-border leveraged finance and general lending transactions, acting for lenders, private equity sponsors and corporates.

Gianpaolo assists many leading Italian and foreign banks and corporates in relation to financial, company and contractual legal aspects. He has significant experience in the areas of banking, capital markets and structured finance and has worked on numerous securitisation transactions, bank financings, Italian public offerings, EMTN programmes, transactions regarding Italian local entities, covered warrants and certificates, repackagings and Tier 1. He is also an experienced adviser on Italian banking and financial services regulation, with particular reference to derivatives contracts. Gianpaolo has considerable experience on restructuring transactions and insolvencies and is the main contact person for assistance in relation to the Lehman Brothers', General Motors' and Icelandic banks' defaults in Italy.

Malte-Matthias, a German Rechtsanwalt with a degree in business administration, joined Allen & Overy LLP in 2004 in the Hamburg office. He has gained experience in connection with a range of corporate transactions, ongoing corporate advice and corporate and commercial law related litigation.

Beth advises on a broad range of debt capital markets and structured finance transactions. Her experience includes advising on structured investment vehicles, CDOs, CFOs, repackagings and secured bonds and, more recently, has had a particular emphasis on social housing backed bond issues, liability management, Islamic structured finance and public sector debt.

Person.Experience: Anchalee is a counsel in the banking practice of the Bangkok office. She specialises in banking and capital markets law. She has advised on a number of high profile syndicated loans transactions in Thailand and has extensive experience in capital markets and securitisation transactions. She also has experience of general corporate and commercial work, mergers and acquisitions, Board of Investment advice, securities and debt restructuring. Her experience includes advising PTT on the borrowing of a USD300m club loan; PTTAC (a joint venture including PTT, Asahi Kasei Chemicals and Marubeni) on its USD400m debt to finance its petrochemical project; and Hemaraj Land & Development (one of the sponsors) on the USD460m and THB9.96bn project financing of GHECO-One IPP.

Martin is a German Rechtsanwalt and Counsel with broad expertise advising on German and international capital markets transactions. Martin specialises in advising on securitisation and other structured finance transactions (encompassing both true sale and synthetic structures and a wide variety of asset classes). Person.Experience: Jeff specialises in public international law and international arbitration. He has been counsel in numerous bilateral investment treaty and Energy Charter Treaty arbitrations under ICSID and UNCITRAL arbitration rules, ICSID annulment proceedings and international commercial arbitration proceedings generally. He is also the author of numerous academic articles and chapters on international investment law and arbitration and he is frequently invited to speak at international conferences on investment law issues. Jeff recently gave a series of lectures on investment law issues to representatives of the Member States of the Islamic Development Bank. He is an Assistant Editor of World Arbitration and Mediation Review, an advisory board member of the Institute for Transnational Arbitration, and a member of UNCTAD's Investment Experts Group. Jeff spent five years practicing litigation and arbitration in Washington, DC prior to joining Allen & Overy. Person.Experience: Yana is an associate in the Banking, Projects, Energy and Infrastructure group in the New York office. Yana has experience representing commercial banks, institutional lenders, private developers and construction companies. Her experience at Allen & Overy includes deals in mining, power, infrastructure and renewables sectors, with a significant focus on Latin America. Yana is a native Russian and English speaker, fluent in Spanish and learning Portuguese.

Person.Experience: Norman is a counsel based in Allen & Overy's Beijing office. His practice focuses on derivatives and structured products, cross-border mergers and acquisitions, private equity and financial regulatory work. He advised international banks on derivatives transactions, wealth management, QDII products, secured debt-financing, and represented banks and major oil companies in their ISDA schedule negotiation. He participated in high-profile IPO and strategic investment projects involving top PRC banks and insurers. He represented PE investors in connection with their equity or debt financing in the high-tech, private education and insurance-related sectors. He also advised US and European companies in public and private M&A deals, strategic alliance and platform building. Norman received an LLM from The George Washington University Law School and from Peking University Law School, and is admitted to the New York State Bar. He is fluent in English and a native speaker of Mandarin Chinese, Cantonese and the Hakka dialect.

Bartosz specialises in corporate and commercial law, in particular in mergers and acquisitions, and real estate law. He has been involved in many real estate projects, advising real estate companies on the day-to-day management of their property portfolios, acquisitions of enterprises and companies as well as corporate restructurings. Bartosz's experience also includes advising on various aspects of employment law (including employment restructurings), consumer promotions (including data protection issues, regulatory aspects of lotteries, consumer protection), and regulations applicable to internet and on-line gambling.

Suparerk has extensive experience of capital markets. He advised the lead underwriters on the initial public offerings (IPO) of Bangkok Metro Pcl; Rayong Refinery Pcl; and Phatra Securities Pcl. He was also involved in the dual listing of shares in Thailand and Singapore by DTAC; the proposed privatisation and IPO of EGAT; TOT Pcl; and CAT Telecom Pcl. He has also advised on a number of M&A transactions. He advised Mitsui Sumitomo Insurance on its acquisition in The Ayudhya Insurance Pcl; and Singapore Telecom on its various acquisitions in Thailand.

Khemmawat is an associate in the banking practice. He has experience in corporate finance, banking, mergers and acquisitions, corporate and commercial law and capital markets transactions. His experience includes advising Citigroup on the issue Thai Baht bonds; Deutsche Bank on its first issue of Thai Baht bonds; HSBC (as lead manager) on the issue of Thai Baht bonds by Commonwealth Bank of Australia; Standard Chartered Bank (Thai) (as joint lead managers) on the debentures issued by BTS and Double A ; Tesco Lotus and Easy Buy on the issues of guaranteed debentures. He also advised Dai-ichi Mutual Life Assurance on its acquisition of shares in Ocean Life Insurance and CAT Telecom on its acquisition of telecom assets from Hutch.

Yulia specialises in corporate/M&A projects in Russia and has experience in international corporate, financial, energy and real estate transactions. She advised foreign and Russian clients on various aspects of Russian corporate, commercial, banking, antimonopoly and other regulatory law in connection with corporate governance, establishment and operation of joint ventures, restructuring including mergers and acquisitions, PPP projects, and state procurement in energy, telecommunication, pharmaceutical, banking, mass media, retail and real estate sectors.

Neil advises a mixture of trustees and employers on their pension arrangements. Pablo has more than 9 years of experience in both domestic and international financing transactions, including syndicate financing (LBOs, corporate, restructuring, project finance and asset finance). Diane has experience in domestic and international syndicated and bilateral corporate finance transactions. She also has specialist real estate finance experience and has worked on numerous investment grade and leveraged finance transactions.

François has extensive banking, finance and corporate experience, advising clients across the Middle East, North Africa, Europe and Canada. Isabelle advises multinationals, private equity houses and financial institutions on both direct and indirect tax matters and is involved in several litigation matters. Alexandra is a Russian law partner specializing in a range of capital market products and Russian corporate and securities laws. Person.Experience: Stefano has 20 years’ experience in banking and structured finance. He is widely acknowledged as a leading finance lawyer in Italy by the top legal directories and has advised on some of the largest Italian transactions in the market. In the banking sector, he advises borrowers and lenders on a broad range of financing transactions, including general lending, leveraged and acquisition financing, real estate finance and project finance. In the area of structured finance, Stefano advises both arrangers, originators and issuers on many of the leading public and private securitisation transactions performed under Law 130 and Law 52/91 in relation to a variety of assets, on the establishment and amendment of covered bond programmes, and the issue of high yield debt and project bonds. He also advises lenders and borrowers on debt restructuring transactions and provides advice on regulatory and compliance issues applicable to the banking and finance sectors. "He is outstanding – always reachable and extremely thorough. Definitely one of the best banking and finance lawyers." CHAMBERS EUROPE & GLOBAL 2013. “Stefano is a very skilled lawyer, very commercial but still quite tough in negotiations when needed. He always acts with the aim of finding the right solution for both parties.” IFLR 1000 2013 - ITALY.

Danielle has experience drafting agreements and corporate documents, conducting and managing due diligence and managing local counsel on complex cross-border transactions. Urs, a German Rechtsanwalt, has experience in national and international finance, including investment grade, acquisition and leverage financing, advising both borrowers and banks. He also benefits from his expertise in complex refinancing (including restructuring) and combined loan and debt capital markets financing.

Person.Publications: National rapporteur for the Netherlands on “Public Capital and Private Capital in the internal market. Person.Experience: Richard is an associate in the Projects, Energy & Infrastructure Group in our New York office. For his level of seniority Richard has significant experience with PPP projects in North America.
Jonathan has experience advising debtors, creditors, and other stakeholders in relation to cross-border and domestic insolvency proceedings.

LaToya advises U.S. and multinational clients on a variety of corporate transactions, including domestic and cross-border M&A. She has experience drafting corporate documents, conducting due diligence in the public and private contexts and assisting in securing antitrust clearance in response to HSR second requests. Prior to working at Allen & Overy, LaToya completed a federal clerkship for the Honorable Morrison C. England, Jr. of the U.S. District Court, Eastern District of California.

Tobias, a German Rechtsanwalt, joined Allen & Overy LLP in 2008 as an associate in the Frankfurt corporate department after having worked as an associate with Cleary Gottlieb Steen & Hamilton LLP, Frankfurt since 2005. He has earned an LL.M. degree at Columbia University, New York. Tobias has gained experience in a range of corporate transactions and matters, advising German and non-German investors and companies in connection with (cross-border) acquisitions and reorganisations. He also has experience in equity capital markets transactions.

Person.Experience: Álvaro has been involved in numerous M&A transactions, transfer of assets and on joint ventures, both domestic and cross-border. He has a wide experience in the preparation and coordination of due diligence both national and international, regarding several sections (corporate, contracts, insurances, real estate, IP), and specially on the electric sector. He also has advised on financings and corporate reorganizations. Moreover he carries out all kinds of secretarial works. Alvaro is a member of the Pro-Bono Committee in the Allen & Overy Madrid office, where he is the contact person for the Vicente Ferrer Foundation. Álvaro has undertaken a secondment in Allen & Overy's Corporate Department in London within the Private Equity team.
Emmanuel advises on corporate law. He joined Allen & Overy in 2009.
Person.Publications: "Starting a business in Luxembourg". Doing Business 2013 - Smarter regulations for small and medium-size enterprises. The World Bank - IFC. March 2013

Person.Experience: Andreea Burtoiu joined RTPR Allen & Overy in 2004. She is a qualified lawyer, member of the Bucharest Bar and of the National Union of Romanian Bar Associations. Andreea has extensive experience in banking and finance, acting on behalf of domestic and international banks and borrowers on syndicated and bilateral credit transactions and advising security takers and providers on the creation and perfection of guarantees and security, as well as on project finance and municipal loans, sovereign debt, major privatisation transactions, capital markets, energy, natural gas, heat, water and sewerage, and real estate financing; she also has experience in cash management tools and derivatives as well as in restructuring. She advised on some of the most important transactions in Romania, such as the issue by the Romanian Ministry of Public Finance of notes under a MTN Programme, and the listing of Transgaz (the largest IPO in Romania).

Agnieszka specialises in banking and finance transactions, including acquisition finance, property finance and project finance as well as general lending, refinancings and restructurings. Agnieszka has advised the largest domestic and international banks on both single-lender as well as syndicated financings. She also has experience in working on the borrower's side and has represented many corporate clients in the financing process.

Imre specialises in M&A transactions, general corporate and employment advisory work (including business transfers, mass dismissals). He advised on numerous domestic and cross-border joint ventures, mergers and acquisitions, asset deals and restructurings (including insolvency related matters). He acted on a number of transactions in the TMT sector. Imre is a member of the Budapest litigation and arbitration group and has experience in both international and domestic disputes. Imre acted for a wide range of domestic and international companies on corporate, employment, data protection and public procurement matters. He has developed specific expertise in the banking, media and real estate sectors. Imre was part of the team which was awarded "Hungarian Law Firm of the Year" by IFLR 2011.
Person.Publications: Co-author "10 Years of the Parliamentary Commissioner's Office of Hungary", 2005

Person.Experience: Victor Pădurari is a partner of RTPR, in association with Allen & Overy LLP. Victor is primarily involved in finance and projects, including secured lending, project finance, LBOs, real estate finance, PPPs, concessions, governmental public debt and municipal finance, as well as general corporate and commercial law, real estate and state aid. Since 2000 Victor has been advising an international financial institution in numerous financings extended to Romanian municipalities and to local utilities sectors (water, district heating, solid waste, local transport).

Cosmin Tilea joined RTPR Allen & Overy in 2005. He is a qualified lawyer, member of the Bucharest Bar and of the National Union of Romanian Bar Associations. Cosmin has an extensive experience in cross- border banking and finance transactions (especially in project finance structures), municipal loans and public debt, procurement and energy matters.

Loredana Boeru joined RTPR Allen & Overy in 2006. She is a qualified lawyer, member of the Bucharest Bar and of the National Union of Romanian Bar Associations. Loredana has a vast experience of advising domestic and international banks and borrowers in syndicated and bilateral finance transactions, restructuring of credits, as well as derivatives, MiFID documentation, cash pooling, custody, T-bills transactions and repo arrangements.

Valentin Hiriţ joined RTPR Allen & Overy in 2004. He is a qualified lawyer, member of the Bucharest Bar and of the National Union of Romanian Bar Associations. Valentin has experience in litigation matters as well as in advising on mergers and acquisitions, corporate and competition legislation in Romania.

Victor Rusu joined RTPR Allen & Overy in 2005. He is a qualified lawyer, member of the Bucharest Bar and of the National Union of Romanian Bar Associations. Victor has experience in advising international companies with regard to commercial transactions, merger & acquisitions, corporate law, and transactions involving financing and real estate in Romania.

Mihai Ristici is a partner of RTPR, in association with Allen & Overy LLP. Mihai focuses primarily on M&A and corporate matters, having advised on a number of significant transactions on the Romanian market such as the privatisation of BCR, Romania’s largest bank, the acquisition of the commercial bank RoBank SA by OTP Bank, and the acquisition of Interbrew Efes Breweries by InBev Romania SA. Mihai has also significant experience in finance matters - real estate, public sector and project finance, advising both lenders and sponsors on complex cross-border syndicated lending arrangements.

Costin Tărăcilă is the managing partner of RTPR, in association with Allen & Overy LLP. Costin specialises in M&A, private equity and corporate matters, having advised on some of the most high profile transactions in Romania, such as the acquisition by MKB Bank of Romexterra Bank S.A., the IPO and listing of Transgaz, the largest IPO in Romania, and several large-scale privatisations in the energy sector. He also has experience in advising international companies on capital markets transactions, corporate & commercial matters, matters, competition law, privatisation and real estate.

Alexandra Ovedenie joined RTPR Allen & Overy in 2008. She is a qualified lawyer, member of the Bucharest Bar and of the National Union of Romanian Bar Associations. Alexandra is a banking lawyer with an experience of more than 10 years in this field. She has worked both as in-house legal counsel for the Romanian subsidiaries of two reputable international banks as well as external banking lawyer. Her areas include corporate and retail banking finance and products, financial derivatives, cash management, capital markets, banking regulatory and banking M&A.

Roxana Ionescu joined RTPR Allen & Overy in 2007. She is a qualified lawyer, member of the Bucharest Bar and of the National Union of Romanian Bar Associations. Roxana has experience in advising international companies on commercial transactions, mergers and acquisitions, competition and labour law in Romania. Roxana has extensive experience in providing assistance in the merger clearance proceedings, as well as in relation to the investigations undergone by the Romanian Competition Council.

Maria has been involved in a number of projects for both Russian and foreign companies on various aspects of Russian securities, corporate and finance law in connection with capital raising deals, mergers and acquisitions and banking business.

Susana Ng is a Consultant in the employment team and a member of Allen & Overy's APAC Regulatory Group. Susana is involved in a wide range of contentious and non-contentious employment matters including employee handbooks and contracts review, advise on restrictive covenants, pension, employment benefits and employee incentive schemes, discrimination, anti-bribery, immigration and data protection laws. She also handles numerous dismissal and discrimination claims and assists in proceedings before the Labour Tribunal and Courts in Hong Kong. Susana also has extensive experience in employment issues arising out of mergers and acquisitions and has advised numerous multinational corporations which have established their presence in Hong Kong. In recent years, Susana has been involved in matters arising out of cross-border employment relationship and advised multinational corporations extensively on PRC employment-related issues. Susana has published numerous articles on employment law appearing in local newspapers and journals. She has most recently contributed a chapter on Remuneration for "Employment Law and Practice in Hong Kong" (Sweet & Maxwell, 2010). Susana has been invited by the World Bank to speak at an international conference on global employment issues. Susana is qualified in Hong Kong and New York. She is fluent in English, Mandarin and Cantonese.
Person.Publications: Regular contributions to South China Morning Post & Career Times and other publications Contributing Editor, "Employment Law and Practice in Hong Kong, First Supplement", First Edition, Sweet & Maxwell, 2012 Contributing Author, "Minimum Wage Ordinance (Cap. 608) Commentary and Annotations", Sweet & Maxwell, 2012

Person.Experience: Natalya has advised Russian and foreign companies on various aspects of Russian corporate law and securities legislation in connection with private placements, potential IPOs and listings of various issuers on foreign stock exchanges. Natalya’s experience includes advising foreign clients on Russian contract, insolvency, custom, aviation law issues and litigation, including acting for major aircraft leasing companies in first ever aircraft repossessions in Russia. Natalya holds LLM in International Business Law.
Person.Publications: 'Debt to equity conversion as way of debt restructuring' published in March2009 issue of M&A Journal, co-authored with I. Mazilin.

Person.Experience: Wojciech has extensive experience in tax matters, including VAT, excise duty and tax litigation, and in particular in proceedings before administrative courts. Wojciech has handled tax proceedings and proceedings before administrative courts in a number of major excise duty cases in Poland. He also assisted clients from different industries in numerous court disputes regarding inconsistencies between Polish VAT regulations and EU law.

Mirosław has extensive experience in commercial and corporate law, IP law, private equity and M&A projects, as well as in providing a broad range of advice on real estate matters. Mirosław specialises in private equity/venture capital (PE/VC) transactions. He advised PE/VC funds on many investments in companies from various sectors. His experience also covers advising the PE/VC funds on divestments.

Person.Publications: Kate has written three articles published by LexisNexis: 'Solvency II, CommSite', co-author, on-line content, 2010. 'The Solvency II Project', Company Secretary’s Review, Volume 32, Number 19,2009. 'Employers' Liability Insurance', Company Secretary’s Review, Volume 32, Number13, 2008.

Person.Experience: Anthony specialises in commercial and financial litigation and has gained experience assisting clients in a variety of civil and criminal proceedings. He has a specific interest in white-collar crimes. Anthony worked two years in the Corporate department, where he was involved in various corporate transactions.

Mariette specialises in banking and finance law with a particular focus on global loans, securitisations, project finance, lending, asset finance and leveraged finance transactions. She has acted for both banks and borrowers and on domestic and cross-border deals and regularly advises large financial institutions including ABN AMRO, ING and Rabobank. Mariette joined Allen & Overy in 2008 after studying at the University of Amsterdam.

Ilya leads Allen & Overy's Aircraft Finance practice in Russia and joined the Moscow office in 2008. He is a recognised expert in this field and acts for all of the leading players in the Russian market. He previously spent 18 months in Allen & Overy’s London office as a member of the Structured and Asset Finance team, acting for major lessors and financial institutions on complex cross-border asset finance transactions. Ilya’s practice features a wide range of aircraft financing matters, including pre-delivery payment financings, ECA financings, portfolio sales and leasing, as well as related Russian tax, customs and regulatory issues. Ilya was the first lawyer to successfully lead the repossession of aircraft from Russia on behalf of an international lessor. Among others, he advised leading international lessors on the KrasAir and KD Avia cases. He also represented major aircraft lessors and banks on their restructurings and on airline bankruptcy cases in Russia. The current edition of the Legal 500 refers to Ilya as “...one of the best aviation lawyers, if not the best, in the Russian market”. In 2012 and 2013, Vedomosti named Ilya as the best aviation lawyer in Russia.

Amine joined Allen & Overy in 2008 having previously worked as a trainee for international law firms in Paris. He studied in France and United Kingdom. Amine has a good understanding of multi sourced financings. Amine specialises in Banking and Finance and has a wide experience in structured finance including projects financing, syndicated loans, acquisitions finance and PPP. Amine spent four years in the Allen & Overy Paris office where he was involved in structured finance, PPP and international acquisitions finance, prior to joining Allen & Overy Casablanca. He advises Moroccan and international clients, banks and lenders on local and international transactions.

Tomasz specialises in banking and finance transactions, including export finance, general lending, and project finance and asset finance projects in Poland and abroad. He has been involved in several export finance transactions from Poland to the Russian Federation, as well as in project finance concerning the construction of motorways in Poland.
Fee has a specific interest in zoning and urban planning related issues and compliance with environmental law, including REACH and soil contamination.

Yara is in the International Capital Markets practice and a member of the Latin America practice. She has capital markets experience representing and advising corporate and banking clients in Latin America, Europe and the United States in debt, equity and equity-linked securities offerings registered with the SEC and made pursuant to Regulation S and Rule 144A under the U.S. Securities Act of 1933. In addition, Yara has provided legal advice under the U.S. Securities Act of 1933 and the U.S. Securities Exchange Act of 1934. She is a native Spanish, Galician and English speaker and has a working knowledge of Portuguese.

Person.Experience: Gabrielle specialises in contentious and non-contentious employment law matters. She joined Allen & Overy in 2008.

Ivan is a Russian qualified associate at Allen & Overy based in the Moscow office. He has played a key role on a number of complex projects for both Russian and foreign investors, corporates and banks and has advised on a wide range of Russian law issues, with a particular focus on financial transactions.

Sergey has a substantial experience in advising leading international and Russian banks and companies on a broad range of banking and finance transactions (both secured and unsecured) and capital markets deals. He has also advised major financial institutions on asset financings, derivatives, securities regulations, insolvency proceedings and related litigation.

Ruben specialises in commercial and corporate litigation and arbitration. His practice covers the full range of dispute resolution, including contractual liability, (financial) product liability, corporate litigation, banking litigation and professional liability. He has experience in legal proceedings before both national public courts and national and international arbitral tribunals. Ruben joined Allen & Overy in 2008 after studying at the [university].

Najat specialises in real estate, construction and environmental law. She advises property investors, developers, landlords and tenants, lenders and borrowers on all aspects of real estate such as acquisitions, developments, and lease and construction agreements both contentious and non contentious. Najat joined Allen & Overy in 2010 after studying at the [university].

Person.Experience: Sach is a US-qualified partner in the international capital markets department of Allen & Overy in London. Sach specialises in advising foreign issuers and investment banks in connection with equity and debt offerings, including Rule 144A, Regulation S and other private placement transactions as well as US SEC registered offerings. Sach is an active member of our EMEA practice and has played a key role in a number of equity and debt transactions within developed and emerging markets with a particular focus on the Middle East, Turkey and Russia. Sach has been ranked by Chambers for his capital markets work in Turkey. Sach worked in New York for eight years before joining Allen & Overy in 2008 and has been a partner since 2011.
Julie advises on international tax law and corporate law. She joined Allen & Overy in 2009.

Antonio is head of the Competition and European Law Department in Spain at Allen & Overy. He has over 19 years of experience in this area including all types of competition and merger control proceedings both before the European Commission and the Spanish Competition Authority (Comisión Nacional de la Competencia). He also advises in the private application of antitrust rules before Courts, acting regularly for Spanish companies before the General Court and the European Court of Justice of the European Union. Antonio is the author of numerous legal publications, Vice-Secretary General of the Spanish Association for the Study of European Law and Member of the Board of Directors of the Spanish Association for the Defence of Competition. He is also a Professor in the Master in European Law of the Universidad Autónoma de Madrid. Antonio is recommended in legal directories such as Chambers & Partners, (every year since 2003 until today), Legal 500, Best Lawyers and Practical Law Company.

Person.Experience: Nik specialises in corporate law, with a focus on mergers & acquistions, private equity and equity capital markets transactions. In [year] Nik graduated from [university]. He joined Allen & Overy in August 2009.

Zeyad Khoshaim is a New York- and Saudi Arabia- qualified lawyer who specialises in advising corporate multinationals on structuring and financing major projects, joint ventures, mergers and acquisitions in Saudi Arabia. Since 2003, he has advised and led on some of Saudi Arabia’s highest profile energy-, petrochemical- and healthcare- related projects. Zeyad leads the capital markets team in Riyadh and has advised on landmark debt and equity capital markets transactions. He is also actively engaged in advising leading commercial and investment banking firms in Saudi Arabia. Zeyad has been invited to speak on various topics, including corporate governance matters and has participated in capital markets symposiums. “Zeyad Khoshaim, is a clear client favourite, who is valued for his expertise and solid grounding in the capital markets arena” (IFLR, 2012) “He is very knowledgeable about the CMA (Capital Markets Association).” (IFLR, 2012) “[Zeyad] has very good client management skills.” (IFLR, 2012) “Sources are enthusiastic about Zeyad Khoshaim’’s capabilities and say he is ‘an innovative thinker who adds a lot of value and has been tremendously helpful’.” (Chambers Global, 2011, Saudi Arabia) “New York- and Saudi-qualified Zeyad Khoshaim is ‘a pleasure to work with and always very helpful’.” (Chambers Global, 2011- Saudi Arabia)

Markus Ernst advises on tax issues in connection with acquisitions, reorganisations, financing transactions and internal compliance investigations as well as on tax audits and tax proceedings. He publishes and speaks regularly on tax related topics.

Person.Experience: Dirk, a German Rechtsanwalt and commercial lawyer of the University of Bayreuth (Wirtschaftsjurist Univ. Bayreuth), joined Allen & Overy in 2008 as an associate in the global tax practice. Prior to that, he worked several years for another major law firm. He has extensive experience in advising in German and cross-border business taxation matters, in particular tax-related M&A transactions, post-acquisition restructurings and reorganizations, structured equity and debt financings and international tax planning.

John's practice includes both in- and out-of-court restructurings. He regularly represents corporate debtors, liquidating trustees, creditors' committees, debtor-in-possession lenders, secured and unsecured creditors, as well as businesses seeking to invest in or acquire the assets and businesses of financially troubled companies.

Person.Experience: Dorothea, a German Rechtsanwältin, has gained broad experience in advising national and international companies on corporate law, restructurings and on M&A transactions as well as on acquisition financing in various international law firms.

Elisabeth advises on both contentious and non-contentious IP/IT matters and also specialises in distribution law, advertising, trade practices, e-commerce and data protection compliance. She has seven years of experience in these areas. Elisabeth lectures in Special Contracts law at the University of Luxembourg. She is a member of the Association Benelux pour le Droit des Marques et des Modèles. Elisabeth joined Allen & Overy in 2008.
Person.Publications: Editor of a new Luxembourg legal publication on IP rights ("JurisNews de Droit de la propriété intellectuelle")

Person.Experience: Damian focuses on advice to financial institutions on financial markets law and regulation, the EU single market programme, clearing and settlement systems and financial institution mergers and acquisitions, as well as advising on derivatives and securities regulation and the development of new products. He also advises commodity, energy and emissions market participants on all aspects of their over-the-counter and exchange-traded derivatives business. Damian has also worked extensively with securities and derivatives exchanges and leading international clearing houses in relation to the development of new markets and market infrastructure relationships. Damian was profiled in Chambers 2014 - "The 'absolutely superb' Damian Carolan 'genuinely understands how banks fit together,' according to interviewees."

Vadim specializes in advising on local and crossboarder transaction which involve property refinancing and lending as well as various issues of land, cityplanning and construction regulations. He has particular experience in negotiating and drafting agreements on security interests over real assets. Vadim was also involved in various aspects of aircraft repossession activities and, during secondment to London, in general lending matters.
Person.Publications: Issues of Summary Judgment in Russian Civil Procedure', Civil and Arbitration Procedure Journal (Moscow) No. 7, 2008. 'Indisputability in Russian Summary and Simplified Proceedings', Civil and Arbitration Procedure Journal (Moscow), July 2009

Person.Experience: Maciej specialises in corporate, civil, real estate and commercial law. He has been involved in a wide range of M&A and private equity transactions, in particular in the financial institutions' sector, as well as in a number of real estate projects.

Jan-Hendrik has experience advising in the field of banking and energy law. In the field of banking law, he advises clients (including arrangers, facility agents, security agents, lenders, borrowers, shareholders, sponsors and guarantors) in all matters of cross-border and domestic banking and finance transactions, in particular in the area of syndicated, club and bilateral corporate loans and acquisition, export and project financings. Jan-Hendrik also advises on energy law matters, in particular, in relation to energy trading activities (especially under the EFET European Federation of Energy Traders Agreement) and other regulatory matters concerning the energy sector such as licensing and grid access.

Person.Experience: Zbigniew focuses on capital markets transactions, including acquisitions of public companies, structuring initial public offerings, and issuing equity and debt instruments on the Polish and international markets. He also has significant private equity experience. Zbigniew is widely regarded as the most prominent ECM lawyer in the Polish market, with unparalleled experience in a variety of complex and innovative transactions, as well as an in-depth knowledge of the regulatory environment. Luis has gained experience in the banking law area by participating in syndicate finance, project and asset finance transactions and security agreements. He has also provided assistance in advising on financial and investment services issues, including credit entities regulation and regulation of the securities and derivatives markets. Luis has also advised Investment Funds and SICAVS with the registration of its activities with the Spanish Stock Exchange Commission. Luis has also participated in Pro-Bono activities for the Against the Malaria Foundation and the Red Cross.

Javier focuses his practice on civil litigation, insolvency and arbitration, especially on insolvency proceedings and financial instruments. He has advised on civil and commercial law areas, primarily litigation on derivatives, insolvency proceedings and misrepresentation claims. Javier has experience concerning distribution and agency agreements, where he has advised both national and international clients. He has taken part in major insolvency proceedings in Spain, such as Mediapro, Martinsa-Fadesa, Nozar and Habitat. He also has represented clients in national and international arbitration proceedings, principally in commercial matters before both international and national arbitration courts such as the ICC Court of Arbitration and CIMA. As for probono work, he is Legal advisor at Asociación Española contra el Cáncer.

Person.Experience: Philipp Wahl is a corporate partner in the London office. He focuses on mergers and acquisitions and corporate finance transactions in Central & Eastern Europe and CIS countries and co-heads Allen & Overy's Russia & CIS practice. Independent publications rank Philipp as leading corporate finance and M&A advisor. He is admitted to practice in Austria, England & Wales and New York.

Otakar specialises in arbitration, litigation and financial derivatives. In addition to the international arbitration work, he regularly assists leading Czech companies in their domestic disputes. Otakar also has significant experience with ICM work and was involved in a number of banking and real estate transactions.
