Person.Experience: Sanne specialises in banking and finance law with a particular focus on global loans, securitisations, project finance, syndicated (un)secured corporate lending, asset finance and leveraged finance transactions. She has acted for both banks and borrowers and on domestic and cross-border deals. She regularly advises large financial institutions including ABN AMRO, ING and Rabobank. Sanne joined Allen & Overy in March 2009 after studying at the [university].

Adam is an associate in the Finance and Capital Markets Department at Allen & Overy Madrid having joined the team in April 2011. Since qualification he has covered a wide range of international financings both in the banking and capital markets sectors. His experience includes advising on EMTN and GMTN bond programmes, stand-alone bond issues (both Issuer and Arranger counsel), ECA backed financings, project bonds, real estate financing and general lending.

Person.Publications: Banking Regulation: Jurisdictional comparisons, UK chapter (co-authored with Bob Penn), Thomson Reuters, 2012

Person.Experience: Cindy Lo is a partner in Allen & Overy's Hong Kong office. Cindy worked in Allen & Overy's Shanghai and Beijing offices before relocating to Hong Kong. She has broad experience in a range of banking and finance transactions, including acquisition finance, project finance, asset finance, corporate lending and pre-IPO financing. Cindy regularly works with both Chinese and international banks on cross-border financing transactions, and is familiar with their documentation requirements and documentation process. Cindy is qualified in Hong Kong and speaks English, Cantonese and Mandarin.

Gergely is a qualified lawyer, a chartered tax expert and a certified economist. Previously he worked for two big four accounting firms as a tax lawyer. Gergely has extensive experience in national and international taxation, tax planning, tax-driven corporate restructuring, taxation of financial instruments, EC tax law, transfer pricing and VAT. Gergely regularly advises multinational clients in several industrial areas on various tax issues. He is the author and co-author of various tax publications.

Constantin has developed an expertise on public agreements (PPP, public procurement, public service delegation) and project finance. He worked on the structuring and the financing of many public utilities in France and in Morocco, in particular in the field of transports and energy. He advises French and Moroccan public entities and international sponsors or lenders. He has advised sponsors in the bidding process for highway concessions (A63, A88), on the construction and operation of stadiums (Stade de Lille), the French MoD on the purchase of military equipments, or the French Tennis Federation on renovating the Roland Garros stadium. In Morocco, he advises public entities. He has also been active on the development and financing for the 700MW expansion of the Jorf Lasfar power plant in Morocco (USD1.4bn). He currently works for sponsors on construction projects, management and operation of a port terminal, of a desalination plant etc. Constantin has also recently developed specific skills in the upstream oil and gas and mining activity in North Africa and acted for several foreign operators during their negotiations with relevant governmental authorities (Petroleum Agreements, Association Contracts, exploration licences, JOA…). He has held a seminar on the public agreements at the Institut d'Etudes Politiques de Paris.

Joyce specialises in various aspects of (notarial) corporate law such as mergers and acquisitions, joint-ventures, demergers, spin-offs, corporate restructurings and reorganisations. She advises (inter)national listed companies on their Dutch structure and Dutch corporate governance. She is also often involved in private equity transactions, management buy-outs, buy-ins and IPO's. Prior to joining Allen & Overy, Joyce was the managing partner for the Amsterdam office of AKD Prinsen Van Wijmen. She has experience of working in New York, where she mainly focussed on US international clients doing business in Europe via the Netherlands.

He has experience advising on various employment issues including individual and collective dismissals, transfer of undertaking, works council, outsourcing, equal treatment, employer liability and data protection. He joined Allen & Overy in 2009 after studying at the [university].

René has joined Allen & Overy LLP in 2009 as an associate in the Hamburg competition group. He advises on all aspects of German and EU competition law, especially on cartels, on German and EU merger control, on private enforcement, on competitive restraints in distribution contracts and on compliance. When cases have a competition background, he also advises in related areas such as criminal law, anti-bribery law and directors & officers liability.

Person.Experience: Stefan, a German Rechtsanwalt, joined Allen & Overy LLP in May 2009 and works in the Frankfurt office. Previously, he practised for more than 5 years with another leading German law firm in Frankfurt, Düsseldorf and London. He has gained broad experience in the area of capital markets law. One focus of his practice is financial services regulation. He frequently advises banks, financial institutions, investment fund companies and corporates on banking, securities, investment and insurance regulatory matters, in particular in connection with capital market transactions, the establishing of institutions or branches, and in connection with compliance, risk management and outsourcing. Another focus of his practice is advising on restructurings and insolvencies in the capital markets sector, including bond restructurings and advising bondholders and trustees in the insolvency of the issuer. Stefan also has experience in M&A and corporate law.

Person.Experience: Christopher advises U.S. and multinational clients on various corporate transactions, including domestic and cross-border mergers and acquisitions, SEC-registered capital markets transactions and general corporate advisory work. He also has experience representing clients in real estate acquisitions, dispositions, financing, restructuring and joint venture transactions.
Noah is an associate in the international capital markets practice.

Tim is an associate in the litigation practice, specializing in disputes and investigations involving contract, tort, antitrust, FCPA, and securities laws liability involving complex financial instruments, trading practices, joint ventures, financial agreements, and commercial contracts. Tim has also taken on pro bono matters involving immigration and asylum law.

Jaime has significant experience in notifying merger filing to the European Commission and the Spanish Competition Authority, as well as handling multijurisdictional filings to other competition authorities worldwide. He also has substantial experience defending companies and trade associations in infringement proceedings dealing with collusive behaviour (cartels) and abuses of dominance. Jaime has also advised large multinational companies in state aid matters. Moreover, he has also litigated before the Spanish Audiencia Nacional (High Court equivalent) in competition law appeals. Jaime has advised in several sectors such as construction, foodstuff, retail, medical devices as well as in electronic payment devices.

Person.Experience: Kenny's areas of practice include US securities law as well as mergers and acquisitions, capital markets transactions, and general corporate matters under Singapore and English law. His US securities law experience includes acting as both issuers' and underwriters’ counsel on US-registered offerings, Rule 144A/Regulation S offerings and ADR offerings. Kenny also advises fund managers and issuers on the structuring and establishment of investment funds domiciled in Singapore as well as on regulatory aspects of managing investment funds out of Singapore. Kenny is New York, Singapore and UK qualified.

Kees specialises in EU and competition law. He regularly represents clients in proceedings before competition and regulatory authorities and courts. Kees has extensive experience in cartel and merger control proceedings before the Dutch Competition Authority and the European Commission. He also advises and litigates on matters of EU law and private enforcement of competition law. Kees regularly publishes on competition law, is a board member of the Dutch Association for competition law, and is also a lecturer in an international LLM programme. Chambers Europe describes him as follows: "Kees Schillemans is rapidly establishing himself as an expert in antitrust and regulated markets. Clients value his 'nice, easy manner' and technical skills. One impressed source said that 'there are not many who have this level of specialism'." … "Kees Schillemans receives overwhelming praise from peers."

Person.Experience: Andrea is an associate in the Energy Group in the Hamburg office and advises on European and German energy and competition law. She advises on a number of antitrust and energy industry related issues in connection with concessions for electricity and gas under the German Energy Act as well as concessions for district heating and water. Andrea also advises on German and international joint venture transactions and projects in the energy sector, including onshore and offshore wind energy, photovoltaic, oil and gas. Andrea has extensive experience with merger control notifications before the European Commission and the German Federal Cartel Office (Bundeskartellamt) and advises on several aspects of European and German antitrust law, including competitive restraint and distribution contracts. She also advises on German foreign trade law and notifies transactions before the German Ministry of Economics. Andrea joined Allen & Overy in 2009. Prior to this she gained experience on German and European energy and competition law working for a Scandinavian law firm in Copenhagen, the European Commission (DG Competition) in Brussels and a wind energy fund in Sydney. Andrea has gained further expertise in the energy sector and competition law through her PhD on renewable energy frameworks in Germany and the UK and European energy, competition and commercial law.

Person.Experience: Juan has gained experience in the tax area by participating in a variety of transactions including advising on Spanish taxation issues, international tax planning, cross-border financial transactions and for the employee share scheme design. He has provided assistance on due diligence tax and given tax advice on mergers and acquisitions. During the last year he has also participated in pro bono activities collaborating with the International Federation of the Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies and the Madrid Regional Immigration Ministry through the Program 'Conoce tus leyes'.

Mayte has gained experience in the banking area by participating in domestic and international syndicated financing transactions and financial debt restructuring transactions. She has also participated in capital markets transactions including the issuance of debt instruments and passportings for the Stock Exchange Commission. Mayte has been involved in Red-Cross Pro-Bono activities.

Pilar has gained experience in the capital markets area by advising a number of leading financial institutions on a wide range of capital markets transactions including standalone bonds, debt programme establishments and updates, securitisations, passportings and liability management transactions. During the last year she has also provided assistance in corporate and project finance transactions.

Evelina specialises in securitisations as well as listing and admission of securities to trading on the regulated market and the Euro MTF market of the Luxembourg Stock Exchange. She also advises on legal and regulatory aspects of Luxembourg legislation relating to prospectuses for securities, transparency obligations and market abuse. Evelina has more than four years of professional experience working in law firms in London and Luxembourg. She joined Allen & Overy Luxembourg in 2009.

Yaakov has experience representing major investment banks, institutional lenders and private equity firms in loan workouts and modifications, loan origination, repurchase/warehouse financing, and the acquisition and sale of all debt tranches including whole loans, mezzanine loans, junior notes and participations. He has also served as counsel to both purchasers/borrowers and sellers of commercial property.

Petra specialises in the areas of banking law, conflict of laws (especially law applicable to contractual and non-contractual obligations), European law, and international trade. Her recent experience includes advising on project, acquisition and asset financing and preparing various analyses of international element in cross-border transactions. Petra is being quoted in a number of publications as an expert on conflict of laws, more recently in the Yearbook on International Arbitration Volume III (2013) published by nw Verlag or in the ASA Bulletin of the Assocation Suisse de l’Arbitrage (2013).

Person.Experience: Kevin is one of the leading high yield lawyers in Europe and has extensive experience advising underwriters, financial sponsors and companies. His experience extends to bridge financings, leveraged bank financings, restructurings and merger & acquisition transactions. Recent deals include: Study Group, Vue Entertainment, Fesco Transportation, Liberty Global/Virgin Media, Perstorp, SBS Nordic, Refresco, Dematic, Ferrexpo, Alcatel Lucent, Avangard, TMD Friction, ENRC, Cable & Wireless and Manchester United. Kevin has been practising in the European high yield market since its inception and has led many of the deals that were instrumental in its development. He led teams that were awarded High Yield Team of the Year in 2013, short-listed Banking and Finance Team of the Year in 2012, short-listed Debt Capital Markets Team of the Year in 2008 and awarded Banking and Finance Team of the Year in 2002. Kevin is a member of the Board of Directors of the AFME High Yield Division and is a member of the Advisory Committee for the Practising Law Institute on Securities Regulation in Europe. Kevin is recognized as a leading lawyer for high yield in Chambers UK (Band 1), Legal 500 and IFLR, with Chambers describing him as having "an outstanding reputation in the high yield sphere" and being "praised for his long-standing experience and his great technical expertise balanced with a commercial approach – he just practices at a really high level".

Person.Publications: "Practical Intellectual Property", a looseleaf publication, editing and updating the chapters on passing off and patent law. Editor, Informa Professional Academy course in Brand Protection. Articles on various Iintellectual Property issues for Plc magazine, Patent World, Trade Mark World, Copyright World and the Journal of Intellectual Property Law and Practice. "Virtual Realities - Advertising in the virtual world" Intellectual Property Magazine.

Person.Experience: Cerintha is a Singapore-qualified banking and finance specialist, particularly in construction and infrastructure project financing and acquisition financing. Her expertise includes company and property law, and she has acted in major Singapore bank mergers. Cerintha has advised in relation to a SGD325m loan to Perennial China Retail Trust and the SGD470m loan facilities to Cambridge Industrial Trust.
Person.Publications: Cerintha is described as a "leading individual for Banking & Finance" - Chambers Asia 2009 Described by interviewees as: - "clever and experienced" - "a sharp and decisive property lawyer" - "an unshakeable banking lawyer with a specialism in real estate" who "has a thorough grounding in her subject"- "a real estate lawyer of no little skill and craft" Chambers Global, Guide to the World's Leading Lawyers

Person.Experience: Klaus has extensive experience in corporation tax advice, particularly in the financial sector. The focus of his practice is on international corporation tax structuring, mergers and acquisitions transactions, German fund taxation and tax advice of banks and financial services providers regarding the development of tailor-made tax-efficient financing solutions. In addition, he advises his clients on specific questions regarding the VAT treatment of financial services and input tax deduction. Klaus handled during his professional experiences several tax field audits and tax litigation proceedings successfully for his clients. He has published a handbook about German VAT taxation of banks and numerous articles in well-respected tax journals. He is also a speaker at tax related seminars on a regular basis.

Person.Experience: Frederique specialises in commercial and corporate litigation and arbitration. Her practice covers the full range of dispute resolution, including contractual liability, (financial) product liability, corporate litigation, banking litigation and professional liability. She has experience in legal proceedings before both national public courts and national and international arbitral tribunals. Frederique joined Allen & Overy in 2009 after studying at the [university].

Marcus specialises in mergers & acquisitions activities with particular experience in listed companies (public offers, public to private) as well as LBOs, MBOs, shareholder's agreements and joint-ventures.
Person.Publications: La transparence pose la délicate question de l'intention et de la preuve, La Tribune, 1 February 2011 (interview) Co-author Doit-on continuer à feindre la schizophrénie de l'administrateur représentant dans les faits un actionnaire ?, Les echos, 9 December 2010. Co-author Asymétrie d'information : le vrai garde-fou passe par la responsabilisation des acteurs, JCPG n° 17, 26 April 2010.

Person.Experience: Alexandre specialises in mergers and disposals of companies listed or not and general company advice for domestic and international clients. He also has a wide experience advising clients on takeover bids.

Jeanette is a partner in our London office. She has significant experience advising underwriters, financial sponsors and companies in Rule 144A/Regulation S high yield bond offerings. Her experience extends to acquisition financings, bridge financings and restructurings. Find out more about Allen & Overy's high yield practice.

Dr. Daisy Walzel, a German qualified lawyer, joined Allen & Overy LLP in February 2010 as an associate in the German Competition practice following practical training at the Federal Ministry of Economics and the EU Commission (DG Comp). Her working experience covers EU and German merger control law, competition law topics related to distribution contracts, cartel investigations by the EU Commission and the German Federal Cartel Office and general compliance advice. Her practice includes a particular focus on antitrust compliance and she regularly conducts IT audits and trainings for clients in a wide range of business sectors.

Person.Experience: Jacob is counsel in our London office and his practice focuses on financial institution and private equity sponsor representation in high yield and leveraged finance buyout and recapitalisation transactions. He has broad experience negotiating the terms of high yield debt securities as well as syndicated credit facilities. Representative high yield and related transactional experience includes advising: - Citi and Deutsche Bank on a fully negotiated high yield offering by Calik Holding. - M&G International on its fully negotiated high yield offering (including the restructuring of such offering from unsecured to secured financing). - A financial sponsor on a CHF1.5bn fully negotiated pari bank/bond acquisition commitment for Orange Switzerland. - Vedanta Resources plc as borrower in connection with its $1.5bn high yield bridge facility in an LBO of Cairn India Limited. - UBS and Deutsche Bank on Citco's $490,000,000 senior secured term loan. - JP Morgan and the other lead arrangers on BHP Billiton's $45bn multicurrency term and revolving facility in a tender offer for Potash Corp. of Saskatchewan. - Citi, Merrill Lynch and the other joint lead arrangers on LyondellBasell Industries' $12.45bn (approx) senior secured credit facilities and $8bn senior second-lien bridge loan in an LBO by Access Industries. - Citi, Deutsche Bank and the other joint lead arrangers on Clear Channel Communications' $16bn (approx) cash flow and asset-based senior secured credit facilities and $2.3bn (approx) senior cash-pay and toggle notes in an LBO by Bain and Thomas H. Lee (and related litigation). - Citi and the other joint lead arrangers on Texas Competitive Electric Holdings Company's (TXU) $24.5bn senior secured credit facilities and Oncor Electric Delivery Company LLC's $2bn senior secured credit facility in an LBO by KKR and TPG (and related "amend and extend" amendment). - Citi, Credit Suisse and the other joint lead arrangers on First Data Corporations's $15bn (approx) senior secured credit facilities and $9bn senior and senior subordinated bridge loans in an LBO by KKR. - JP Morgan, Royal Bank of Scotland the the other joint lead arrangers on Cengage Learning Acquisitions' $3.74bn senior secured credit facilities and $2.275bn (approx) holdco PIK bridge loan and senior and senior subordinated notes in an LBO by Apax (and post-closing incremetal loan under such senior secured credit facilities). - Citi, Deutsche Bank and the other joint lead arrangers on U.S. Foodservice's $3.24bn cash flow and asset based senior secured credit facilities and $1.55bn senior and senior subordinated bridge loans in an LBO by Clayton, Dubilier & Rice and KKR.

Elaine is the head of Allen & Overy LLP’s U.S. Antitrust practice and co-head of the Global Antitrust practice. She has a broad antitrust practice covering antitrust litigation, mergers and acquisitions, and antitrust counseling. She has handled matters in a wide range of industries, including pharmaceuticals and healthcare, banking and financial services, engineering, energy, oil and gas, other natural resources, chemicals, insurance, telecommunications, defense electronics, cable, advertising, paper, leisure and retail sales, agricultural products, shipping, and vitamins. She has been featured in Chambers USA, PLC Which Lawyer?, The International Who’s Who of Competition Lawyers, and Euromoney’s Guide to the World’s Leading Competition and Antitrust Lawyers. Elaine has an active practice before the U.S. Department of Justice (DOJ) and the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) representing merging parties in connection with mergers, acquisitions and joint ventures, as well as companies in non-merger investigations, and she is particularly experienced in coordinating U.S., European, and other foreign antitrust clearances on complex cross-border deals. Elaine also has an active antitrust litigation practice and represented Experian and Saudi Aramco in recent cases. In addition, she regularly advises companies on business conduct, including worldwide distribution and licensing arrangements, patent pools, information exchanges and benchmarking, and represents companies facing conduct investigations by U.S. government antitrust authorities and parallel proceedings in other jurisdictions. Prior to joining Allen & Overy, Elaine was a partner in the New York office of a major New York-based international law firm, where she was executive partner for Diversity, and was a founding member of that firm’s Women’s Network Committee. Elaine is a member of the American Bar Association (Antitrust section) and the New York State Bar Association (executive committee, Antitrust Law section). She is also a member of the editorial board of the ABA’s Competition Laws Outside the United States, a former associate editor of the Antitrust Law Journal, and a former member of the Antitrust and Trade Regulation Committee of the Association of the Bar of the City of New York. She is a frequent speaker at antitrust conferences and seminars.

Co-author, 'Antitrust Aspects of Reverse Engineering,' Intellectual Property Antitrust 1993, published by the Practising Law Institute, 1993, with David Bender.

Person.Experience: Simon's practice focuses on special situations – complex disputes of significant financial or reputational risk. His emphasis is on clients in banking and financial services. He has been conducting commercial litigation and managing legal teams in multi-jurisdictional actions based out of Hong Kong for over 19 years. Simon regularly acts for banks and securities brokerages, market intermediaries and professional service providers in connection with disputes and regulatory investigations pursued by the Hong Kong Monetary Authority and the Securities and Futures Commission.

Person.Experience: Aaron specialises in public and private mergers and acquisitions, equity investments, joint ventures and foreign investment and general corporate advice. He has over 15 years' M&A experience in both investment banking and law. Aaron brings a commercial perspective to delivering practical solutions and advice to complex transactions. Aaron has advised on transactions across a wide range of industries. He has advised on a number of Australia's most significant transactions, the most recent being his advising SABMiller on its hostile takeover bid for Fosters, which is M&A Deal of the Year - 2012 Insto Distinction Award. The Asia Pacific Legal 500 2012 recognises "'the great' Aaron Kenavan" as a key individual.

Simone, a German Rechtsanwältin, joined Allen & Overy LLP in November 2010 as an associate in the Frankfurt corporate department. She advises national and international corporations, investors and financial institutions on all aspects of German corporate and insolvency law, in particular in relation to general companies, stock corporation and transformation law and accompanied in addition several M&A transactions. A main focus of her practice is the corporate restructuring of insolvency threatened companies.

Daniel is the Managing Partner of Ginting & Reksodiputro. He specialises in banking, finance and major projects, corporate and capital markets. He has worked on structuring financing transactions, acquisition financing, project development (coal, toll roads, power), mergers and acquisitions of banks and financial institutions, debt restructuring and capital markets deals. He has been involved in devising financing structures, drafting terms sheets, loan agreements, restructuring agreements, security documents and other transaction documents, as well as assisting clients in negotiating project proposals with government officials. He has also spent a seven-month period working in the Credit Recovery Unit of The Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation Limited in Jakarta.

Agata specialises in corporate and commercial and law and labour law. She has been involved in a number of M&A projects, recently in the insurance sector. She also has experience in derivative transactions and has represented financial institutions in litigation proceedings.

Kai has wide and general experience advising on a range of international and national capital markets transactions, with an emphasis on regulatory aspects, structured products and derivative solutions (institutional, wholesale and retail), restructuring and insolvency, and bank M&A matters. He has extensive experience in litigation and in the management and effective resolution of disputes arising in these areas.

Person.Experience: Christian advises on complex national and cross-border M&A transactions and core corporate matters (particularly stock corporation law (AktG) and group law – Konzernrecht). He joined Allen & Overy LLP in 2010 as a partner in the Düsseldorf Corporate department. His clients are mainly listed stock corporations and private equity investors. Previously, he was a partner at another well-known international law firm.

Person.Experience: Dr Murad M. Daghles is a member of the Corporate pratice group at Allen & Overy. He advises national and international corporations on complex national and cross-border M&A transactions as well as on German corporate, take-over and related capital market law and corporate governance matters. Dr Murad M. Daghles also specialises in corporate litigation matters, i.e. post M&A disputes, disputes between shareholders, and respresents companies or members of management boards in legal disputes in relation to management affairs and executive compensation. Dr Murad M. Daghles completed his doctorate on legal questions of Islam in Germany.

Person.Experience: Silke Justen has been working as a dispute resolution lawyer since 2005 and as a counsel at Allen & Overy since 2011. She represents clients in state courts and arbitration proceedings, often in cross-border disputes. She focuses on banking and capital market law disputes, in particular on the fields of investment advice and credit security law. In addition, she is regularly involved in post-M&A disputes, mostly in the arbitration context. She also has particular expertise in reinsurance and insurance law, and especially in D&O insurance and in director's liability cases. In this context she regularly advises clients on conducting internal audits for identifying breaches of duty or identifying and securing evidence with a view to potential proceedings.
Person.Publications: Justen S., Busse D. (2007) "Stahl, Mayenburg, Englisches Rückversicherungsrecht and the London Market - Standardprobleme in Beispielsfällen", reviewed in SchiedsVZ 2007, page 158-159 Justen S., Busse D., Taylor P. (2008) "Rückversicherungsschiedsgerichtsbarkeit in Deutschland - Gegenwärtiger Stand und Entwicklungen in 8 Thesen", article in Zeitschrift für Schiedsverfahren, page 1 – 9

Person.Experience: Dr Daniel Busse, LL.M. (Columbia University), a German Rechtsanwalt and Frankfurt-based partner, heads Allen & Overy's German Dispute Resolution practice. He deals solely with dispute resolution, with a particular focus on arbitration. He represents clients in state court and arbitration proceedings and has an in-depth knowledge of private international law issues and transnational litigation (jurisdiction, service, taking of evidence, enforcement). He frequently also acts as arbitrator (party-appointed, sole arbitrator, chairman) in ad hoc and institutional arbitration proceedings. Daniel has advised clients in cases involving national and international commercial law (including the law on commercial agents), with a major focus on banking litigation. He also frequently deals with corporate (especially "post M&A") disputes and insurance/reinsurance matters, mostly in an arbitration context. He speaks regularly at conferences and publishes regularly on arbitration and related issues in various leading German and English legal journals.

Jason is a banking and finance partner based in Sydney. Jason has a leading market reputation in the structured and asset financing field, and has also acted on a wide range of syndicated, property, leveraged and other corporate debt financing transactions. Jason has been voted by his peers as one of Australia's Best Lawyers in each year 2008 to 2012 in Banking & Finance and in Aviation. Chambers Asia Pacific 2012 recognises him as a "highly regarded banking and finance partner, with particular experience and expertise in asset financing and cross-border work". The Asia Pacific Legal 500 2012 recommends Jason and the "excellent" banking and finance team, which is "commended generally for its 'quality advice and depth of market knowledge'."

Karolina is a capital markets lawyer and her expertise spans across the entire debt capital markets, acting in connection with secured and unsecured funding transactions. Karolina specialises in securitisation and, with the recent introduction of enabling legislation, in covered bonds. She has significant experience across residential mortgage-backed and asset-backed securities in domestic, US (both SEC-registered and Rule 144A offerings) and Euro markets, acting for all participants involved including originators, issuers, trustees and investors. Karolina has extensive experience across a range of asset classes including residential mortgages (prime, low doc and no doc), commercial property mortgages, reverse mortgages, credit cards, trade receivables, dealer floorplan financings, motor vehicle and equipment leases and hire purchases and chattel mortgages. She also has significant expertise acting for purchasers and sellers of pools of receivables (including securitised receivables) and securitised products. Karolina's experience includes acting in connection with the establishment and maintenance of, and issuances under, unsecured debt programmes as well as structured derivatives, cash flow financing and general banking and finance. For many years Karolina's team has been regarded as top tier in securitisation and debt capital markets. The team was awarded IFLR Asia 2013 Securitisation and Structured Finance Team of the Year. Karolina has been acknowledged as a "Leading Lawyer" for Capital Markets – structured finance and securitisation in IFLR 1000 Australia, where Allen & Overy is ranked Tier 1. Legal 500 Australia 2013 says that Karolina is the "go-to person for covered bonds" and Chambers Asia Pacific 2012 notes the "multi-talented Karolina Popic handles both debt work and securitisation transactions. Sources say 'she has a good depth of experience and sound technical ability'." Karolina actively participates in the Australian Securitisation Forum (ASF) and the work of its sub-committees. She is a member of the ASF's Education Committee. Karolina also sits on the New South Wales Regional Council of the Financial Services Institute of Australasia (FINSIA).

Michael Reede is a corporate partner who focuses on M&A and major commercial transactions acting for private equity and hedge funds and other financial sponsors and corporations in industries characterised by significant levels of regulation (including telecommunications and aviation) or technology (including the CMT and life sciences sectors). He has advised many clients addressing the challenges of structural change in their core industries. Michael has worked on projects across the Asia Pacific region. Michael has been identified as a leading lawyer in Asia’s Leading Lawyers, Chambers Global, the Asia Pacific Legal 500 and Australia’s Best Lawyers.

David is a leading lawyer whose expertise spans public and private mergers and acquisitions, equity investments, joint ventures, foreign investment and general corporate advice. He also has a specialised interest in financial services M&A, funds management, real estate and infrastructure transactions with particularly outstanding corporate, real estate and fund-raising skills. Chambers Asia Pacific 2012 recognises that "David 'understands commercial rationale and related legal issues. He takes a personal approach to advice'. He handles real estate and infrastructure work, as well as M&A and funds matters". Chambers Global notes that David acts for a number of large multinational clients and that his practice covers domestic and international real estate funds work. The Asia Pacific Legal 500 ranks him as a leading lawyer.

Barry has a wide range of experience in the energy and resources sector, with a focus on mining, oil & gas, renewables and related infrastructure projects. He has advised clients in Australia and throughout the Asia-Pacific region. Barry has been involved in a range of substantial cross-border transactions including structuring new projects, project acquisitions and disposals, joint ventures, design engineering and construction, contract mining, mining and oilfield services, marketing arrangements, commodities sale and purchase contracts, the negotiation of concessions with governments and has assisted his clients on applicable legislative regimes (including those dealing with foreign investment in various jurisdictions). Barry is a member of the Mining Law Committee which forms part of the Section on Energy, Natural Resources and Infrastructure Law of the International Bar Association. In this capacity, Barry is one of the principal contributors to the Model Mining Development Agreement initiative. The Asia Pacific Legal 500 2012 recommends "the very responsive and knowledgeable" Barry as a leading practitioner in the energy and resources sector. He is named as one of the leaders of the field amongst the world's mining lawyers in the International Who's Who Legal 2011. Barry has been voted by peers as one of Australia's Best Lawyers (2011 and 2012) in Mining.
Person.Publications: Barry is the author responsible for the chapter on Australia in Minerals and Mining, a book to be published by Globe Law and Business Publishing on mining laws around the world. Barry has been appointed co-editor of Foreign Investment Regulation in Australia published by LexisNexis Australia, a leading commentary which provides a complete guide to the legal aspects of foreign investment regulation in Australia for investors and others, including an overview of foreign investment, and annotations to the Foreign Acquisitions and Takeovers Act 1975.

Person.Experience: Andrew has a wealth of experience in tax advisory, including international tax, corporate tax, cross-border investment and corporate structures, infrastructure financing, funds management and financial products. He is considered an industry leader in advising on the income tax implications of structured finance transactions and other financial products and is the adviser of choice for many leading global investment banks. Andrew has been recognised in a number of leading legal directories, including The International Who's Who of Business Lawyers - Corporate Tax 'Leader in their field 2009' and PLC Which Lawyer?, Guide to the World's Leading Tax Advisers. Chambers Asia Pacific 2012 recognises that Andrew "has been described as 'one of the finest tax lawyers in practice', noted for his 'intensive experience of the market and ability to connect legal knowledge and commercial sense'. He has deep expertise in the tax implications of structured finance transactions and other financial products." Chambers Global notes Andrew's "incisive advice and detailed knowledge". Andrew has been voted by peers as one of Australia's Best Lawyers each year from 2008 to 2012 for Tax.

Grant is a corporate advisory / M&A partner who specialises in private equity and venture capital transactions, share and business acquisitions, capital management and complex equity arrangements. He has extensive experience across a range of private equity transactions having advised many of the most successful private equity investment houses investing in Australia, the Asia-Pacific region and the UK. Grant is qualified in both Australia and the UK and worked in London for a number of years before relocating to Sydney. Chambers Asia Pacific 2012 recognises that he "has 'very solid private equity expertise' noted interviewees. He advises domestic and international private equity houses on a range of transactions." The Asia Pacific Legal 500 2012 recommends Grant in the corporate and M&A area. He is noted as a "rising star" in Australasian Legal Business' Private Equity Guide 2009.

Meredith practises in the areas of corporate, commercial and energy and resources law and has advised on a wide range of commercial transactions, including takeovers, mergers, acquisitions, disposals, capital raisings and joint ventures. She has conducted comprehensive compliance and due diligence programs in those areas. Meredith has considerable experience in offshore transactions, having advised on a number of AIM, LSE, TSX and JSE listings and offshore capital raisings. She also advises on acquisitions and raisings by foreign entities in Australia. Meredith has been voted by peers as one of Australia's Best Lawyers each year from 2010 to 2012 for Corporate work. Chambers Asia Pacific 2012 ranks Meredith in the Equity Captial Markets area: "Meredith is recognised for providing 'an exceptional service and complete value-adding support'."

Tim Spranger, a German Rechtsanwalt who has joined Allen & Overy LLP in 2011, is advising in all national and international tax matters with a special focus on real estate transactions and tax (re-)structuring of multinational groups.
Person.Publications: RdF-Workshop "Basel III" am 10.05.2012 in Frankfurt a.M., Recht der Finanzinstrumente, 4.2012

A chapter on Indonesian aviation regulations and their implementations,included in an international publication 'Aircraft Finance: Registration,Security & Enforcement' published by Sweet and Maxwell (2009).

Person.Experience: Peter’s practice consists of a wide range of corporate, corporate finance, and commercial matters, with particular expertise in mergers and acquisitions and joint ventures. Peter has more than 10 years of experience working in these areas, with a particular focus on Luxembourg-related transactions. He was seconded to a FTSE 100 company in Luxembourg in 2006 and joined Allen & Overy in 2010. Peter regularly speaks at seminars in Luxembourg and the surrounding area on a broad range of topics, including recently M&A trends and directors’ duties under Luxembourg law.
Bogdan specialises in corporate and capital market transactions, including share acquisitions, mergers, public offerings and regulatory issues.
Marine advises on general banking matters. She joined Allen & Overy Luxembourg in 2011.

Kate has a broad range of finance experience including aircraft finance, rolling stock finance, leasing transactions, single lender and syndicated loan transactions, warehouse facilities, single and portfolio acquisitions, asset management agreements and corporate jet finance.

David, a German Rechtsanwalt, joined Allen & Overy in 2010 in the Hamburg office. Since then, David has gained experience in corporate transactions, advising German and international companies undertaking M&A projects as well as providing ongoing corporate law advice. He also deals with dispute resolution matters.

Thorsten is an associate in the Frankfurt Public and Environmental Law Group. Prior to joining Allen & Overy he was associate in a German law firm advising on environmental and planning law issues (with a particular focus on chemicals industry and mineral materials). Prior to his career as a lawyer, he was for 1.5 years a research assistant in the banking and capital markets team of another magic circle firm in Frankfurt am Main. With Allen & Overy Thorsten gained practical experience in planning and environmental law, with a focus on rail tracks regulation and permitting.

A Practionner’s Guide to Private Equity, City & Financial, April 2009 Collective work; co-author of a chapter dedicated to French regulations

Person.Experience: Susanne, admitted as attorney at law in the State of New York and a German Rechtsanwältin, is an associate in the Frankfurt office of Allen & Overy LLP. She joined the US capital markets group in July 2010 after working at a US law firm in London. She has extensive experience in advising investment banks in connection with equity, high yield debt and convertible bonds offerings.

Person.LanguagesSpoken: Slovak, English, German, Czech, Polish, French
Person.Experience: Juraj specialises in corporate, real estate and litigation law. He has advised on a number of mergers and acquisitions, arbitrations and litigations. His experience also includes advising on regulatory issues in the energy and pharmaceutical sectors. Juraj teaches EU Law at the Law Faculty of Comenius University in Bratislava and publishes articles on various aspects of Slovak and EU law.

Person.Publications: Financial Products Helpdesk 2007, Indonesian Jurisdiction, published by LawInContext (www.lawincontext.com)

Person.Experience: Isabel Tinsley joined Allen & Overy LLP in 2010 as an associate in the firm’s banking department, having previously worked at a US law firm in London. Isabel advises lenders and borrowers on a range of banking and finance transactions, including general and syndicated lending transactions, cross-border financial restructurings, and project and development financings in emerging markets. Isabel focuses in particular on real estate finance deals involving properties in Germany. She also has experience in banking litigation. Isabel has spent much of her life outside the UK in international environments and speaks French, Italian and German.

Charlotte is a Senior Professional Support Lawyer in Allen & Overy's London TMT group. She trained at Allen & Overy and became an associate in the team in 2000. She rejoined Allen & Overy in 2010 having spent six years working in the legal team at Accenture where she negotiated a wide variety of sourcing and procurement contracts and was the SME covering non-contentious IP in the UK. Charlotte has significant experience in, amongst other things, arrangements for the exploitation of intellectual property, outsourcing and procurement transactions, IT/technology law, and system build and integration agreements. She also advises on non-contentious intellectual property and data protection issues. She assists the commercial/outsourcing group with complex research, training (internal and external) and legal know-how support on transactions and also continues to do some client facing work, primarily of a supervisory nature.

Tobias specialises in employment and law and is head of the Employment & Benefits group in Allen & Overy's Düsseldorf office. He is a qualified German lawyer (Rechtsanwalt) and a certified Employment Law Specialist (Fachanwalt für Arbeitsrecht). He advises national and international companies on all issues relating to individual and collective employment law, incentives, company pension matters and data protection/privacy law. He focuses in particular on advising on complex transactions, reorganisations and the restructuring of corporate groups (matrix), on cross-border projects and in distressed and insolvency situations. Tobias has extensive experience in compliance projects and is recognised as a leading expert in occupational health and safety management. Tobias is also admitted as a solicitor in England and Wales. Tobias acts as moderator of the "HR Compliance" forum on Xing, which now has almost 1000 members, who are company representatives interested in the subject. He also hosts two international online groups on German employment law. Tobias regularly publishes articles in leading national and international industry journals, periodicals and legal books in the fields of employment law and human resources, recently discussing the effects of the new rules on temp agency employees, the employment law aspects of compliance systems and occupational health and safety management. He is valued and recommended by event managers and companies as both a seminar leader and speaker.

Person.Experience: Adrian specialises in banking and real estate projects. He has advised on numerous real estate finance, project finance, Islamic finance, joint venture and leasing transactions, both domestic and cross border.

Elke is a German-qualified lawyer who specialises in German and European competition and regulatory law with particular experience in merger control, cartels, restrictive practices and abuses of dominance. Prior to joining Allen & Overy, Elke practised competition law with a large European-focused law firm in Brussels. In addition to her private practice, Elke has completed an internship with DG Competition. She is admitted in Berlin, listed as a European lawyer with the Brussels bar and she is a member of the Studienvereinigung Kartellrecht.

Person.Experience: Knut, a German Rechtsanwalt and admitted as attorney at law in the State of New York, joined Allen & Overy LLP in September 2010. He previously worked with an international law firm in Frankfurt and New York. He has extensive experience in capital market transactions, e.g. capital increases, rights offerings, IPOs and convertible and exchangeable bond issues.

Person.Experience: Katarína heads the Employment practice in Bratislava. She regularly advises employers in a wide variety of industry sectors on the full range of employment law issues, both contentious and non-contentious. She has significant experience in employment restructurings, international assignments, and employee transfers and redundancies (including group lay-offs). Katarína drafts internal policies (company handbooks) and employment and management agreements. She also advises on benefit/incentive schemes, the employment aspects of acquisitions, and data protection regulations. Katarína is a member of the Employment and Social Affairs Committee of the American Chamber of Commerce in Slovakia, and regularly conducts client seminars and speaks at conferences on various employment law issues.

Laura focuses on intellectual property and bankruptcy litigation. She has represented clients in trademark, trade secret, copyright and patent matters, as well adversary proceedings in chapter 11 proceedings and cross border proceedings under chapter 15 of the U.S. Bankruptcy Code. Her matters have covered a wide range of technologies, including specialized insurance products, telecommunications devices, servers, operating systems and software. Laura also has experience in complex commercial litigation at the trial and appellate level, including the drafting of complaints and answers, briefing motions to dismiss, preparing and responding to discovery requests, defending fact and expert depositions, as well as writing motions for summary judgment.
Person.Publications: Co-author, "Second Circuit applies SLUSA to preclude class claims by investors in Madoff 'feeder funds,'" Allen & Overy Publication, September 25, 2013 Co-author, "Supreme Court raises the bar on class actions: Wal-Mart Stores, Inc. v. Dukes," Allen & Overy Publication, June 22, 2011

Person.Experience: Pablo is head of the Madrid Public law and Regulated Sectors Department. He has wide experience in advising the Administration and private entities in questions related to telecommunications, media, energy, transport, gambling, infrastructure, public procurement and public law litigation. He is a State Lawyer since 1990 and in 1996 was appointed junior minister of the Public Works Ministry, which held the competences over the infrastructure, telecommunications and transport sectors. In this period he become a member of the Board of Directors of RENFE, AENA and GIF. He is the author of numerous publications on the sectors previously mentioned. Pablo is highly recommended for his excellent work in the main legal directories such as Chambers & Partners.

Person.Experience: Jean-Yves specialises in the structuring and financing of foreign and French real estate investments and has developed a particular expertise with respect to French REITs, OPCIs, Anglo-Saxon and Islamic funds. He advises many listed real estate companies and foreign funds on their real estate investment transactions in France and abroad. He acts as an adviser of the French property federation (FSIF) on tax matters. Since 2003, Jean-Yves has also been involved in the first real estate transactions carried out by Islamic investors in France and he has been one of the key contacts of the Ministry of Finance in relation to the adoption of new regulations adapting French taxation to the requirements of Islamic finance. He is a member of the Islamic Finance Commission set up by Paris Europlace.
Person.Publications: Co-author Projet de réforme des société de personnes : éclairages et incertitudes, Busines Immo, February 2011. Articles in Tax Notes International, Option Finance, Business Immo

Person.Experience: Sophie advises French real estate listed companies (SIICs) and foreign investments funds, and provides assistance in the scope of tax litigation.
Person.Publications: Co-author Projet de réforme des sociétés de personnes : éclairages et incertitudes, Business Immo, February 2011. Articles in the Lettre de l'Immobilier (Option Finance)

Tax Notes International', vol 53 n°2, Practical effectiveness of beneficial ownership clauses in France's tax treaties, co-author with Mr. Stéphane Austry and Mr. Stéphane Gelin, 2009.
Article also published in France in the Revue de Jurisprudence Fiscale, vol. 12/08 and in Japan in the Zeidai Journal, vol. 13 Feb. 2010.
'French commissionaire: a PE for its foreign principal?', Tax Notes International, vol. 47 n°6, co-author with Mr Stéphane Gelin, 2007.
Tax Management International Forum, BNA International, various contributions for France since 2006.

Person.Experience: Jean-Christophe has French domestic as well as international experience on acquisition leverage financing, acting for both financing providers (senior or subordinated) and sponsors and borrowers. In addition to other general banking matters, he has also been involved in restructuring transactions.

Angus is actively involved in the energy industry and its associations, and has advised an array of energy and resources clients on a broad range of matters and projects. He has been involved in advising in relation to projects and transactions in the UK, Norway, Indonesia, Singapore, Brunei, Japan, China, Turkey, Mauritania, South Africa, Argentina, Korea, Papua New Guinea and in each state of Australia. Angus is particularly skilled in contractual issues and negotiations and he has advised extensively in relation to the gas and power industries. He advises producers, generators, operators, purchasers and government. In relation to major projects, he has advised: Australia's North West Shelf Project; Anadarko; BG Group; BHP Billiton; Brunei LNG; Chevron; Encana; ExxonMobil; Hess; Inpex; Kansai Electric; Mitsubishi; Mitsui; PTTEP; Rio Tinto; Santos; Shell; Total; Vermilion and Woodside. Angus' broad industry knowledge and reputation was recognised when he was appointed by the Attorney-General of Western Australia to the panel of senior practitioners comprising the State's Gas Review Board. Angus is regularly recognised as a Leading Individual in Energy and Natural Resources, including by Chambers legal directory in each publication since 2002-2003 and Australia's 'Best Lawyers' in each of the categories of Energy, Natural Resources and Oil & Gas. In addition, he was named the 'Best Lawyers' 2012 Perth Natural Resources "Lawyer of the Year" and 2013 Perth Energy "Lawyer of the Year". Chambers Asia Pacific 2012 notes that Angus is "a recognised specialist in the gas and power industries". Additional recognition from Chambers: "Angus Jones is a specialist in the oil and gas sector and has particular expertise in LNG projects". Clients note his "collaborative and approachable style" and "excellent intuitive feel for what you are trying to achieve". The Asia Pacific Legal 500 2012 recognises Angus as an "oil and gas specialist".
Rebecca, admitted as attorney at law in the State of New York, is an Associate in the Frankfurt office of Allen & Overy. She joined the US Capital Markets Group in September 2010.

Karoly is heading the Hungarian banking group. He focuses on complex domestic and international banking and finance transactions ranging from consumer products and services through corporate finance transactions and derivatives to real estate and project finance as well as workout transactions. Karoly regularly advises leading financial institutions such as CIB Bank, Citigroup, ING Bank, HSBC, KBC Group and OTP Bank. Karoly is highly recommended by leading benchmark publications and was referred to as "one of the brightest banking and finance lawyers in Hungary" by IFLR 1000.

Victoria Martín has more than 12 years experience in all kind of contentious and non contentious Administrative Law matters. In particular, her expertise is focused on public procurement, infrastructures, transports, telecommunications, media, energy and gambling. She has been successfully involved in the most relevant contentious-administrative proceedings issued by or concerning to the companies operating in such sectors. She is responsible, likewise, for providing them with full assistance on all their concerns on public law issues. Victoria has followed the Doctorate courses in Administrative Law, holds a Master in Public Management and she used to be a visiting researcher of Harvard University. She has been for more than ten years an Associated Teacher of Administrative Law at Universidad Complutense of Madrid and regularly collaborates as speaker or lecturer in Public Law specialised seminars and conferences. Victoria is also author of several articles and chapter of books on her areas of expertise.

Person.Experience: Frank has experience in a wide range of corporate transactions in the areas of mergers and acquisitions, corporate restructuring, joint ventures, private equity, and PRC foreign direct investments and PRC outbound investments. Frank has advised listed and private multinationals, private equity funds and state-owned enterprises on transactions, frequently on a cross-border basis, in the automotive, food and beverage, financial services, healthcare, insurance, media and technology, mining and resources, power and real estate industries. Frank has worked in Australia and Singapore before relocating to Shanghai in 2004. He is qualified in Australia and is fluent in English and Mandarin.
Person.Publications: Directors' and Officers' Liability in the PRC', Executive Risks – A Boardroom Guide, Willis (2010)
Fortress Italy: Racial Politics and the New Immigration Amendment, 26 FORDHAM INT'L L.J. 1438

Person.Experience: Yanis is an associate in corporate department of Allen & Overy Legal Services. Yanis has participated in advising both Russian and foreign companies on various aspects of Russian corporate, commercial and securities law, including regulatory issues, in connection with capital raising deals as well as mergers and acquisitions of companies. He has also participated in a number of due-diligence exercises on Russian companies in connection with IPOs, SPOs and M&A transactions.

Caroline specialises in commercial and corporate litigation and arbitratrion. Her practice covers the full range of dispute resolution including contractual liability, (financial) product liability, corporate litigation, banking litigation and professional liability. She is involved in legal proceedings before both national public courts and national and international arbitral tribunals. Caroline gratuated from [university] in 2011 and joined Allen & Overy in August 2011.

Harun is a partner of Ginting & Reksodiputro. He mainly practices in the areas of corporate and commercial law, including public and private M&A, joint ventures, corporate restructurings and dispositions, investment and divestment. He focuses on investors doing business in Indonesia through direct investment or the capital markets.

Olivier specialises in corporate law. He has experience across a wide range of areas including mergers and acquisitions, joint ventures, fund structuring, equity capital markets and corporate restructuring. Olivier joined Allen & Overy in October 2011 after graduating from Utrecht University and Durham University (UK).

Person.Experience: Christoph, a German Rechtsanwalt and Attorney-at-Law (New York), joined Allen & Overy LLP's Frankfurt office in January 2011 as an Associate in the Corporate Department. He has previously worked with another major international law firm. He has advised a broad range of clients on domestic and cross-border transactions including mergers, acquisitions, joint ventures and real estate.
Person.Publications: "Recent Efforts to Amend the System of Airport Slot Allocation in the European Union", German Journal of Air and Space Law 2011, page 449 et seq.

Person.Experience: Sören joined Allen & Overy as an Associate in 2011. The focus of his activities lies on providing employment law advice on transactions and business transfers as well as on all issues of individual and collective employment law, including conducting legal proceedings, advising on draft agreements and disputes regarding works constitution and co-determination law issues. Before joining Allen & Overy, Sören was a research associate in the employment law practice group of another international law firm.
Person.Publications: Markulf Behrendt, Sören Seidel (2011) "Mitarbeiter richtig informieren", Arbeit und Arbeitsrecht, page 704 et seq.

Person.Experience: Jim focuses on patent litigation as well as intellectual property due diligence and transactional matters. In particular, he has significant experience litigating patent cases in the electrical engineering and computer science area. Such cases have involved, among others, redirection software, laptop computers, and mobile phones. Jim also has significant experience representing clients in patent litigation in the chemical, pharmaceutical and biotechnology industries. In the chemical and biotech areas, he has represented clients in litigations concerning DNA microarrays, labeling reagents, and immunochemical detection systems. In the pharmaceutical area, he has been involved in several Hatch-Waxman litigations. Jim also has experience in trademark and trade secrets disputes. Jim's practice is international in scope, and he has litigated in courts across the country, and in international arbitrations in Switzerland and Germany. He has significant experience in litigation in popular patent forums, including the Eastern District of Texas, Delaware, the Western District of Wisconsin, and the ITC. In the transactional area, Jim's experience includes advising investment banks, private equity firms, and corporations on the intellectual property aspects of mergers, acquisitions, and other corporate transactions. As part of this transactional work, he has reviewed patent portfolios and outstanding patent litigations for leveraged buyout and takeover candidates, and has advised on other aspects of companies' IP portfolios.
Person.Publications: Co-author, 'The America Invents Act – Provisions of Interest to Litigators,' New York Intellectual Property Law Association Bulletin. Scheinfeld and Parker H. Bagley (with the assistance of James P. Barabas), 'Amazon.com Loses in Court: The Difficulties of Obtaining Preliminary Injunctions', New York Law Journal (May 23, 2001)

Person.Experience: Gautam’s practice focuses on representing senior banks, hedge funds and mezzanine investors in complex structured and leveraged finance transactions in South Asia and South East Asia with a principal geographical focus on India, Indonesia and Singapore. He worked in London and New York before moving to Singapore in 2006. Gautam has advised on numerous complicated structured outbound and inbound investment transactions in South East Asia, including many involving Indian and Indonesian sponsors. He has also advised on various LBO transactions in Indonesia and in Singapore.
Person.Publications: The Legality of Options and Futures Derivatives in India, 19 SEBI & CORP. L (India). 52 (1999). Taxation of Specualatives under the Income Tax Act- An analysis of Options and Futures, 102 TAX (India), 267 (1999). With Professor Andreas Lowenfeld, Documents on International Finance: International Business Transactions, New York University, (2000).

Person.Experience: Vera, a specialist in employment law, is an senior associate working in the Employment and Benefits group. She advises German and international companies in individual and collective employment law, in particular with regard to drafting of employment contracts, temporary agency work, employment litigation and transactions.

Person.Experience: Francisco has broad experience advising in any type of corporate transactions either for listed and non listed companies in relation to corporate restructuring, M&A, takeover bids, issuance and listing of securities and joint ventures. Likewise, he has experience giving advice to credit entities in various areas like the provision of investment services and has participated in the creation of institutional protection systems and in the incorporation of private banks. He also has experience in drafting mercantile and corporate contracts. Finally, it should be highlighted his performance as secretary and vice-secretary of the board of directors of non listed companies.
Person.Publications: Co-author of "Contratos Mercantiles" Tomos I, II y III. Aranzadi, 2008, Pamplona.

Person.Experience: María has gained experience in Commercial Law, in particular in corporate and finance area, participating in a variety of mergers and acquisitions (M&A) transactions and financing transactions, including restructuring of debt and syndicated financing. She has participated in projects of infrastructures (Project Finance). María has experience in legal audit (due diligence).

Alfonso has gained experience in the banking and capital markets field. He has participated in numerous finance operations, including project finance and syndicated finance. In capital markets, Alfonso has advised collective investment institutions and investment services entities on contractual matters regarding financial products and services and financial derivative instruments. He has also advised leading financial institutions in banking contracting issues, securitisations, payment services and branching. He has also experience in banking and insurance regulation. Alfonso is a member of the Instituto de Empresa examination board.
Person.Publications: Revista de Derecho del Mercado de Valores, no. 6/2010 “Reglamento (CE) núm. 1060/2009 del Parlamento Europeo y del Consejo, de 16 de septiembre de 2009, sobre las agencias de calificación crediticia”.

Person.Experience: Tamara has working experience in different practices, in particular, debt and equity capital markets and corporate law. Tamara has advised both Russian and foreign investors on various aspects of corporate and commercial law in connection with M&A, potential IPOs, private placement, establishment of joint ventures and representative offices; advised on Russian environmental law in connection with construction of mining and production facilities, offshore construction of oil and gas facility in Russia.

Sophie specialises in corporate tax and international tax law and is involved in advising international companies on their tax matters. She graduated from the Law Firm School in March 2013. She is admitted to the Amsterdam Bar and an aspirant member of the Dutch Bar of Tax Advisors. Sophie graduated from the University of Amsterdam in 2011 and joined Allen & Overy in June 2011.

Roel specialises in international capital markets transactions. He has experience in advising both issuers and dealers on EMTN transactions and covered bond programmes. He furthermore advises both banks and companies on regulatory law matters. Roel joined Allen & Overy in 2011 after graduating from the Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam (LL.M. Corporate Law) and Leiden University (LL.M. Civil law).

Benjamin is a partner and the head of the China IP practice for Allen & Overy. He has over 15 years of experience in protecting IP in China, U.S. and Europe. A native Chinese and U.S. trained patent lawyer, he concentrates on representing multinational companies in protecting, licensing, and enforcing IP rights in China and Chinese companies in resolving IP disputes outside China. With the unique combination of a Ph.D. in chemistry and strong expertise in international IP disputes, he is a trusted advisor to world’s top companies on IP issues. His representative matters include: acting as lead counsel for multinational companies in patent infringement suits in China, including defense of Nokia in patent infringement suits brought by Qualcomm in China and handling of infringement suits against Chinese generic companies on behalf of global pharmaceutical companies; acting as lead IP counsel for complex technology transactions; advising Global 500 companies on IP licensing strategies and IP strategies for R&D activities in China; and resolving patent infringement disputes for Chinese companies outside China. Benjamin is a prolific writer and frequent speaker on intellectual property issues. He has been an invited speaker on China IP issues around the world and has lectured extensively in the U.S., Europe, and China. He also has written numerous articles on IP protection in China and has more than a dozen scientific publications to his credit.

Wipawat is an associate in the banking and finance practice. Her experiences include corporate financing and capital market transactions as well as advising on legal issues relating to regulations of the Thai SEC, SET and BOT.

Marieke specialises in banking and finance law with a particular focus on global loans, securitisations, project finance, syndicated (un)secured corporate lending, asset finance and leveraged finance transactions. She acts for both banks and borrowers and on domestic and cross-border deals. She regularly advises large financial institutions including ABN AMRO, ING and Rabobank. Marieke joined Allen & Overy in September 2011 after graduating from the University of Amsterdam.

Victoria has experience advising on employment and social security and expatriate including top executives relations, due diligence. She has participated in litigation proceces, negotiations, equality reports, collective agreements, employment contracts, termination agreements, relations with worker's representatives and integrate legal advising to national and international companies.

Bettina is a lawyer at Allen & Overy specialising in employment law. Bettina has extensive experience in all areas of individual and collective employment law. She advises German and international companies in particular in connection with reorganisations and restructurings, associated staff reduction measures and regarding co-determination rights. Moreover, she represents companies in proceedings before labour courts leading to a judgement or an order. Furthermore Bettina advises clients on collective bargaining and industrial action matters. She regularly publishes in the daily and specialized press.

Thomas is a partner specialising in employment law and is head of the global Employment practice at Allen & Overy as well as head of the German Employment & Benefits practice. He has extensive experience in all areas of employment law. Thomas advises companies in particular on restructuring, outsourcing projects, staff reduction measures and other adjustment processes. He supports these projects from the strategic planning stage right up to final implementation. Thomas has extensive experience in dealing with works councils and trade unions. His negotiations are characterised by his focus on achieving objectives and reaching solutions. Thomas is recognised as a leading expert in advising on collective bargaining and averting threatened industrial action. Clients and colleagues value his pragmatic approach and expertise in preparing and advising on labour-court cases. Thomas has repeatedly been named as a recommended specialist for employment law in Germany by JUVE, Chambers Europe (Volume 1) and PLC Which Lawyer. Since August 2011 he has been ranked among the "40 leading names in the sphere of human resources in Germany" (Personalmagazin, Haufe-Verlag (German HR journal)). He has been awarded Best Lawyers' 2013 Frankfurt am Main Labor and Employment "Lawyer of the Year" (in cooperation with Handelsblatt). Thomas regularly speaks and publishes on his specialist subjects, most recently focussing on issues of tariff and trade union plurality as in Lehmann, "Deutsche und europäische Tariflandschaft im Wandel" (as co-author). He is co-editor and co-author of "Beck'sches Formularbuch Arbeitsrecht", "Nomos Stichwortkommentar Arbeitsrecht" and co-author of Lukas/Dahl, "Konfliktlösung im Arbeitsleben".
Person.Publications: Ubber, T. (2013) co-author of "Deutsche und europäische Tariflandschaft im Wandel", Lehmann, Frankfurt Ubber, T. Person.Experience: Eduard specialises in matters in which intellectual property, technology, and ICT issues play a dominant role. He has advised a wide range of clients in a variety of transactions and litigious matters, which all revolved around complex (information) technology. He acquired in depth knowledge of database conversion technology which was at the centre of DeLaval's acquisition of Dutch software company Uniform Agri. In the acquisition of search engine Legal Intelligence by Wolters Kluwer, he evaluated the intellectual property aspects of the company's search engine technology. Also, he was involved in designing an IP structure in preparation of the acquisition of a multi-jurisdictional consumer electronics business. He has extensive experience working in tandem with technical personnel. His broad technical knowledge and quick grasp of underlying concepts allow him to bridge the gap between the legal and the technical. He joined Allen & Overy in 2011 after obtaining an LLM in Law and Technology, Cum Laude, at the University of Tilburg
Camilo advises on general corporate and investment funds matters. He joined Allen & Overy Luxembourg in 2011.

Frank is a leading expert in financial services regulation, with a special focus on the regulation of investment and asset managers. Together with his team, he advises clients on a broad range of regulatory requirements under the German Banking Act, the Securities Trading Act and the Investment Act. In addition to his ongoing advisory work, he has acted as lead partner for many outsourcing and M&A transactions in the financial services area. His relevant experience includes advising a large number of German investment managers on the establishment, management and restructuring of open-ended investment funds. Frank is recognised as a leading German investment funds lawyer by Juve, Legal 500 and PLC. Frank Herring "has a strong standing in the finance sector, especially in questions related to investment funds." – Chambers Europe 2011

Person.Experience: Detmar, a German Rechtsanwalt, works in Allen & Overy LLP’s Frankfurt office. Before joining Allen & Overy LLP in 2011 he worked for another leading international law firm and one of the big four auditing firms. He advises clients on a broad range of regulatory requirements. He focuses in particular on the Investment Act (license requirements, structure, set-up, risk management, eligibility of investments), Securities Trading Act, outsourcing, compliance matters, cross-border issues, banking regulation and other regulatory aspects (e. g. data protection, anti-money-laundering). He frequently advises national and international banks, investment services firms and investment managers on their implementation of new laws and regulations including investor protection acts, UCITS III, UCITS IV, MiFID, MiFID II, AIFMD and PRIPS. Furthermore, he advises on the structuring of financial products with a particular view on Solvency II. In addition, he led several investigative due diligences in the private equity sector. He publishes frequently on regulatory related issues in leading German journals and speaks at seminars.

Person.Experience: Valeska, a German Rechtsanwältin, works in Allen & Overy LLP's Frankfurt office. Before joining Allen & Overy LLP in April 2011 she worked for two other leading international law firms. Valeska advises in particular ETF/ETC clients with respect to their listings on German stock exchanges (regulated and regulated unofficial market), custody related questions – transfer of shares to Cleartream Banking Frankfurt from e.g. France/Ireland - and the delistings of ETFs/ETCs. She assisted banks, financial services firms and German investment funds in their establishment and the outsourcing of critical operational functions; her working area also covers the preparation of tied agents agreements and assisting German banks/financial services firms and EU-passported branches based in Germany on questions relating, inter alia, to the following German Acts: Securities Trading Act (WpHG), Anti Money Laundering Act (GwG), Banking Act (KWG): Securities Prospectus Act (WpPG) and Sales Prospectus Act (VerkProspG). In addition, Valeska is regularly involved in the registration of non-German UCITS and AIFs for distribution in Germany and is advising non-German investment companies on the sale of investment funds in Germany (e.g. negotiating distribution agreements, agreements with information and paying agencies, private placements of fund units, review of marketing material).

Person.Experience: Attila is a member of the firm's Central European Corporate group. He is specialized in EU and Hungarian competition law, and he also has a wide range of experience in intellectual property and regulatory matters. He previously worked for the European Commission's Competition Directorate. Attila is an author of a number of articles on competition law issues.

Sophie specialises in corporate law. Her experience includes advising on mergers and acquisitions, private equity transactions and general commercial and contract law. Sophie joined Allen & Overy in 2011 after graduating from University of Amsterdam in European and International Law (LL.M) and from King's College London in International Peace and Security (Msc). Sophie has advised 3i, DSM, Dong Energy and GE on various M&A transactions.

Person.Experience: Max Landshut advises international and domestic companies in all areas of corporate law, with a particular focus on M&A, joint ventures and restructurings. His clients range from publicly listed corporations and financial institutions to family-owned companies.

Adam has a wealth of experience advising on a range of structured financings and project financings, including advising sponsors and lenders on PPP transactions as well as resources, power, telecommunications and infrastructure finance transactions. He has acted for both lenders and borrowers in financings under secured, unsecured, syndicated and bilateral facilities as well as debt capital markets raisings and acquisition financings. Adam is listed in the International Who's Who of Project Finance Lawyers and has been voted by peers as one of Australia's Best Lawyers in each year 2009 to 2012 for the categories of Aviation, Banking & Finance and Equipment Finance. In addition, Adam was named as Best Lawyers' Sydney 'Equipment Finance Lawyer of the Year 2012'. Chambers Global 2013 recognises Adam as "an extremely strong finance lawyer who is very commercial with his advice as well as being technically excellent.”

Yukiko, a specialist in employment law, is an senior associate working in the Employment and Benefits group. She advises German and international companies on issues relating to individual and collective employment law, in particular in connection with the drafting of employment contracts, restructuring, representing clients in court, and transactions. Yukiko in particular has experience in advising Japanese companies. In this respect she benefits from her studies at Keio University, Tokyo and her experience in an internationally operating Japanese company. Yukiko is co-author of the industry journal "Zeitschrift für das öffentliche Arbeits- und Tarifrecht".
