Person.Experience: Rafael has wide experience in the different matters related with the IT Law including personal data protection, both in its contentious and non-contentious side, e-commerce and consumers protection law. He is specialized in matters related to personal data protection projects entailing international transfer of personal data, implementation of whistleblowing schemes and advising on the implementation of e-commerce projects. Rafael also advised in matters related with intellectual property law (propiedad intelectual and propiedad industrial) in its non-contentious side, software contracts and on the implementation of electronic money schemes. Rafael has been named one of the five Spanish leading lawyers for 2011 in data protection & privacy by Best Lawyers publication.
Person.Publications: Collaborator with the Spanish publications "Computing"

Person.Experience: Hans-Peter has been working as a legal adviser exclusively in the field of employment law for more than 15 years. He has extensive experience in all areas of employment law. He focuses in particular on employment law issues relating to restructurings, mergers, outsourcing projects and codetermination in companies. His activities include the strategic planning of structural measures and development of personnel solutions, including the drafting of possible structures together with the management team, and assisting in their implementation. He has supported our clients in negotiating and successfully concluding numerous reconciliations of interests and social plans with employee representatives, for instance. The finance and service industries represent his main areas of business. Our clients appreciate his negotiation strategy, with its focus on conflict resolution. Hans-Peter has been listed as one of the "leading senior partners for employment law" in the JUVE Handbook "German Commercial Law Firms" since 2006; he is also named as one of the recommended lawyers for employment law advice in Germany in the Chambers international legal directory. Hans-Peter regularly speaks and publishes on his specialist subjects, most recently on anti-discrimination, mergers and integration, and issues relating to business transfers. He is a permanent member of the editorial team for employment law of the industry journal "Betriebs-Berater".

Person.Experience: Arjen specialises in employment law. He has experience advising on various employment issues including individual and collective dismissals, transfer of undertaking, works council, outsourcing, equal treatment, employer liability and data protection. Arjen joined Allen & Overy in June 2011 after graduating from VU University Amsterdam in November 2010.

André is a German lawyer (Rechtsanwalt) at Allen & Overy and a certified specialist (Fachanwalt fuer Arbeitsrecht) in employment law. Since being admitted as a German Rechtsanwalt, André has worked exclusively in the field of employment law. He has extensive experience in all areas of individual and collective employment law. He advises international and German companies in particular in connection with restructuring and transferring businesses, outsourcing, staff restructuring measures, reconciliations of interests and social plans, actions against wrongful dismissal, employment due diligence, employment compliance, internal investigations, introducing codes of conduct, employee stock option plans, co-determination in companies and temporary agency work. André regularly speaks and publishes on his specialist subjects, in particular in the journals "ArbR Aktuell" and "juris PraxisReport Arbeitsrecht".

Person.Experience: Michael is a recognised specialist for private equity transactions and a member of the Private Equity group in Germany. He predominantly advises financial investors on buy-out transactions as well as corporate clients from a wide range of industries on all aspects of corporate law. Before joining Allen & Overy, he was a partner in another well-known international law firm focusing on private equity clients. Michael is a lecturer in corporate law at the Institute for Law and Finance of Goethe University Frankfurt as well as at the Frankfurt School of Finance & Management and regularly publishes and speaks on topics of corporate law and M&A.

Markus is an associate in the Corporate/M&A practice of Allen & Overy LLP. Markus specialises in cross-border and domestic M&A, corporate and securities law with a strong focus on private equity transactions. He is admitted as German Rechtsanwalt and as Attorney-at-Law (New York). He is author of a standard case book on German corporate law, co-author of a commentary on the German Stock Corporation Act, and a lecturer at HfB Business School Frankfurt. Markus earned a LL.M. degree from the University of Chicago and a doctorate degree from Humboldt-University at Berlin.

Achim advises both national and international insurance and reinsurance companies on domestic and cross-border transactions, on regulatory issues and on general corporate matters. He has particular experience in Contractual Trust Arrangements (CTA) and occupational pensions schemes. Achim is also experienced in insurance contract law, particularly in life insurance.

Person.Experience: Paveen is an associate in the corporate practice of the Bangkok office. He has broad experience working on a number of M&A transactions and securities law. He also has extensive experience in conducting legal due diligence exercises in various types of business.

Julien qualified as German Rechtsanwalt and joined the Hamburg corporate/real estate department of Allen & Overy LLP in 2011. He particularly concentrates on real estate transactions. Initially he completed his legal traineeship in Hamburg and Cape Town. As legal trainee Julien worked at the Federal High Court of Hamburg (Hanseatisches Oberlandesgericht) and supported the real estate department of an international law firm. He has gained practical experience in a range of real estate issues and M&A including real estate takeovers, real estate financing, renewable energies projects and other (cross-border) transactions.

Person.Experience: Zuzana leads the Intellectual Property practice in Bratislava. She has experience advising on various IP issues, including domain name recovery, licensing, software, anti-counterfeiting, electronic commerce and IP aspects of commercial transactions. Zuzana also advises on data protection matters, including data transfers, outsourcing, cloud computing and compliance. She worked for three years as a legal advisor in the European Commission where she handled issues related to the enforcement of intellectual property rights. Before joining Allen & Overy, Zuzana worked in the IP/media technology department of an international law firm in Hong Kong. She is a member of the Anti-Counterfeiting Committee of ECTA (European Community Trademark Association). Person.Experience: Charles’s Political Law practice focuses on advising multinational corporations and other entities on regulatory and compliance obligations in the areas of campaign finance law; the Lobbying Disclosure Act (LDA); state and local lobbying law; the Foreign Agents Registration Act (FARA); Municipal Securities Rulemaking Board (MSRB) Rule G-37; state and local pay-to-play law; and federal, state, and local law regulating gifts, entertainment, and governmental ethics. Charles’s clients include financial institutions, health insurers, private equity funds, airlines, and lobbying firms, and he regularly assists clients in developing compliance strategies and in building comprehensive compliance programs. Charles has taught classes on government ethics as a visiting faculty member at both Georgetown University Law Center and Harvard Law School. Charles’s Strategic Counseling practice focuses on matters involving the intersection of law and public policy. As part of his practice, Charles counsels individuals appointed to Executive Branch positions on federal conflict-of-interest, security clearance, and financial disclosure requirements and helps such appointees formulate strategies for resolving legal and political issues connected to their nomination. Charles frequently assists clients in crafting legislative and regulatory solutions to complex problems, and advises clients on the management of legislative and public policy risk. Charles also routinely participates in election law-related litigation, and has authored numerous appellate and U.S. Supreme Court briefs on redistricting and other political law issues. Charles also counsels financial services clients on legal issues arising from their relationships with public pension funds. In this regard, Charles regularly advises financial services firms on issues relating to the application of the federal Freedom of Information Act and state Public Records Acts to confidential business information provided to public sector entities and regulatory bodies. Charles’s practice also focuses on public policy issues relating to aggregate litigation. He has taken part in significant legislative initiatives at the federal and state level, including the passage of the Class Action Fairness Act of 2005, and he has filed numerous amicus briefs in state and federal courts on aggregate litigation issues. Charles also has been active in the area of international class actions. He has counseled clients on the development of aggregate litigation mechanisms in Europe and Asia, assisted clients in responding to European Commission proposals for new group litigation procedures, and advised on the defense of class actions brought in Canada and Australia.
Person.Publications: "Non-U.S. Issuers Selling Fund Interests In The United States," The Review of Securities & Commodities Regulation (July, 2012), with Barbara Stettner, Sam Brown and Claire Rajan "On the Road to Litigation Abuse: The Continuing Export of U.S. Class Action and Antitrust Law," presented at the U.S. Chamber Institute for Legal Reform 2006 Legal Reform Summit (Washington, D.C., October 2006) (co-author, John H. Person.Experience: Chris’ practice focuses primarily on advising financial institution clients, and specifically broker-dealers, investment advisers, private equity funds, and hedge funds on compliance with the federal securities laws and regulations and on compliance with the rules of the self-regulatory organizations (SROs), including the Financial Industry Regulatory Authority. Previously, Chris worked at the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) as an Attorney in the Division of Market Regulation. Chris also is a Certified Public Accountant who worked as an Audit Manager for the U.S. Government Accountability Office and as a Staff Accountant for KPMG Peat Marwick, where he obtained extensive accounting and financial regulatory experience. While at the SEC, Chris responded to requests from broker-dealers and self-regulatory organizations for interpretation, guidance, and no-action relief with regard to the SEC’s broker-dealer financial responsibility rules, including the net capital rule, the customer protection rule, the books and records rules and the financial reporting rules. In addition, Chris worked extensively on various SEC rulemaking efforts, including the adoption of a limited regulatory structure for dealers active in the over-the-counter derivatives market. Chris has extensive experience advising clients with respect to broker-dealer and investment adviser regulation. He routinely helps broker-dealers and investment advisers in registering with the SEC, the states and becoming members of SROs. Chris routinely advises clients on their supervisory procedures and compliance policies, and assists clients with the development of their policies and procedures. Chris has extensive experience with compliance reviews and audits as well as internal investigations. Chris also represents clients in enforcement actions before the SEC, SROs, the U.S. Attorney’s Offices, and the State Attorney General’s Offices. Chris was recognized in Chambers USA 2013 as a leading individual for Financial Services Regulation: Broker Dealer (Compliance). Clients commented Chris is, "remarkably dedicated to clients and is a strong advocate."

Person.Experience: Vera, a German qualified lawyer, joined Allen & Overy in August 2011 as an associate in the Hamburg Competition practice. She specializes in EU and German competition law and regularly advises on competition law issues such providing advice in complex merger control cases, defending clients in cartel investigations, executing compliance audits. Prior to joining Allen & Overy, Vera worked for international law firms in Düsseldorf and Munich.

Tony advises on a range of corporate and commercial transactions including capital raisings, mergers and acquisitions, privatisations and general securities law matters. Tony is listed as a leading lawyer in capital markets in Chambers Asia Pacific, IFLR 1000, Legal 500 (Asia Pacific), PLC Which Lawyer and the International Who's Who of Capital Markets Lawyers.He has been recognised by Legal 500 (Asia Pacific) as a 'knowledgeable' and 'accessible' team head [and] is a 'very experienced' practitioner. He has also been voted by his peers as one of Australia's Best Lawyers 2012 for Corporate/Governance. IFLR 1000 notes he is 'one of the next major rainmakers' and 'a safe pair of hands, reliable, extremely hard working, excellent knowledge of the relevant law and has great experience'.

María has a Law and Journalism Degree at Carlos III University of Madrid. María also has a Masters Degree on Advocacy and Legal Business Assessment at Carlos III University and Madrid BAR Association.
Person.Publications: María has collaborated in two publications: Madrid Update: The AEADE's global Bias, An Uncertain Future (September 2010 issue of Mealey's International Arbitration Report) Madrid Update: Arbitration Friendly: Madrid and Consumer Protection (December 2010 issue of Mealey's International Arbitration Report)

Person.Experience: Sara has studied a degree in Law and International Relations in the Comillas University of Madrid – 2011.

Aziz specialises in corporate law and is a deputy civil law notary. He has experience across a wide range of areas, including mergers and acquisitions, joint ventures, fund structuring, equity capital markets and corporate restructurings. Aziz joined Allen & Overy in September 2011 after graduating from VU University Amsterdam in April 2011.

Vorasaree is a senior associate in the banking and project department of our Bangkok Office. Her experience in project finance includes drafting, reviewing and negotiating commercial contracts and project finance agreements (including joint development agreements, consortium agreements, shareholder agreements, share purchase agreements, power purchase agreements, coal supply agreements and inter-company financing agreements). She also has experience in mergers and acquisitions, joint ventures, corporate and commercial law as well as conducting due diligence exercises for various transactions. Prior to joining Allen & Overy, Vorasaree spent a number of years in the in-house counsel department at GDF SUEZ and as an associate at another international law firm in Bangkok.

Bella is an Associate in the international capital markets practice of our Frankfurt office. She focuses on debt capital markets transactions. She regularly acts for underwriters and issuers, including sovereigns, banks and corporates. Bella's experience includes acting for major US, UK and emerging market lenders on multi-jurisdictional transactions in the areas of insolvency, restructuring of credit facilities, distressed debt, conduit level lending and securitisation. Before joining Allen & Overy LLP in 2011, Bella was an Associate at leading international law firms in Moscow, Frankfurt and Australia. Bella is admitted as a Solicitor in England & Wales and Queensland, Australia. She graduated from the Queensland University of Technology (Bachelor of Laws, 2006) and Griffith University (Bachelor of Business, 2001 and Bachelor of Science, 2000) in Australia.

Naoufal has experience working in litigation and arbitration projects including employment and commercial law. He has practical and through experience before Moroccan tribunals. Naoufal is qualified in Morocco.

Assia has experience advising foreign investors, major groups in Morocco, as well as leading banks on the negotiation and the drafting of financing documents. She has participated in major local and international financing transactions in Morocco. Assia specialises in finance transactions mainly in project finance and structured finance.
Anis has experience primarily in arbitration and litigation and worked on varied and complicated matters.

Soumaya has developed a track record experience in real estate projects, hotels, residential projects and leisure facilities. She has been involved in the large scale project Plan Azur. Soumaya advised public sector organisations in investment transactions.

Abbes specialises in corporate law, essentially mergers and acquisitions, joint-ventures and restructuring of companies. Abbes has valuable experience in competition law, intellectual property law and new technologies law.

Mehdi has a range of experience in public procurement law, IPP, concessions, administrative law and planning law. He has worked closely with public entities, commercial banks and sponsors in France and Morocco.

Sylvain has ten years' experience in acquisitions, disposals of companies and group restructuring programs in Europe, Morocco and Africa. He generally advises international, corporate clients, institutional investors and investment funds. His practice mainly covers mergers and acquisitions (particularly cross border), joint ventures, private equity and foreign investments in Morocco and French speaking African countries. Sylvain is qualified in France.

Younes has been involved in a large number of transactions in Morocco and assisted banks and local international investors in their mergers and acquisitions operations. He focuses on mergers & acquisitions, capital markets, corporate and banking and foreign exchange control regulations. Younes is qualified in Morocco.

Omar has acquired expertise in the employment law area advising clients on a broad spectrum of labour law aspects. He specialises in drafting, negiotiating and handling individual and collective dismissals as well as conciliation proceedings. Omar qualified in Morocco.

Justyna is a senior associate at Allen & Overy Warsaw's Competition and EU Law Department. Justyna has many years of experience in conducting proceedings before the President of the Office of Competition and Consumer Protection concerning concentrations and anticompetitive practices of undertakings operating in various industries. She has advised clients on the compliance of commercial contracts and pricing, sale and marketing strategies with competition law. She conducts training sessions and workshops on the application of competition law principles. Before joining Allen & Overy, she worked as a director in the Office of Competition and Consumer Protection.

Laura is a German Rechtsanwältin and works in Allen & Overey LLP's Frankfurt office since 2011. She is a member of the International Capital Markets Team and advises on regulatory requirements under the German Banking Act, the Securities Trading Act and the Investment Act.

Person.Experience: Filippo leads our Public, Administrative and Environmental Law team in Italy. He has significant experience in assisting Italian and foreign companies as well as public entities in connection with administrative, regulatory and public law issues, providing a complete range of contentious and non-contentious advice. He focuses on PPP (Public-Private-Partnership), public procurement, energy, real estate, zoning and building as well as environmental law sectors. He also advises companies and public entities on local public services and other infrastructural projects, including highways, health facilities and hydro as well as projects for the disposal, collection and treatment of waste. "According to clients Filippo Bucchi has a marked inclination towards problem solving." Top Legal 2012 – Administrative Law.

Person.Experience: Brian is a Consultant in Allen & Overy’s Hong Kong and Beijing offices and has extensive experience in oil and gas (including LNG, CBM and shale gas), power, renewables (solar, wind, hydro, biomass and CDM), infrastructure, petrochemical and mining transactions, covering cross-border mergers and acquisitions, joint ventures, project development and financing, EPC and large scale commercial agreements etc. Brian is also experienced in both representing Chinese SOEs and private companies in outbound investments and representing foreign/multinational companies in their investments in China. Brian was trained and has previously worked in London (with other international firms), and he speaks fluent English and Mandarin. Marie specialises in EU and Dutch competition law and the regulatory aspects of the energy, telecoms and postal markets. She both litigates for and advises clients on all competition and regulatory issues related to environmental, administrative, tendering and communication law. Marie joined Allen & Overy in October 2011 after graduating from the University of Amsterdam.

Samer is the Managing Partner of Allen & Overy’s office in Doha. He specialises in banking, finance and capital markets and has a broad experience in both conventional and Islamic finance with a focus on general corporate lending, leveraged and acquisition finance, real estate finance and debt restructuring. He regularly acts for both lenders and borrowers on domestic and cross-border transactions. His expertise in capital markets includes advising arrangers, underwriters and issuers on debt and on equity issuances. He also regularly advises local and international financial institutions and regulatory bodies on financial markets regulatory matters. Samer has been based in Doha for over nine years. He is fluent in English, Arabic and French. Before joining Allen & Overy Samer was a partner at a leading international law firm where he headed up their financial markets practice in the Middle East. Samer’s practice is recognised in various recommendations and write-ups in the legal directories: In IFLR2013, Samer is ranked as a Leading Lawyer and is described as “one of the leading banking and finance lawyers in Qatar” and that "He is very capable both in terms of local and international law." In Chambers Global 2012, Samer is ranked as a Band 2 lawyer. He is singled out for his significant finance practice and is described as “an excellent lawyer” and peers “have only good things to say about him.”

Jan is head of Allen & Overy's German Corporate Insurance Practice. He focuses in particular on M&A transactions, post-acquisition integration measures and restructurings in the insurance and reinsurance sector. Furthermore, Jan also advises on general corporate law and insurance regulatory law matters, and is an expert on pensions related transactions and contractual trust arrangements. Before joining Allen & Overy, Jan was a partner at another well-known international law firm, where his practice areas were identical; prior to that he worked in several positions for Allianz Group.

Person.Experience: Siba has experience acting for major banks, property and insolvency firms in a wide range of financial, property and commercial litigation, and insolvency. Since joining Allen & Overy LLP in 2011 as an associate, she has gained experience in banking transactions, including corporate syndicated loans and other general lending transactions.

Michael, a German Rechtsanwalt, joined Allen & Overy LLP in 2011 as an associate in the Düsseldorf Corporate Department. Prior to joining Allen & Overy LLP, Dr Fink worked for other renowned international law firms as lawyer for several years. He advises national and international organisations on all matters regarding corporate law, with focus on stock corporation law, limited liability company law, group law, transformation law and on corporate disputes. This includes in particular matters regarding Corporate Governance, cross-border mergers, international joint ventures and restructurings. Furthermore, Dr Fink advises regularly on complex national and cross-border M&A transactions.

Person.Experience: Denis leads the Litigation department in Paris, where his practice encompasses a wide range of complex litigation matters both in civil and criminal courts. He appears in court for major international corporates or financial institutions, practicing principally in banking and finance, securities litigation, regulatory defence work and white-collar crime. Denis also has substantial experience in the area of product liability, with a strong focus on aviation. His practice is quintessentially international and he has gained considerable experience dealing with complex cross-border issues, such as conflicts of law and jurisdiction and devising international litigation strategies involving France and other countries. Denis is one of the few practitioners to appear regularly before the courts of French-speaking African countries, where he represents international corporates and financial institutions in commercial and criminal matters. Denis served in the United Nations Interim Administration Mission in Kosovo in 1999 as a legal advisor to the Head of Mission. He is also the President of Droits d'Urgence, a non-governmental organisation providing free legal aid to disadvantaged groups. A former member of the French National Human Rights Commission (by the appointment of the Prime Minister), he teaches international litigation at ESCP Europe, a leading European Business School. He is currently serving as an officer of the Litigation Committee of the International Bar Association.

Person.Experience: Erwan advises French and foreign companies in complex civil and criminal disputes. He notably advises in the areas of banking and finance litigation, where his experience includes liability claims against banks, financial services and investment funds; corporate litigation, including disputes between majority and minority shareholders, disputes related to shareholding agreements as well as warranties and representations; and product liability and insurance disputes, with a focus on the aviation sector. Erwan has worked in France and in the UK and he is qualified in both jurisdictions. He has developed specific expertise in conflicts of laws and jurisdictional issues (a subject he teaches at university), international judicial assistance, asset-tracing and recovery, and the enforcement of foreign judgments and arbitral awards on assets located in France. His expertise also covers representations before the courts of French-speaking African countries in commercial and criminal litigation matters, as well as before international courts (in particular, the ILO Administrative Tribunal).

Jens, a German Rechtsanwalt, works in Allen & Overy LLP’s Frankfurt office in the International Capital Markets practice. He advises clients in relation to investment law (license requirements, marketing/sales, fund documentation, depositary), banking supervisory law (in particular cross-border issues) , securities trading law (compliance, notifications of voting rights and other notification procedures), listing of ETFs and ETC, exchange-related issues as well as clearing, settlement and custody. Before joining Allen & Overy LLP Jens worked for another leading international law firm and Deutsche Börse Group.

Person.Experience: John heads the firm’s litigation and regulatory investigations practice in Australia. He specialises in commercial litigation and dispute resolution in corporate and banking matters. He also represents entities and executives in ASIC, ACCC and other regulatory investigations and enforcement actions. John has represented many of Australia’s leading financial institutions and corporates, as well as executives, who operate in a wide range of sectors, especially banking, wealth management, financial markets, resources, real estate development, IT and telecommunications. Independent benchmarking publication Legal 500 Asia Pacific ranks John among leading dispute resolution lawyers in Australia, describing John as "a consummate professional, highly knowledgeable and commercially minded".

Matthias advises on employment law matters. He joined Allen & Overy Luxembourg in 2011. He was admitted as an avocat in Luxembourg in 2011.

Conor advises on general corporate matters. He holds a LL.M from the University of Pennsylvania, USA, and a LL.B from the University of Wales, UK. Conor is a member of the Irish American Bar Association. He joined Allen & Overy Luxembourg in 2011.
Benoît advises on general regulatory matters. He joined Allen & Overy in 2011.
Emilie advises on general banking matters. She holds a Master en Droit des sociétés from the Catholic University of Louvain-la-Neuve in Belgium. She joined Allen & Overy Luxembourg in 2011.

Natalie specialises in intellectual property law and in particular in both contentious and non-contentious copyright, trademark and patent matters. She also advises on unfair competition issues and commercial contracts. Natalie has a particular interest in the Life Sciences sector. Moreover, Natalie represents clients in various sectors on matters relating to information technology, data protection, advertising as well as regulatory issues. Natalie previously worked in the field of intellectual property in Paris, Luxembourg and Lyon. She joined Allen & Overy Luxembourg in 2011.
Olivier advises on taxation law matters. He joined Allen & Overy in 2011.

Pierre-Henry advises on general capital markets transactions, including issues of debt and equity securities and securitisations. He also advises on banking work, including debt restructuring and acquisition finance. Pierre-Henry joined Allen & Overy in 2011.

Serge advises on capital markets transactions, including issues of debt and equity securities and securitisations as well as banking work, including debt restructuring and acquisition finance. He joined Allen & Overy in 2011.

John has extensive experience advising on various capital market transactions, including corporate hybrid securities, bank regulatory capital securities, investment grade and high yield bonds, dim sum bonds, MTN programmes, sovereign bonds, convertible and exchangeable bonds, bonds with warrants, IPOs, GDRs, block-trades, structured finance, securitisation, synthetic collateralised obligations and structured call warrants. He has also been involved in several corporate transactions, including sale and purchase of shares, joint ventures and listing shares of offshore funds. John speaks English and Korean.

Amit Singh is a US-qualified consultant in the ICM department in Hong Kong. He worked in New York and London before relocating to Hong Kong. Amit is admitted to the New York bar.

Main CV Elaine is professional support lawyer in the corporate department in Hong Kong and has experience in a number of mergers and acquisitions transactions, sales and purchases of businesses and private companies and on joint ventures, reorganisations and a range of other general corporate and commercial matters. She also assists in running the firm's company secretarial practice in Hong Kong.

Paul focuses on domestic and international M&A transactions and large scale commercial agreements for energy clients. He has also been involved in disputes and matters of public law in relation to the oil and gas sector. Paul was named Global Oil and Gas Lawyer of the Year 2010 (Who's Who legal awards). Person.Experience: Ian has international experience of a wide range of banking transactions, including European leveraged finance transactions (acting both for banks and borrowers) and real estate finance transactions. Mark Roppel is a partner in the corporate department of Allen & Overy's Global U.S. Practice. Mark has over 20 years of experience in complex cross-border transactions in Asia, Europe and the Americas. Mark is based in New York but has extensive Asian experience having previously worked in China for more than six years. He represents clients in a variety of transactions including stock mergers, tender offers, public offerings, private stock and asset purchases, private placements, leveraged acquisitions, restructurings, joint ventures and strategic alliances. He also regularly advises clients on corporate governance matters and represents financial institutions as financial advisors to transactions. Mark is admitted to the New York Bar, and a member of the American Bar Association and the Association of the Bar of the City of New York. Andrew has been with Allen & Overy since January 2000, based in London, Singapore and now as a Foreign Legal Consultant with Ginting & Reksodiputro in Jakarta. Person.Experience: Heather heads up the partnership office which is involved in many aspects of Allen & Overy's risk management programme including in particular, legal and regulatory risk and advising Allen & Overy on its liabilities to clients, suppliers and other third parties. Genevieve has more than 20 years HR experience in professional services firms - including Ernst & Young, Schroders and Arthur D. Little - and has also run her own consultancy business. Marc-Henri is the global head of e-Business overseeing the strategy, development and marketing of the legal practice's online services for clients. Person.Experience: Wim Dejonghe is Global Managing Partner of Allen & Overy LLP. He was Managing Partner of the Belgian offices from 1996 until his election as Global Managing Partner in May 2008. Person.Experience: David is Allen & Overy's worldwide Senior Partner, a role akin to Executive Chairman. He joined Allen & Overy as a trainee in 1980, qualifying as a solicitor in 1982 after obtaining an MA in law from St John's College, Cambridge University. He is a banking lawyer with 25 years of transactional experience. In 1998 he became global head of the banking practice. He was elected worldwide Managing Partner, a role akin to CEO, in May 2003, elected worldwide Senior Partner in 2008 and re-elected for a further four year term in 2012. David is a member of the Mayor of London's International Business Advisory Council and a member of the Best Lawyers Advisory Board. He is chairman of Prime, the UK legal profession wide initiative to provide fair access to quality work experience. In 2012 he was listed as one of the 10 most influential lawyers in the UK by The Times newspaper. In 2013 he was recognised as one of The Top 50 Big Law Innovators of the Last 50 Years by The American Lawyer.

Person.Experience: Leigh specialises in European and Dutch law relating to network sectors including gas, electricity, telecoms, transport, post and water and is internationally recognised as a leading expert and commentator in this field. Her expertise is primarily in the field of interconnection between competition law and sector-specific regulation with a particular emphasis on access pricing and conditions, State aid and cross-subsidisation. Her work has included representing private sector clients in litigation before national regulatory bodies and the European courts, in international arbitration proceedings, in competition notifications to the European Commission and national regulatory authorities, and advising on State aid complaints to the European Commission. In addition, she has regularly assisted major clients in preparing and managing lobby strategies and documents on relevant competition and regulatory issues at national and European level. She has advised clients on the regulatory and competition law aspects of cross-border interconnectors and has notified a number of applications for regulatory and/or competition clearance for such projects at European and most recently national level. She has regularly acted as an adviser to the European Commission and the European Parliament on energy law issues. Leigh is a professor of European law at the University of Tilburg and was a member of the Scientific Council for Government Policy (WRR). Prior to 1997, she was a professor of European law at the Erasmus University Rotterdam. She was visiting professor of Natural Resources Law at the University of Calgary, Canada. Furthermore, she was Head of Legal Services at the Energy Charter Secretariat until 1999. Leigh has lectured on European and national electricity law issues throughout Europe, North America and Japan at both academic and commercial conferences and has published widely on electricity law in many leading journals. She contributes regularly to Financial Times specialist newsletters on legal and policy issues, particularly in the European energy sector. Leigh graduated from the University of Glasgow in 1978. Before joining Allen & Overy she worked with LeBoeuf Lamb Leiby and Greene as an Of Counsel (1991 - 1995) and as a partner with Kennedy Van der Laan in Amsterdam (1995 - 2002). In addition to founding and editing two specialised legal journals in the field – the Utilities Law Review and the Journal of Network Industries – she is also a member of the editorial board of Utilities Policy, Markt en Mededinging, the European Law Journal, Legal Issues of European Integration and the European State Aids Law Quarterly. She is author of the leading handbook on European State Aids Law (1999) and one of the first comprehensive studies of European Electricity Law (1991) as well as numerous articles and books on competition law and regulated industries. She is a member of the Council of the Section on Energy and Recources Law of the International Bar Association's Electricity Committee and a board member of the Centre for the Study of Regulated Industries, based in the United Kingdom. She is also Vice-Chairman of the Appeals Panel of the Amsterdam Power Exchange.
Person.Publications: Co-author of the leading handbook on European State Aids Law (4th edition, 2012) The first comprehensive studies of European Electricity law (1991) Contributing author to EU Competition Law and Energy Markets (3rd edition 2011) As well as numerous articles and books on competition law and regulated industries

Hancher andProfessor P.J. Slot) and on European and national competition law (with Mr S.J.van der Voorde).

Person.Experience: Pat is a trial lawyer, specializing in complex securities, commercial and criminal matters. From May 2008 to May 2010, in addition to practicing law, Ms. Hynes was President of the Association of the Bar of the City of New York. With almost 23,000 members, the City Bar is the oldest and largest Bar Association in New York. Pat is included in the 2012 edition of Best Lawyers in the categories of Bet the Company, Commercial Litigation and Securities and Capital Markets Litigations. In addition, Pat is included in the 2012 edition of 'Super Lawyers' as a top attorney in business litigation, and has been listed as one of the Top 50 Women Lawyers. Pat has also been listed in The American Lawyer’s “The Best Lawyers in America: Annual Guide to Commercial Litigation.” In May 2007, she was named by the National Law Journal as one of the “50 Most Influential Women Lawyers in America.” Pat had also been included in the first list of the Most Influential Women Lawyers which ran in 1998, as well as the National Law Journal’s list of the 50 Top Women Litigators published in 2001. Chambers USA: America's Leading Lawyers for Business has recognized Pat as a "tough, smart litigator who quickly gets to the crux of the matter" and has noted Pat's 'courtroom edge' as a prominent trial lawyer. A Fellow of the American College of Trial Lawyers since 1984; she is also a Fellow of the International Academy of Trial Lawyers, and has been included in the list of Best Lawyers in America since 1993, New York’s Super Lawyers, the Euromoney Guide to the World’s Leading Litigation Lawyers and Who’s Who in American Law, and Who’s Who in the World. Pat has taught Trial Advocacy at Harvard and Fordham Law Schools, has lectured extensively on Securities Law, Class Actions and Civil RICO, and has been a member of The American Law Institute since 1996. Pat has served as Chair of the American Bar Association's Standing Committee on the Federal Judiciary from 2000 to 2001, having previously served as the Second Circuit Representative on that Committee from 1995 to 2000. From 2002 to May 2009, Pat chaired the Merit Selection Panel for Magistrate Judges for the Southern District of New York, having previously served as a member of that Committee from 1994 to 2002. From 2004 through 2007, Pat was a Member of the Departmental Disciplinary Committee of the Appellate Division of the Supreme Court, First Judicial Department. In February 2012, Pat received the Federal Bar Council's prestigious Whitney North Seymour Award for Outstanding Public Service by a Private Practitioner. In October 2007, Pat received the Citizens Union of the City of New York Robert F. Wagner, Jr. Award 'for her contributions and exemplary leadership in strengthening the civic life of New York City'. From 2003 to 2006 Pat was the Chair of the Board of Directors of The Legal Aid Society and oversaw the successful financial restructuring of the Society that saved it from bankruptcy.

Philip Wood is one of the world's leading experts in comparative and cross-border financial law, a celebrated speaker, a well-known writer and an experienced practitioner. He works full-time for Allen & Overy in the firm's London office. He has written around 18 books, including nine volumes in the series Law and Practice of International Finance published in 2007. His university textbook on international finance has been translated into Chinese. He was a partner in Allen & Overy from 1973 to 2002 and was, for ten years, head of Allen & Overy's Banking department. He is chairman of the Sovereign Bankruptcy Group of the International Law Association and a member of the Market Monitoring Committee of the Institute of International Finance. One of his recent assignments was acting for the steering committee of the bondholders in relation to the bankruptcy of Greece. In a recent period of about a year, he delivered about 140 lectures in 30 countries. He is on the editorial board of many law journals and on the advisory council of law faculties at universities in India and Hong Kong. His 40 years experience in the firm includes most aspects of international banking and finance, including financial regulation, risk management, bank loan syndications, project finance, asset-based finance, leasing, securitisations, insolvency and debt restructuring, netting, clearing houses, payment systems, trade finance, derivatives, security interests, capital market issues, sovereign insolvencies, expert witness in litigation and law reform. He has experience and knowledge of financial law in most jurisdictions, including those in Britain and others in the European Union, Scandinavia, Central and Eastern Europe, Turkey, Russia, the Central Asian republics, India, China and other countries in South East and East Asia, Japan, Australia, New Zealand, Africa, the Middle East and Arab countries, the United States, Canada, Central America, South America and the Caribbean. He is qualified as an English lawyer. He pioneered a method of measuring financial law according to key indicators and is particularly well-known for his colour-coded global law maps. He has developed a methodology for legal risk ratings of the jurisdictions of the world with regard to both their written law and the application for the law. He completed the London Marathon in 2005, and the Berlin Marathon in 2011 (at age 69). He climbed Mount Kilimanjaro in 2009. The garden at his Surrey home, designed and built by his wife, was featured in the Austrian TV programme England's Most Beautiful Gardens and the book Britain's Most Amazing Gardens. He is interested in literature, economics, history, architecture and science, and plays popular tunes on the piano. He was born in Livingstone, Zambia and is married with four children. March 2013

Schan has broad experience representing bank and non-bank financial institutions in civil litigation and enforcement matters involving the Federal consumer financial laws, the U.S. Bankruptcy Code, and the consumer protection statutes of nearly every state. In addition, he has extensive experience representing plan sponsors, independent trustees, recordkeepers and investment managers in civil litigation and regulatory matters involving the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 (ERISA), with a particular focus on fiduciary issues.
Katalin has experience in several banking deals, various corporate and tax matters, participated in domestic and cross-border corporate deals.
Caroline is an associate in Allen & Overy's New York office.

Nicolette focuses on intellectual property litigation, commercial litigation and international arbitration. She has experience drafting, briefing, preparing and responding to discovery requests and working with experts. Nicolette has worked with major financial institutions, cutting edge technology companies and multinational corporations in cross-border disputes.

Wouter advises companies and public entities on European and Belgian antitrust and economic law. He very regularly advises companies and financial institutions on the application of the EU sanctions regime. He has a broad expertise in EU law in general (including institutional and internal market law, sectoral regulation, competition law). He represents clients before national courts and authorities (including the national economic sanctions authority), as well as before the European Court of Justice (ECJ) where he pleaded three high-profile cases in the past few years. Wouter is a former Référendaire at the ECJ and a member of the Belgian national competition authority. He is a full-tenured Professor of EU law at the University of Leuven.

Michal has particular experience advising on indirect taxation issues including VAT, but has also frequently assisted clients in other fields such as and investment incentives. Michal has been involved in a number of corporate and finance transactions working for a variety of corporate clients.

Ondřej specializes in the area of corporate law, real estate, employment law and protection of personal data, including regulatory matters. Ondřej also dealt with selected regulatory questions in the area of environmental law, in particular related to renewable sources of energy. His experience includes advising Glencore, one of the world’s leading integrated producers and marketers of commodities, on the real estate aspects of acquisition of crush plant technologies, edible oil refining technologies and bottling technologies located in Ústí nad Labem, Czech Republic and advising a global financial services group on its cross-border data protection compliance matters across 57 jurisdictions.

Csilla participates in various corporate matters including drafting agreements, providing data protection advice, preparing due diligence reports and assisting with the day-to-day corporate matters of our clients. Csilla is also involved in antitrust and employment matters regularly.

Paul Crook is a Consultant and was Global Head of Corporate Know-how and Training from 2003 - 2012. He was a partner in the corporate department from 1984-2003. He obtained an MA and an LL.M from Jesus College, Cambridge, joined the firm in 1976 and qualified as a solicitor in 1978. From 1980 to 1982 he was seconded as the first in-house secondee lawyer to the London Stock Exchange. He spent three years (1993-1996) leading the corporate practice in the firm’s Paris office and was admitted to the French Bar in 1994. He has considerable experience in a wide range of corporate transactions, including mergers and acquisitions (public and private, domestic and cross-border), international joint ventures, equity issues and leveraged and management buyouts. Paul was until recently a member of the Law Society Company Law Committee and also sits on the Advisory Board of Gore-Browne on Companies. Paul also leads A&O's Project Rwanda (delivering legal training to lawyers and judges in Rwanda) was one of the first Directors of International Lawyers For Africa (a pro bono/CSI initiative aiming to build legal capacity in Africa by providing secondments with leading international law firms to young lawyers from around 16 African countries).

Bernardine has a wealth of legal experience in M&A, equity capital markets and corporate and regulatory compliance across a range of industries. Prior to joining the firm, she was Hutchison Whampoa's Deputy Head Group General Counsel. Hong Kong-headquartered Hutchison Whampoa is a Fortune 500 conglomerate with global and diversified business interests. Bernardine played an instrumental role in Hutchison Group's many high-profile M&A and ECM transactions during the 11 years she was with the group. Her experience includes the highly acclaimed Singapore listing, by way of a spin off, of Hutchison Group's ports business trust earlier in 2011 (in which Allen & Overy also advised). Prior to joining Hutchison Whampoa, Bernardine was a partner at Denton Wilde Sapte (one of the leading corporate firms in Hong Kong at the time) where she led their corporate and commercial practice in Hong Kong. She offers clients a detailed knowledge of the Hong Kong corporate industry along with on-the-ground experience advising on M&A, equity and regulatory matters.

Lisa's practice focuses on banking and capital markets work, with particular emphasis in derivatives and structured finance.
She acts as counsel to the International Swaps and Derivatives Associations in respect of matters involving Italian law and the Italian derivatives markets, and regularly assists foreign and Italian financial institutions in connection with the management of credit and legal risks involved in financial transactions concluded with Italian public and private sector counterparties.
Lisa's clients have included the World Bank and the Federal Reserve Bank of New York. She is currently a member of the Council for the Legal Practice Division of the International Bar Association and is a former Co-Chair of the IBA's Banking Committee.

In November 2010, Lisa coordinated a G20 survey of the legal issues associated with proposed bank "bail-in" measures for submission to the Policy Development Group of the Basel Committee.

Person.Experience: Annalisa has a wide experience on structured finance, securitisations and covered bond transactions, also with a focus on public finance and Italian local entities. She has assisted an continues to assist on several covered bond programmes established by Italian banks. Annalisa holds a law degree from the University of Rome, La Sapienza, and an LLM Degree from New York University School of Law. She is is admitted to the Italian and New York BAR. She also practiced law in New York, where she gained a significant experience on debt and equity offerings, securitizations and other structured finance and private equity transactions.

Stephen has extensive experience dealing with schemes of arrangement under UK law and sister common law jurisdictions. In addition, Stephen has advised on the insurance aspects of derivative transactions.

Bart specialises in PPP projects and project finance, structured asset finance (including leasing) and general lending. He headed this department from 1999 until 2006. Person.Experience: Vince is a recognised expert in e-disclosure and document management with over 37 years' experience at Allen & Overy. He has experience of a broad range of company/commercial work with particular emphasis on mergers and acquisitions (often of an international nature) and issues of listed securities. Ishtar has more than 10 years of experience advising on Spanish taxation issues on domestic and international transactions. She has advised on international tax planning transactions and tax matters related to domestic and cross-border finance transactions, debt capital markets transactions and debt issuances and liability management transactions. Person.Experience: David focuses on public-private partnerships involving the acquisition, financing, maintenance, and development of transportation infrastructure in the United States. Prior to joining the firm, David served at the U.S. Department of Transportation as Deputy Assistant Secretary for Transportation Policy and Chief Counsel of the Federal Transit Administration ('FTA'). At the Department, David was involved in all aspects of the U.S. Secretary of Transportation’s initiative to promote private investment in the U.S. transportation network.

David regularly advises clients on mergers, acquisitions, and joint ventures, appearing before the U.S. Department of Justice and the Federal Trade Commission. In addition, David frequently counsels on cross-border transactions, and has coordinated worldwide merger notifications for transactions requiring clearance in multiple foreign jurisdictions. Recently, David represented Mubadala Development Company in connection with its joint acquisition (as part of a consortium with Sony) of EMI Group’s music publishing business, which was investigated and cleared by the Federal Trade Commission. David advises clients on other aspects of antitrust law, including monopolization, vertical restraints, concerted activity, licensing and other intellectual property issues, resale price maintenance, price discrimination and implementation of antitrust compliance programs. David represents clients in civil investigations, and represented two major financial institutions in connection with a series of investigations by the Department of Justice into internet-based trading platforms. The investigations were resolved without enforcement action. David has represented clients in civil antitrust litigations in the vitamin and shipping industries. He has also defended companies in criminal price-fixing investigations, including, most recently, a European manufacturer in a matter that was successfully closed with no enforcement action having been taken by the Department of Justice. David has represented clients in a variety of industries, including agriculture, banking and financial services, packaging, entertainment, information services, media, healthcare, biometrics, semiconductors, chemicals, mining, oil and gas, advertising, pulp and paper, construction equipment and motor vehicles. David is a contributing author to a forthcoming ABA treatise on antitrust and joint ventures and is on the editorial board of the ABA’s Annual Review of Antitrust Law Developments.

Jimena has extensive experience in domestic and international financial transactions including leveraged finance, acquisition finance, real estate finance and structured finance. She has advised in multiple project finance transactions, in sectors such as energy, renewable energies and LNG. She has been involved in numerous debt restructuring transactions in recent years. Jimena has also taken part in several securitisation transactions in Spain. Jimena is recommended for her excellent work in Chambers & Partners. Person.Experience: Sigrid is a senior professional support lawyer specialising in tax. As such she is involved in a wide range of tax work, mainly national and international corporate, but also employment related. Prior to joining Allen & Overy in 2003, she worked for KPMG Meijburg & Co as a tax consultant. Furthermore, she is a professor of tax law at Erasmus University, Rotterdam and member of the board of the Dutch Association of Tax Advisers. She writes and lectures regularly on topics regarding national and European tax law.

Marlise specialises in debt capital markets and securitisation transactions. She graduated from the University of Amsterdam and received an LLM Degree from the Duisenberg School of Finance in 2011. Marlise joined Allen & Overy in January 2012.

Person.Publications: "Barristers from the Same Chambers Appearing as Counsel and Arbitration; Independence Revisted?" Dispute Resolution International, (November 2011) Volume 5, Issue 2 (with Michael Polkinghorne).

Person.Experience: Walter has extensive experience working on capital markets transactions, including convertible and exchangeable bonds, bonds with warrants, warrants, structured notes, floating rate notes, medium term notes programmes, repackaging programmes and global depositary receipts involving Korean, Hong Kong, Indian, Philippines, Thai and other Asian issuers. He has also advised Korean parties in connection with derivatives and structured finance-related matters and restructurings. Walter speaks English and Korean. He is a US- and UK-qualified partner in the international capital markets department in Hong Kong.

Ulrike, a German Rechtsanwältin, joined Allen & Overy as an associate in 2001. She has gained broad experience in litigation for both domestic and international clients in several areas of law. Since 2007, she has been a professional support lawyer, working for the dispute resolution and IP teams. She assists the teams in client work, e.g. by researching questions of law. Ulrike focuses on cross-border litigation issues and conflicts of laws. She also informs her colleagues about new developments, conducts internal training, prepares external talks and maintains the know-how-collection. In addition, she co-ordinates the know-how-management within Allen & Overy Germany.

Person.Experience: Laëtitia is a partner of the Intellectual Property and Litigation department of Allen & Overy Paris. She leads the Paris IP practice and is co-head of Allen & Overy's Life Sciences Group. She has a wealth of experience in all intellectual property areas including patents, trademarks, copyright and unfair competition issues, both contentious and non-contentious. She also handles product liability cases and advises on regulatory issues and contracts. Laëtitia is the author of several chapters of the book Competition, Public Health, Innovation and Drugs, of Generic drugs and IP law and of Question 202 of the AIPPI French group on "The impact of public health issues on exclusive patents rights". More recently, she is notably the co-author of the articles "The judgement DHL/Chronopost of the CJEU of 12 April 2011: a community injunction may be obtained insofar as the functions of the trade mark are affected" (Lamy Droit de l'Immatériel, 2011), "Why France is a good forum for preliminary injunctions in patent matters" (Global Business Magazine, 2012), "Supplementary Protection Certificates – CJEU provides welcome clarifications" (International Who's Who Legal - Life Sciences, 2012), "Trade Secrets Protection: a Comparative Overview" (Handbook of European IP Management 2012), "Comparative Advertising for Generics in Germany and France after L’Oréal v Bellure" (PTMG Law Lore & Practice, December 2012), "Interim injunctions over patents – The French practice" (Managing Intellectual Property, to be published), and "Overview of Life Sciences law in France" (to be published in Chambers Life Sciences Guide 2013). According to Chambers Europe 2012, "Laëtitia Bénard 'is becoming increasingly important' in the practice and is 'a true rising star,' agree peers. Clients observe that 'she has developed profound expertise in the pharmaceutical and biotech areas, both in regulatory and contentious areas'.” "The 'extremely talented' Laëtitia Bénard receives praise from clients who appreciate her 'responsiveness and appreciation of our commercial goals'. She acts for several globally recognised pharmaceutical innovators in litigation against both generics manufacturers and rival innovators, bringing a 'very detail-oriented, meticulous and precise' approach to cases" (IAM Patent Litigation 2012). Laëtitia Bénard "consistently exhibits 'outstanding leadership, knowledge, responsiveness and forward thinking on the most difficult matters'” (World Trademark Review 1000 – 2012). "'An exceptional and tenacious advocate', she will 'persevere to achieve clients’ goals" (World Trademark Review 1000 – 2011). "The ‘very creative’ Laëtitia Bénard is praised for daring to ‘break new ground’." (Legal 500 EMEA 2011).

Person.Experience: Ed is a consultant to and former senior partner of the Derivatives and Structured Finance Practice. He joined Allen & Overy in London in April 1990 and was a partner for twenty years from 1993 to 2013. He was based in the Paris office of the firm from 1999 to 2002. Ed is a senior member of the Allen & Overy team that advises the International Swaps and Derivatives Association (ISDA) on a variety of issues globally. He is the Chairman of ISDA's Financial Law Reform Committee and represents ISDA on the UK Treasury’s Banking Liaison Panel, established under the Banking Act 2009. Ed is a member of P.R.I.M.E. Finance (the Panel of Recognised International Market Experts in Finance), which is based in The Hague and was established to assist judicial systems in the settlement of disputes on complex financial transactions. He was a member of the UK Financial Markets Law Committee from 2005 to 2013. Ed is a Visiting Professorial Fellow at the Centre for Commercial Law Studies of Queen Mary London and a visiting lecturer at the Université Panthéon-Assas (Paris II). He has also given guest lectures at the University of Cambridge, the London School of Economics, the Bucerius Law School in Hamburg and University College Dublin's Commercial Law Centre. In October 2009 he was appointed a Recorder of the Crown Court (part-time criminal court judge). In September 2013 he was authorised to sit as a Deputy High Court Judge in the Chancery Division.

Person.Experience: John is managing partner of the Litigation practice and a leading finance litigation specialist. Over the last 20 years he has advised most of the world's major banks on a full range of banking, finance and securities disputes and regulatory proceedings. He has also acted on substantial general commercial cases for a wide range of clients. Nearly all matters on which he advises involve proceedings (both civil and criminal) in multiple jurisdictions. He is very well known in the market for his specialist expertise in the derivatives and structured finance field. John is ranked as a leading individual for Banking Litigation in both Chambers and Legal 500. Chambers & Partners has said that on derivatives disputes “[he] really ought to be seen as the market leader.” Chambers 2012 comments: “Sources say John O'Conor is an 'incisive and seasoned lawyer' who 'focuses on the critical issues in complex cases to maximise the strengths of the client's case'.”

Mark is head of the London real estate finance group and has a wide ranging banking and commercial experience including real estate financing, syndicated financings, structured financings, acquisition financings, project financings and securitisations. He has acted on a large number of investment and development (both speculative and prelet) real estate financings and has extensive experience on cross-border transactions. Mark is listed as a 'leading individual' in Legal 500 2011 and as a 'star performer' in Chambers & Partners 2012 who describe him as "a class apart from the rest, in terms of both knowledge and experience."

Kevin is head of the U.S. real estate practice and senior partner of Allen & Overy's U.S. practice. He specializes in commercial real estate finance, equity investments and sales, workouts and fund formation. Kevin's practice includes large mortgage loans, structured finance, securitization, mezzanine (including 'true' mezzanine, preferred equity and A/B note) financing, restructurings, NPL sales, and joint ventures and complex equity investments. Kevin's practice is capital markets focused and he regularly represents private equity funds, investment banks, asset managers, financial institutions and REITs on their most complex real estate transactions. Since The John Hancock Tower transaction in 2009, Kevin has become one of the leading experts in UCC foreclosures and the execution of loan-to-own strategies for the world’s leading opportunistic investors. Kevin's practice also increasingly focuses on inbound and outbound debt and equity transactions involving the U.S., Europe and Asia which plays to the strength of Allen & Overy's global presence. Kevin is listed as a leading individual for Real Estate New York in Chambers USA. 'Sources value the way that department head Kevin O'Shea "cuts through all the red tape and works very hard for his clients to get a good solution." He is also praised because he "has the foresight to see trends and capitalize on them."' (Chambers USA 2013: Real Estate Finance: New York, Ranked Band 2)

Person.Experience: Chris has nearly 20 years of experience in Australia advising on both domestic and cross-border banking and finance transactions and now specialises in acquisition and leveraged finance, syndicated and bilateral lending and real estate finance. Chris is recognised in Chambers Global Guide as having an "excellent track record on major corporate financings" and has been voted by peers as one of Australia’s Best Lawyers each year from 2009 to 2012 for Banking and for Leveraged Buyouts. Chambers Asia Pacific 2012 notes that "Chris has cemented his reputation in all aspects of acquisition and leveraged finance, asset finance, lending and real estate finance". The Asia Pacific Legal 500 2012 recommends Chris and the "excellent" banking and finance team, which is "commended generally for its 'quality advice and depth of market knowledge'."

Salvador has wide experience in the regulation and contractual matters of financial institutions, financial instrument markets, OTC, clearing and settlement systems, custody and a wide range of financial products. He advises to financial entities, particularly, banks, investment firms, fund management companies, private equity firms, insurance and pension funds, among others, licensing and products requirements, rules of conduct, capital requirements, investment rules, major holdings in financial institutions and listed companies, transparency requirements and AML. His professional practice is also focused on contractual matters about banking, investment, insurance and other financial services, particularly, banking and investment contracts, complex financial products such as derivatives, financial collateral, trading, custody and settlement matters, investment and private equity funds. Salvador has been ranked first in Spain as “Leading Individual” in Financial Services; Regulatory in Chambers Europe 2013 (and since inception) and he has also ranked first in Spain in investment funds as “recommended lawyer” in PLC Which Lawyer 2013. He is also recommended as a Leading Lawyer by Best Lawyers in the practise areas "Venture Capital" and "Banking & Finance".

Person.Experience: Willem's practice covers a wide range of corporate and commercial litigation and arbitration, with a particular emphasis on international arbitration in, among others, joint venture, M&A, financial services, investment, projects, energy, oil and gas, marine, aviation and insurance disputes. Person.Experience: Arnold heads the management team of Allen & Overy Amsterdam. Person.Experience: José Manuel has gained experience in the banking and finance area by participating in domestic and international syndicated financing transactions. He has also provided assistance to financial institutions interested in acting as dealers in the Spanish public debt market. During the last year, he took part in several pro-bono projects for the World Bank, the International Red Cross and The Against the Malaria Foundation.

Catherine specialises in information technology, data protection, e-commerce, advertising, media and telecommunications, intellectual property and regulatory issues, with a particular focus on IT and outsourcing contracts and negotiations. She has more than seven years of experience working in these areas in Luxembourg. In the past years, Catherine has also lectured in IT law at the University of Luxembourg. She is a member of FedISA (Luxembourg chapter of an international electronic archiving community) and ITechLaw.
Julie advises on corporate and international tax law. She has seven years of experience in this area. She joined Allen & Overy in 2005.

Person.Experience: Shaun specialises in energy and infrastructure project development, construction and finance, and has represented developers, contractors, sponsors and lenders in relation to more than 60 power projects in Africa, the Americas, Europe and the Middle East. Shaun specialises in commercial agreements, such as power purchase, fuel supply, construction, O&M, etc. He is also a professional engineer, and prior to practicing law managed energy and infrastructure project development and construction for more than a decade. Shaun is ranked Band 3 by Chambers & Partners and noted as a "rising star" in the IFLR1000 directory of project finance lawyers. Sources highlight Shaun Beaton's technical expertise in energy matters. He qualified as an engineer before being admitted to the New York Bar, giving him a distinct advantage in technically complex work. Interviewees describe him as "capable, committed and pleasant …" CHAMBERS 2013 … an excellent combination of legal and engineering background … LEGAL 500

Person.Experience: Michael specialises in international arbitration, and leads the Paris arbitration team. He has advised and represented clients in numerous arbitrations throughout the world, both ad hoc and under each of the major institutional rules. He sits on the ICC Court of Arbitration. Although experienced across all industry and market sectors, he has a specific focus on energy, chemicals and natural resources disputes. Those disputes have arisen worldwide, with a particular focus on the Caspian, the Middle East, Europe and Africa (both Anglophone and Francophone). He acts regularly as advocate before both arbitral tribunals and experts, and has been on the Executive Committee of the Federation for International Arbitration Advocacy since its inception (where he has taught advocacy classes in Switzerland, France and Brazil). Michael sits frequently as an arbitrator himself. He has also written and spoken widely on arbitration, as well as teaching at the Faculty of Law at Sciences Po in Paris and in the Faculty of the University of London LL.M arbitration programme in Paris. A UK national, he originally qualified as an English barrister. He has been an English solicitor since 1996, and based in Paris since 2006. Market recognition Legal 500: (recommended for international arbitration): "The group is led by Michael Young, a highly regarded adviser who charms clients with his great professionalism and personality; Young ‘has the wit of a master, knows ICC rules inside out, and never loses’; an "outstanding" lawyer; "Michael Young demonstrates a 'high level of knowledge and experience', in addition to being 'a real pleasure to work with'". "Michael Young is 'very bright, committed, hardworking and focused, and very well informed about international arbitration and its key players'". "Extremely responsive and very sharp"; " un avocat 'de toute première classe'". Chambers: (recommended for international arbitration and energy disputes): "'Highly rated', he is 'intelligent, articulate and approachable', reported clients". "Michael Young receives glowing praise: 'Bright, driven and with a vast experience in international arbitration'…". "Michael Young is a highly skilled practitioner, agree sources. His practice is characterised by a strong global dimension, and he is regularly in demand for his specialist knowledge…." . Option Droit & Affaires and Décideurs (recommended for international arbitration):; "l’[équipe de l’] excellent Michael Young… a également connu un succès fulgurant. ‘Michael Young est l’un des meilleurs avocats en France en arbitrage commercial international’, explique tout simplement l’un de ses clients"."… il y a une récurrence d'arbitrages liés à l'énergie, notamment le pétrole et le gaz, dans lesquels Michael Young se distingue particulièrement". Who's Who Legal (recommended for international arbitration): "a real perfectionist"; "brilliant".

Person.Experience: Chris specialises in cross-border mergers and acquisitions, joint ventures and foreign direct investment. He has particular experience of M&A transactions in South East Asia. Chris has been recognised by clients, the press and in independent market research as a leader in his field and has been acknowledged by key industry publications.

Pieter heads the Belgian Employment & Benefits team. He advises and litigates on employee benefits issues, labour and employment matters, corporate restructuring issues and outsourcing transactions. In addition to his client related work, Pieter has published and lectured extensively on employment law and employee benefits, including executive and equity compensation, European works councils, outsourcing and company restructuring. For many years, he has been listed in all major directories as an employment expert and leading lawyer.
Person.Publications:
De Managementvennootschap', CED-Samsom, 2000, 1 (subject: management company vehicle in professional relationships)

Person.Experience: Ryan has represented and advised sovereign, corporate, and banking clients in Latin America and the Caribbean in connection with SEC registered debt security offerings and debt security offerings made pursuant to Rule 144A and Regulation S under the U.S. Securities Act of 1933. He has also provided legal advice to clients in the Americas and Europe in connection with the U.S. Securities Act of 1933 and the U.S. Securities Exchange Act of 1934. Ryan is a native English speaker and fluent in Spanish.

Dr Johanna Gerstung joined Allen & Overy's Employment & Benefits team in 2011. She studied law in Saarbrücken, Lausanne and Freiburg. After her first state exam in law she worked as a research associate for Prof. Sebastian Krebber, LLM (Georgetown) at Albert-Ludwigs-Universität Freiburg. Under the supervision of Prof. Krebber, she wrote her doctoral dissertation on "Rechtliche Bedeutung der Internationalen Rahmenvereinbarungen" (Legal Significance of International Framework Agreements) and was awarded her doctorate in Freiburg in December 2009. Johanna advises national and international companies exclusively on employment law matters, both in collective and individual employment law. She also represents clients in proceedings before labour courts. Johanna focuses on all employment law aspects in relation to restructurings and transfer of businesses as well as outsourcing and offshoring projects. Furthermore, she frequently advises on reconciliation of interests and social plans, employment due diligence matters, employment compliance (including internal investigations) and on the implementation of codes of conduct. In addition, she focuses on corporate social responsibility, pensions and international employment law issues.

Kenneth is the managing partner and heads our International Capital Markets practice in Singapore. Over the past 16 years in Asia, Ken has led numerous complex and novel equity, debt, and equity-linked securities transactions throughout Asia. He has advised on numerous equity and debt offerings throughout South and Southeast Asia. Ken also has extensive experience in Islamic financing capital market transactions. Ken is highly-regarded as a leading lawyer in the Asian capital markets. He has been named one of Singapore's leading capital markets lawyers in The Asia Pacific Legal 500. He has also been ranked as a Band 1 leading individual in Capital Markets in Chambers Asia 2011 and 2012.

Person.Experience: Jack is a partner and head of the U.S. tax group. He focuses primarily on advising on domestic and international tax planning, the taxation of financial instruments and derivatives and cross-border financing and securitizations. Jack also has significant experience in advising on mezzanine financing, cross-border and domestic real estate transactions, including REITs and fund structures, debt restructurings and global corporate transactions. In addition to private practice, Jack served for two years as attorney/adviser to the Honorable Arthur L. Nims, III, Chief Judge of the U.S. Tax Court. Jack has been ranked as a leading tax lawyer in Chambers USA 2013, 2012, 2011, 2010, 2009 and 2008. The directory says “Jack Heinberg of Allen & Overy LLP ‘is admired by clients for the creative and thoughtful advice he offers in cross-border financing and securities, derivatives and financial instruments, and international and domestic tax planning. He is valued for being a great communicator and 'one of the easiest tax lawyers to talk to.’''

Person.Experience: Andras is a member of the firm's banking and finance group. He has been involved in various domestic and international transactions. He has taken part in banking and finance matters including cross-border finance, project finance, asset finance and general lending. He assists the banking team by preparing Hungarian security documents, legal opinions, other ancillary documents and managing parts of finance transactions. Andras has recently been involved in renewable energy project finance and asset finance matters, as well as the enforcement of Hungarian security agreements.

Richard specialises in corporate law, advising hedge funds, private equity and real estate clients as well as banking corporations and multinational companies in connection with mergers and acquisitions, joint ventures, structuring of international transactions, reorganisations, refinancings and corporate finance. He has over eight years of experience in these areas working for international law firms in Paris and Luxembourg. He holds a Ph.D. in law, is a member of the Luxembourg and Paris Bars, and has been admitted as a Solicitor of the Senior Courts of England & Wales.

Person.Experience: Stefanie joined Allen & Overy's German Public and Environmental Law Team in Frankfurt as a lawyer in February 2012. She gained practical experience in advising on renewable energies projects such as several photovoltaic and wind energy projects, where she comprehensively advised on grid connection, feed-in tariffs, planning and environmental issues. Another focus of her work is the advice on regulatory requirements in the life sciences sector, including in particular pharmaceuticals and medical devices. Further, she advises on public law issues in corporate and banking transactions and on a standalone basis with a particular focus on environmental and public construction law issues.
