Person.Experience: Anjali is a member of the global Financial Services Regulatory practice. Her practice focuses on advising multinational corporations and other entities on regulatory and compliance obligations in the areas of campaign finance law; federal, state and local lobbying law; Municipal Securities Rulemaking Board (MSRB) Rule G-37; state and local pay-to-play law; and federal, state, and local law regulating gifts, entertainment, and governmental ethics. Anjali also has experience representing financial institutions and corporations in civil litigation and enforcement matters.

Tim is a partner in the Projects, Energy & Infrastructure Group based in London, focusing on European and Middle Eastern energy and infrastructure markets, including leveraged acquisition and structured finance transactions. His experience covers both international work across a range of sectors, acting for financiers (including Islamic lenders, project bond arrangers, multi-lateral agencies and export credit agencies), project and acquisition companies and sponsors. Tim worked for Allen & Overy in Germany for seven years and is a fluent German speaker. He was the co-lead partner advising The Bank of Tokyo-Mitsubishi UFJ, Ltd. in connection with their acquisition of a portfolio of project finance assets from The Royal Bank of Scotland Group PLC.
Person.Publications: Ausländische Modelle der Vertragsübernahme (Direct Agreements): Heidelberger Kolloquium, Technologie und Recht, 1999.

Person.Experience: Kyrill predominantly advises national and international companies on core corporate law related matters, with focus on stock corporation law (AktG), limited liability company law (GmbHG), and group law (Konzernrecht) as well as multi-jurisdiction reorganisations, national and cross-border M&A transactions and "corporate housekeeping".

Carla joined the Munich banking department in March 2012. Previously, she worked as an assistant lecturer for Prof. Dr. Georg Nolte and Prof. Dr. Christian Walter at the Institute of International Law, Ludwig-Maximilians-University, Munich.

Patrick, a German Rechtsanwalt, joined Allen & Overy LLP in 2012 as Associate in the Frankfurt banking and finance department. Before working for Allen & Overy, Patrick studied in Berlin as well as in Stockholm, Sweden. Patrick has experience in the sectors of national and international restructurings and leveraged financing. Expertise in the foreign trade sector and labour law add to his experience. Patrick advises national and international credit institutions as well as borrowers.

Sarah is a member of the risk management team responsible for advising Allen & Overy on its legal and regulatory risks including its liabilities to clients, suppliers and third parties. Prior to taking on her current role, Sarah was an associate in the corporate department, primarily involved in mergers and acquisitions and corporate restructurings.

Kirsty is a Senior Lawyer in the dedicated E-Business team of Allen & Overy's wholly owned affiliate Derivative Services LLP which provides high quality legal subscription services in the fields of derivatives and financial services regulatory compliance. Kirsty has a wide range of experience working on project finance, procurement, corporate and regulatory matters. Kirsty has spent most of her career working on cross border transactions in London and New York and speaks French and German.

Claire's Political Law practice focuses on advising clients on federal, state, and local pay-to-play and campaign finance laws. She advises clients on government ethics, including compliance obligations and best practices under federal, state, and local laws regulating lobbying, procurement, gifts, and entertainment. Claire has developed expertise in helping clients establish and maintain political law compliance regimes, particularly while on secondment to a major global financial services provider. Claire also advises clients on government enforcement actions at state and federal levels. Prior to joining Allen & Overy, Claire worked as a litigation attorney for the Federal Election Commission and served as counsel to Commissioner Ellen L. Weintraub. Her FEC litigation experience included matters at the United States Supreme Court, as well as various federal circuit and district courts throughout the United States.
Person.Publications: "Non-U.S. Issuers Selling Fund Interests In The United States," The Review of Securities & Commodities Regulation (July, 2012), with Barbara Stettner, Charles Borden and Sam Brown Co-editor, "A Practitioner’s Guide To Appellate Advocacy," American Bar Association, Litigation Section, Appellate Practice Committee (2010) Contributor, "Encyclopedia Of The United States Constitution," Facts On File, Inc (2009). Contributor, "Report of the Independent Expert on the Protection of Human Rights and Fundamental Freedoms while Countering Terrorism for the United Nations High Commission for Human Rights" (February 2005). Co-author, "Some Reflections on Lessons Learned from U.S. and International Financial Institutions’ Efforts Promoting Legal Reform in Countries in Transition" (May 2004).

Person.Experience: François Renard is a Counsel in Allen & Overy Beijing office where he leads the China antitrust practice. Prior to joining Allen & Overy, François was based in Brussels and Paris and he has 15 years experience advising in EU antitrust and trade law. François has extensive experience advising Western and Asian clients on PRC, EU, and other national competition laws, including merger control, anti-competitive agreements and concerted practices, the interaction between intellectual property and antitrust laws, abuse of dominance, market investigations, antitrust compliance, and EU State aid. Since he joined our Beijing office, he has assisted Western and Asian companies in many multi-jurisdictional antitrust matters throughout the Asian region and in Europe. Francois has worked on various complex merger matters in China including the award winning Seagate-Samsung transaction. François has been one of only several EU experts invited to speak to and train PRC antitrust officials in recent years. He has been Vice Chair of the Legal Working Group and Chair of the Competition Sub-working Group of the EU Chamber of Commerce in Beijing between 2009 and 2011. He is also well recognised as a leader in assisting companies throughout the world in antidumping and trade sanctions proceedings, as well as in various international trade matters, including WTO-related matters. François is listed as a leading antitrust lawyer in PLC's cross-border competition category in China, as well as in The International Who's Who of Competition Lawyers, Global Competition Review and by Chambers. He is also listed in the Expert Guide as one of the world's leading international trade lawyers. François has recently authored several articles on merger control in China, in particular "Lessons from the merger control regime in China" (Competition & Antitrust Review 2011 of Euromoney Yearbook), "A Practitioner's Look at Merger Control Remedies in China" (CPI 2012 (2)), and "Some key features of merger control remedies in China" (Competition & Antitrust Review 2012 of Euromoney Yearbook). His article "EU and Chinese antidumping and anti-subsidy proceedings: A politically driven process" was published in the Euromoney Guide. He has been a lecturer at the Institute of European Studies in Brussels since 1997. François obtained his law degree from the Free University of Brussels, and obtained an LL.M in European Law from the Institute of European Studies in Brussels, and a second LL.M from Duke University in the United States. François is admitted to the Belgian Bar, and a member of the Barreau de Bruxelles. François speaks French, English, Italian and Dutch.

Michael has extensive experience advising on all aspects of international capital markets transactions. A main focus of his practice are debt issuance programmes, corporate bonds, Pfandbriefe, Schuldscheine and structured products including credit linked notes, fund linked products and certificates. Another focus of his practice are derivative transactions and banking and securities regulations. Michael joined Allen & Overy in 2003. Prior to that, he worked in the capital markets department of a leading German law firm.
Person.Publications: Becker M. (2008) Co-author of Financial Services Regulation in Europe, Oxford University Press, 2nd edition

Person.Experience: Alexandru Retevoescu is a partner of RTPR, in association with Allen & Overy LLP. He is a qualified Romanian lawyer, registered with the Bucharest Bar. Alexandru focuses primarily on finance projects such as banking and project finance. However, since 1999 he has also been heavily involved in numerous transactions advising major international and Romanian clients on M&A (including leveraged acquisitions and privatisations on both the buy and sell side). He also has experience in real estate and competition matters.

María has broad experience advising in any type of corporate transactions. She has participated in several corporate transactions in relation to mergers, acquisitions, corporate restructuring, commercial contracts, advising both domestic and international listed and unlisted clients. Moreover, she has a wide experience in the drafting and coordination of legal due diligence in connection with domestic and cross-border transactions. Likewise, María has experience in performing Board secretary duties at all kinds of companies, as well as in advising enterprises of all kinds on rules of good governance.

Christina, a German Rechtsanwältin and a German Certified Tax Adviser, joined Allen & Overy LLP in 2008 as an associate in the Munich office, after six years of practical experience within Shearman & Sterling LLP, Munich and KPMG Deutsche Treuhand-Gesellschaft Aktiengesellschaft Wirtschaftsprüfungsgesellschaft, Munich. Christina has practical experience on a broad range of national and cross-border tax matters with a focus on corporate reorganisations, restructurings, M&A transactions, tax-efficient financing structuring and international tax planning. She has also experience in German corporate law, in particular related to M&A matters.

Jihad Agouram has seven years' experience and manages the litigation and arbitration projects including real estate, criminal and commercial law. He also specialised in employment, intellectual and residential law. Jihad has extensive and practical experience and understanding in litigation and arbitration. He qualified in Morocco.

Fedor specialises in real estate, real estate finance, projects and dispute resolution. He advises on purchasing, construction and lease of the industrial and commercial facilities, as well as on project and concession contracts under PPP and project finance transactions. He also has extensive experience working on EPC and other construction contracts, including contracts on the basis of model contracts of the International Federation of Consulting Engineers (FIDIC). His wide dispute resolution experience includes advising on international arbitration matters, large scale cross-border and domestic litigations.

Bernard Field is a Senior Of Counsel within the corporate/mergers & acquisitions department of Allen & Overy LLP Paris. Bernard joined Compagnie de Saint-Gobain in 1985 where he was successively appointed Legal Services Director, Director of Legal and Tax Affairs and Corporate Secretary and member of the Executive Committee of Saint-Gobain. Currently member of the AMF (French Financial Markets Authority) Enforcement Committee, Bernard was previously a member of the AMF's Board and chaired the AMF's working group on thresholds crossing declarations and participations in listed companies, a group which gave its recommendations in the "Field Rapport". Bernard was also rapporteur of the "Viénot II Rapport" and general rapporteur of the "Bouton Rapport" on corporate governance and co-headed the European Private Company Advisory Group. Amongst other responsibilities, Bernard was a member of the French National Accountancy Council, member of the Conseil supérieur de la participation and chairman of the Corporate Law Commission (Commission Droit de l'entreprise) of the MEDEF (Movement of French Enterprises). He is an Officer of the French Legion of Honor and Chevalier de l'Ordre national du Mérite' (National Order of Merit).

Goran is a specialist energy and resources lawyer who, in over 15 years of experience, has advised a broad spectrum of mining and energy clients in Australia and internationally, including China, the Philippines, Canada, Tanzania, Namibia, the Democratic Republic of Congo, Saudi Arabia, Brazil and New Zealand. Goran has extensive experience in major oil and gas and minerals projects with particular emphasis on contract negotiation, drafting and interpretation. His clients include those in the coal, power and gas industries including power generators, purchasers and operators. Goran has also been involved in dealings with the Economic Regulation Authority in relation to electricity licensing and regulatory issues. Goran has been actively involved in the energy and resources industry throughout his career.
Person.Publications: 'An Overview of the Development of Native Title in Australia', 2000 Gold Conference, Burswood Resort Casino, WA 'An Analysis of Re Calder: Ex Parte St Barbara Mines Ltd', 1999 Australian Mining & Petroleum Law Association State Conference, WA. (Awarded 'Best Speaker' Prize) 'A Mining Industry Perspective on Indigenous Land Use Agreements', 1999 National Native Title Tribunal ILUA Conference, WA 'Case note on Re Calder: Ex Parte St Barbara Mines Ltd' (2000) 19 AMPLJ 70-81 'Review of Margaret River Resources Pty Ltd v Shire of Augusta-Margaret River & ors' (2001) 20 AMPLJ 126-132 'Trespass and conversion on a mining lease: Finesky Holding Pty Ltd v Minister for Transport for Western Australia' (2001) 20 AMPLJ 190-195 'Challenges in and Strategies for dealing with Concurrent Mining and Petroleum Operations - A Western Australian Perspective', 2009 Western Australian Mining and Resources Law Conference, Sheraton Hotel, Perth, WA 'Responses to Frequently Asked Questions regarding Uranium Mining and Nuclear Energy in Western Australia' (unpublished client circular), 2007

Person.Experience: Felicity Gemson is a Professional Support Lawyer for Allen & Overy LLP's Global Employment & Benefits team. Felicity has a global focus and, with over 11 years' experience in her role, has developed considerable expertise on global employment issues which enables her to keep clients and colleagues briefed on key developments and trends. Felicity regularly collaborates with colleagues in our international network. As well as monitoring key legal developments across jurisdictions, she collects data and provides unique know-how to clients seeking to operate employment law policies and employee benefit plans on a cross-border basis. She has developed our online cross-border guides on restrictive covenants and restructuring, and has conducted surveys on financial sector pay reform and European Works Councils.

Michael is a senior PSL in Allen & Overy’s London banking practice. Michael gives technical advice to the firm’s lawyers and clients on a broad range of finance law issues. His expertise includes all aspects of secured and unsecured corporate debt finance. Michael also analyses the implications of legal developments for the firm’s banking practice, designs and delivers training to the firm’s lawyers and clients, and manages the banking practice’s know-how and standard form precedents. Michael is one of the firm’s representatives on the Loan Market Association's documentation committee. He is also a member of the PSL advisory panel for Butterworths Journal of International Banking and Financial Law, and a section editor of the Australian Journal of Banking and Finance Law and Practice. Previously, Michael practised as a transactional lawyer and has broad experience of a variety of financing transactions. Michael has worked in London and Sydney, and is dual-qualified in England and Australia.

Ivana is a member of the Central European Competition law team. She specialises in competition, regulatory and EU law. Her previous experience included working with another leading law firm in Brussels and in the Legal Service of the European Commission. Ivana has an extensive experience with merger clearance procedures before both the European Commission and the Czech Competition Authority, as well as abuse of dominance and restrictive agreements investigations. She has been involved in advising clients from various sectors including industrial and manufacturing, pharmaceutical, energy and telecommunications. Sources say that Ivana "is definitely one of the up-and-coming names to praise. She advises clients on merger control issues and other competition-related risks". CHAMBERS EUROPE 2012
Clients add: "We can rely on her know-how and client approach." CHAMBERS 2013

Antje Nehles, a German Rechtsanwältin and Württ. Notariatsassessorin, is a Senior Associate in the Frankfurt corporate department of Allen & Overy. She advises national and international corporations, investors and financial institutions on all aspects of German corporate and insolvency law, in particular in relation to general companies- , stock corporation- and transformation law and accompanied in addition several M&A transactions. A main focus of her practise is the corporate restructuring of insolvency threatened companies.

Radek advises clients mainly on direct taxation with particular focus on corporate tax advisory, financial services industry, planning and restructuring for corporate taxpayers, and direct tax aspects of European law. Sources say: “He has a deep understanding of technical details“.

Alan regularly represents clients in all areas of the real estate industry, including lenders, borrowers, institutional investors, sponsors, sellers, buyers, participants, landlords and tenants in sophisticated secured loan transactions, hotel and other commercial acquisitions, disposition, financings and management agreements, single and portfolio loan purchase and sales, loan intercreditor and participation agreements, debt workouts and restructurings, joint ventures and lease transactions.
Rebecca is an associate in the Projects, Energy & Infrastructure Group based in New York. She has experience advising ECAs and other lenders and sponsors on project financings around the world.

An-Sofie advises on general corporate law and specialises in corporate transactions, restructurings, private equity and M&A work. She has provided legal assistance to clients in various industries, both at national and international level.

Michael has represented corporate clients in intellectual property and complex commercial litigations and individual clients in regulatory investigations. He has experience in discovery as well as drafting and briefing motions at various stages of a litigation. Prior to joining the litigation group, Michael worked in Allen & Overy's real estate group representing clients in real estate finance transactions.

Andrea is an international arbitration lawyer. Her role encompasses strategy, business development, business planning, communications, recruitment, management, training and knowledge management for the firm's global arbitration practice.

Ruth Ward is Allen & Overy's Head of Central Knowledge Management and is a senior member of A&O's global know-how and training function. Ruth qualified as a banking lawyer in 1992 and worked in private practice before moving into legal KM in 2000. Since then, she has led a wide range of KM projects for A&O and its clients, and is particularly respected for her work on Web 2.0 collaboration technologies. Ruth heads A&O's central KM team, which is at the heart of A&O's global know-how and training function. Ruth and her team partner with offices and practice groups to develop and deliver the KM aspects of A&O’s global strategy. They nurture and share KM innovation and drive underlying systems development. They foster and facilitate best practice sharing and learning across A&O's KM community. They provide KM consultancy to A&O’s clients and play an active role in key client relationships. And they inform and support KM development for A&O’s associated and relationship firms. Outside the firm, Ruth plays an active role in KM and business networks. She regularly contributes to legal, business and KM conferences and publications. She is a founder member of the KM advisory group of the Society for Computers and Law. In 2010 she was a member of the Law Society's working committee on outsourcing.

Jeff is a U.S.-qualified Counsel, regularly advising investment banks and corporations on capital markets transactions, including 144A and Regulation S initial public offerings, rights issues and other equity and equity-linked transactions as well as debt private placements. Merrill Lynch on the SAR800m secondary capital raising by Capitec Bank Holdings Barclays and Citi on the GBP900m initial public offering and listing on the main market of the London Stock Exchange by Justice Holdings Limited Merrill Lynch on the USD250m initial public offering and listing on the Istanbul Stock Exchange by Bizim Toptan Satış Mağazaları Credit Suisse, HSBC and JPMorgan on the proposed equity rights issue and proposed private placement of up to USD5.0bn in subordinated notes by Prudential plc Weir Group plc on its private placement of USD160m and GBP55m senior unsecured notes Citi and Merrill Lynch on the GBP323m equity firm placing and open offer by Debenhams Lonmin plc on its USD477m equity rights issue Merrill Lynch, UBS, HSBC, RBS Hoare Govett and Barclays Capital on the GBP620m equity placing and open offer by Liberty International Wincanton plc on its GBP270m term and revolving credit facilities and private placement of USD30m senior unsecured notes ABN AMRO, BNP PARIBAS, Deutsche Bank and Merrill Lynch on the EUR450m rights issue by Alapis SA TomTom on its EUR359m rights issue and EUR71m private placement of ordinary shares Scottish and Southern Energy on its GBP479m equity placing Merrill Lynch and Morgan Stanley on the GBP224m sale of shares of Hansen Transmissions International NV by its controlling shareholders Hammerson on its GBP584m equity rights issue Moneysupermarket.com on its GBP840m equity initial public offering and listing on the main market of the London Stock Exchange QinetiQ on its GBP1.3bn equity initial public offering and listing on the main market of the London Stock Exchange TomTom on its EUR540m initial public offering and listing on Euronext Amsterdam TeleAtlas on its EUR537m initial public offering and listing on Euronext Amsterdam

Igor is an experienced and versatile Russian lawyer with wide ranging banking and finance expertise, including general lending, project finance, real estate finance, securitisation, derivatives and bank regulation. Igor also practises in the areas of international capital markets, M&A and dispute resolution. Igor is recognised by the Chambers, Legal500 and IFLR1000 legal directories as a leading practitioner.
Person.Publications: Igor is a frequent contributor to various regional and international publications.

Person.Experience: Frederik, a German Rechtsanwalt, joined Allen & Overy LLP in 2012. Frederik works in the Banking & Finance group in Frankfurt and provides German banking and finance law advice to national and international credit institutions and corporations.

Jim is a senior U.S. corporate finance partner based in our London office and has practiced in the United States, EMEA and Asia for more than 20 years. Until recently, he was the global head of capital markets at another of the market leading firms, where he was a partner for 13 years. Jim is a graduate of Yale University and Columbia Law School, and he practiced at Cravath, Swaine & Moore in New York and London and then at JP Morgan, in New York, Hong Kong, Singapore, and London, latterly as the group head of legal and compliance for the EMEA region and a member of the European Management Committee. Jim is recognised as a leading lawyer by the legal directories such as Legal 500.

Gideon has experience counseling clients on matters related to project development and financing and energy-related transactional matters. He has represented agency lenders, commercial banks, sponsors and developers in financing conventional and renewable power and natural gas infrastructure projects in South America, Africa, Europe and the U.S.

Greg's practice concentrates on international financing transactions, with particular emphasis on emerging markets in Africa, Central and South Asia, Latin America and the Middle East. He represents lenders (including development finance institutions, export credit agencies, multilateral institutions and commercial banks), host country governments and sponsors in connection with the development and financing of projects and private equity funds across a wide range of industry sectors - such as energy, financial services, housing, manufacturing, microfinance, petrochemicals and telecoms. Greg regularly is recognized by legal industry publications such as Chambers & Partners, Legal 500 and Best Lawyers in America as a leading attorney in the field of project finance.

Jean has represented agency and commercial lenders in complex project financings around the globe in a variety of sectors, including energy, telecommunications and oil and gas field development. Jean also served as internal counsel at SunEdison, a global solar energy services company, where she focused on expanding the company's operations outside the United States.

Ryan has experience representing agency lenders in complex international project financings in a variety of sectors including renewable energy, telecommunications and housing development. Ryan also has significant experience advising sovereign states and their agencies and instrumentalities on matters of public international law.

Cameron is a U.S. capital markets counsel based in Moscow. Prior to joining Allen & Overy in 2012, Cameron was an Executive Director in the capital markets execution team at Morgan Stanley in London. At Morgan Stanley, Cameron was responsible for structuring and executing European equity and equity-linked transactions, with a focus on equity offerings by Russian businesses. Before joining Morgan Stanley, Cameron was an associate at a major US law firm in its New York, London and Moscow offices. Cameron has extensive experience on Rule 144A and SEC-registered equity and debt offerings, including IPOs and follow-on offerings.

Katharina Stüber, a German lawyer, advises on all aspects of corporate law. Her focus is the advisory of listed stock corporations on legal issues in connection with the German stock corporation law, the law of affiliated companies as well as capital markets law, in particular the obligation of disclosure and publication on information resulting from admission to stock exchange. She has gained wide range of experience on litigation and has advised companies on transactions and transfer of business. Moreover she gives advice in aspects of the law of non-incorporated firms. She speaks German and English.

Abigail has extensive experience gained as a lawyer in major law firms in Australia and the UK, and as a structurer in the capital products team of a leading investment bank. She has a background in both debt and equity capital markets transactions, with particular experience in international regulatory capital and hybrid securities issuances. Abigail is qualified in both Australia and England and works on transactions in multiple jurisdictions with lawyers across Allen & Overy's global network. International benchmarking publication IFLR100 recognises Abigail's presence in both the Australian and UK markets and states that Abigail "has extensive experience in regulatory capital and hybrid securities issuances".
Person.Publications: 'Bail-ins - Just Another Self-Fulfilling Prophecy?', Banking & Finance Law Review 27.4 (2012).

Person.Experience: Patrick is specialised in debt capital markets transactions and structured products. Patrick's practice includes bond offerings, structured notes and Schuldscheine, OTC derivates, credit derivatives and repackagings. Further, Patrick advices issuers in the establishment and structuring of structured notes programmes and market participants with regard to the clearing of financial instruments.
Person.Publications: Scholl (2004) "Der private Sachverständige im Verhandlungsrecht" Nomos Verlag 2005 Scholl/Waltz (2009) "Das neue Schuldverschreibungsgesetz" Bondbook - Alles über Anleihen 2009/10 Scholl/Dreher/Geier (2010) "Mehr Sicherheit und Transparenz für Derivatmärkte" Börsenzeitung of 01/12/2010 Kusserow/Dreher/Scholl (2010) "Vertane Chance für Emittenten und Privatanleger" Börsenzeitung of 06/07/2011 Kusserow/Scholl (2011) "A road paved with good intentions" IFLR July/August 2011, 34ff. Kusserow/Scholl (2011) "Das ESMA Konsultationspapier und seine Auswirkungen auf Emissionsprogramme" RdF 2011, 3110ff.

Person.Experience: Arthit is an associate in the banking and finance practice of the Bangkok office. His practice includes capital markets, corporate and mergers and acquisitions transactions. He has experience advising clients in a number of mergers and acquisitions transactions as well as corporate financing transactions through equity, equity-linked and debt instruments. He also has experience advising numerous clients on legal issues relating to corporate laws and regulations of the Thai SEC and SET as well as conducting due diligence exercises for various transactions.
Pannalin Jantadee is a lawyer at Allen & Overy. If you would like to receive a current CV please email webmaster@allenovery.com.

Dr. Alexander W. Schilling, a German Rechtsanwalt, joined Allen & Overy LLP in 2012 as Associate in the Frankfurt banking and finance department. Before working for Allen & Overy, Alexander studied and graduated at the University of Marburg. He has experience in national and international financial transactions and advises in this area national and international credit institutions as well as borrowers.

Robert specialises in real estate structured finance, including loan origination, complex credit facilities and mezzanine financings. His experience includes working with a variety of national and regional financial institutions, real estate investment funds, insurance companies and institutional investors in structured finance transactions, including syndicated, securitized and single lender mezzanine and mortgage loans, construction and permanent loans, corporate, warehouse and subscription credit facilities, "repo" transactions, and other complex structured financings.

Anne-Françoise is an associate in the Banking, Projects, Energy and Infrastructure group. She is located in our São Paulo office and is a member of our Latin America practice. Anne-Françoise has advised multinational clients on a variety of project financings, general banking, structured finance, debt restructuring, corporate restructuring and mergers and acquisitions transactions. She has experience drafting and negotiating transaction documents and conducting and managing due diligence. Anne-Françoise is a native French and Dutch speaker, fluent in English and Portuguese.

Pawel advises on employment law, giving corporate and financial institutions counsel on their obligations as employers. He also advises on share plans and share schemes, including employee incentives. Additionally, his area of specialisation includes litigation in employment matters, management contracts, and advising on employment aspects of mergers and acquisitions.

François Guillaume advises on international banking and finance transactions, including syndicated lending, investment grade and leveraged acquisition finance, as well as debt restructuring. He also advises on regulatory matters relating to the financial services industry. François Guillaume has more than 9 years of experience in these areas. He is in charge of the banking department’s business development and knowledge development steering committee.
Person.Publications: "Enforcing financial collateral arrangements in the new world - challenging times!", Bulletin Droit et Banque, No 47, April 2011 (co-author)

Person.Experience: Bradley focuses his practice on complex commercial disputes and securities litigation, as well as regulatory investigations. He has represented leading financial institutions, multinational corporations and corporate officers and directors in complex litigations at the trial and appellate levels.
Person.Publications: Note, Whistling a Foul on the NCAA: How NCAA Recruiting Bylaws Violate the Sherman Antitrust Act, published in Volume 58, Book 2 of the Syracuse Law Review.

Person.Experience: Karen advises on legal and structuring issues in the area of OTC derivatives, specializing in credit derivatives. Karen works closely with several global financial services institutions on the implementation of various requirements mandated by the Dodd-Frank Act, principally in relation to Title VII. Prior to joining Allen & Overy, Karen was Executive Director & Assistant General Counsel at JPMorgan Chase covering the full range of transactional, clearing and derivatives matters, including advising front office and others internally on legal, regulatory, risk and other issues that arose in connection with product development, onboarding clients, transaction execution, credit events, clearing, collateral-posting obligations and disputes. Karen has been active on various industry working groups and initiatives including in relation to credit event settlement and Dodd-Frank documentation.
Joseph has experience advising debtors, creditors, and other stakeholders in relation to cross-border and domestic insolvency proceedings.

Person.LanguagesSpoken: English, French, German, Italian, Luxembourgish, Portuguese, Spanish
Person.Experience: Carmen, raised in Luxembourg, received a B.S. of Foreign Service with a concentration in Science and Technology in International Affairs from Georgetown University in Washington, DC, USA, and a JD degree from the University of Chicago Law School in Chicago, IL, USA. She is qualified as attorney at law in the State of New York, and joined Allen & Overy LLP in Frankfurt as an associate in the US Corporate Finance group after working at law firms in New York and Frankfurt. Carmen has experience in cross-border M&A and capital markets transactions. She is fluent in German and English and proficient in French, Spanish and Luxembourgish.

Dr. Bernd M. Geier is a German Rechtsanwalt and Solicitor (England & Wales) in the International Capital Markets practice of Allen & Overy LLP. Before joining Allen & Overy LLP in June 2012, he practised for five years with a leading German law firm in Frankfurt and London. Bernd Geier is a regulatory lawyer specialising in banking and insurance supervisory as well as in securities trading law and the market infrastructures regulation. In particular, Bernd Geier advises on the Basel III implementation, solvency II issues, the MiFID- and MAR reforms as well as the implementation of EMIR. His practice includes Bank-M&A transactions, the structuring of capital instruments, funds and other products for regulatory purposes as well as the clearing and settlement of financial instruments. Bernd Geier is lecturer for banking supervisory law and bank restructuring at the university of administrative sciences (Speyer).

Person.Experience: Gregory is an in-house lawyer with the Business Acceptance Unit of our Singapore office. Prior to joining Alen & Overy, Gregory was a partner in a regional Southeast Asian law firm and handled a range of corporate and commercial matters throughout the Southeast Asia region, with a particular emphasis on M&A, investment and doing business in Vietnam, Thailand, Indonesia, Myanmar and Laos.
Person.Publications: Co-author, “A Brief Glance at Anti-Corruption and Compliance Law in Thailand and Vietnam”, Asian Legal Business, Issue 11.01, January 2011 Co-author, “New Anti-Corruption Efforts in Thailand”, Asian Legal Business, Issue 11.11, November 2011

Person.Experience: Jens specialises in trade mark, design and patent law, unfair competition law, licensing and R&D projects, as well as employee inventions, anti-counterfeiting and the transfer and exploitation of intellectual property rights. He also advises and represents companies in court cases, in particular with regard to interlocutory relief, but also in developing and implementing image campaigns and product advertising, as well as in contract negotiations and corporate transactions.

Person.Experience: Jeff has extensive experience in securities enforcement, regulatory investigations, and complex cross-border litigation and regulatory matters. In particular, Jeff focuses his practice on advising clients in connection with cross-border civil, criminal and regulatory matters and frequently represents financial services firms, private investment funds, public companies and their officers, directors, and employees in investigations before the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), the Financial Industry Regulatory Authority (FINRA), the U.S. Department of Justice (DOJ), and numerous other domestic and foreign regulatory and governmental bodies. Jeff has represented a wide variety of clients in both domestic and cross-border investigations relating to potential violations of the U.S. securities laws, including accounting and disclosure requirements, insider trading, anti-corruption (FCPA), market manipulation and other financial reporting and securities matters. In addition, Jeff has conducted numerous internal investigations on behalf of financial services firms, private investment funds and public companies concerning financial reporting irregularities, potential violations of the FCPA (and its foreign counterparts), anti-money laundering regulations, employee ethics and whistleblower complaints. Jeff was recommended by Legal 500 United States in the area of Litigation: White Collar Criminal Defense, 2012. Clients surveyed commented that he “performs his work with great skill and confidence, and analyzes problems and tackles sensitive situations creatively and knowledgeably.” In an August 2013 survey conducted by Latin Lawyer on top anti-corruption experts Jeff was described as, “without question, one of a very short list of true Latin American anti-corruption specialists…peers recommend him for his thorough understanding of the anti-corruption compliance issues businesses face in Latin America and for his ‘deep relationships in the Latin American business community’”.

Person.Experience: Bill is experienced in representing financial services firms, public companies, and their officers, directors, and employees in U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) enforcement investigations, FINRA investigations, as well as related criminal investigations, internal investigations, and securities litigation. Over the years, Bill has led dozens of high profile securities matters including those involving insider trading, broker-dealer and investment adviser rules and regulations, accounting issues, public company disclosure requirements, and municipal securities regulation. Bill served for eight years on the staff of the Enforcement Division of the SEC serving as a staff attorney, branch chief and senior trial counsel. While at the SEC, Bill led investigations and litigation involving accounting and financial fraud, insider trading, municipal securities, broker-dealer and investment adviser violations and market manipulation.

Dirk, a German Rechtsanwalt, joined Allen & Overy LLP in August 2012. He previously worked with an international law firm in Frankfurt am Main and Singapore. Dirk is specialised in advising banks, insurance companies and corporate issues in connection with capital markets transactions (including hybrid capital issuances and convertible and exchangeable bonds).

John heads our cartel defense practice in the United States. He advises U.S. and international clients involved in domestic and cross border antitrust and other regulatory investigations and litigation. His practice spans government enforcement and private litigation of cartel and other antitrust infringements, market sector investigations, and general antitrust compliance, across all industry sectors. Previously, John was Director of Criminal Enforcement of the DOJ, Antitrust Division, where he had management responsibility for the Antitrust Division’s criminal investigations and litigation nationwide. In his tenure with the Antitrust Division, John investigated, litigated, and presided over some of the largest global cartel investigations undertaken by the DOJ. He also served as the Antitrust Division’s primary liaison with state, federal, and foreign law enforcement authorities, as well as the Antitrust Division’s Financial Fraud Coordinator for inter-agency prosecutions, investigations, and information sharing. John’s DOJ service earned him awards of distinction from the Attorney General of the United States and Assistant Attorney General for the Antitrust Division. John is a member of the Antitrust Sections of the American Bar Association (ABA) and International Bar Association (IBA) and is serving an appointment by the ABA on the International Cartel Task Force. John is also a regular author and frequent speaker on antitrust matters at ABA, IBA and other academic and client events.

Deanna's practice focuses on asset-backed securities having advised on SEC-registered, Regulation S, Rule 144A and/or Article 122a-compliant securities offerings backed by student loans, auto loans, auto leases, dealer floorplan receivables and mortgages, advising both issuers and underwriters. Meghan's practice focuses on advising financial institutions, primarily broker-dealers, investment advisers, hedge funds and private equity funds on compliance with federal securities laws and regulations. Specifically Meghan has advised broker-dealers with respect to compliance matters including trading surveillance, supervision, and compliance with Financial Industry Regulatory (FINRA) rules. Meghan also has experience counseling advisers to hedge funds and private equity funds on registration with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) and has experience advising broker-dealers and investment advisers on preparing for SEC examinations and responding to inquiries from FINRA. Prior to joining Allen & Overy, Meghan was an attorney advisor in SEC's Office of Compliance Inspections and Examinations, Office of Chief Counsel and served as a law clerk for the Honorable Debra Freeman.

Dao is the managing partner of Allen & Overy Vietnam. She advises multinational and domestic clients on a wide range of matters including corporate and M&A, banking and finance, real estate, energy and infrastructure. She has acted for developers and the government of Vietnam on several landmark project finance transactions including the first licensed BOT project in Vietnam. Dao is fluent in English and Vietnamese. The Asia Pacific Legal 500 2012 notes she is "head and shoulders above her peers in the market" and "demonstrates a detailed view of ongoing and likely future legal developments, a strong willingness to understand the client's needs, combined with a pragmatic approach". The Legal 500 adds she "may be the top lawyer in Vietnam for a complicated important energy project. The government agencies respect her experience and knowledge". Chambers Asia 2013 notes "she has an exceptional reputation in the market and is described by sources as an 'extremely knowledgeable and influential practitioner'". Chambers Asia 2011 also adds she is "highly regarded as the 'number-one real estate lawyer in Vietnam'". Dao is recognised as a leading lawyer by Chambers Asia in Corporate/M&A (2008-2013), Banking & Finance (2008-2012) and Projects & Energy (2010-2013). She was also named a Real Estate "Star Individual" by Chambers Asia (2008-2011).

Person.Experience: Ruth advises U.S. and multinational clients on a variety of corporate transactions, including domestic and cross-border M&A in the public and private contexts. She also has experience drafting transaction documents and conducting due diligence in a variety of industries.
Caitlin advises U.S. and multinational clients on various public and private M&A transactions and general corporate advisory work.

Akemi focuses on structured finance, projects and general banking transactions. She has also completed her legal training at The Legal Training and Research Institute of the Supreme Court of Japan. Akemi speaks fluent Japanese and English.

Dolly has extensive experience representing lenders, public authorities, developers and other equity participants on complex energy and infrastructure projects. She is considered an expert on public-private partnerships and concession arrangements and co-authored a "Model Law on Concession Agreements" published by the OECD. "Dolly Mirchandani is recommended for being 'skilled at managing complex transactions in challenging situations.'" Legal 500 US 2010 "Dolly Mirchandani is 'intelligent and extremely diligent.'" Chambers USA 2011

Kent represents investors, credit providers, public sector entities, contractors and other participants in infrastructure and natural resources transactions. His global experience is unique among natural resource and infrastructure lawyers. He’s been involved in major infrastructure financings in Asia, the Middle East, North America and the UK, including many first-of-their-kind transactions. He has played a leading role in the development of private finance in the transportation infrastructure sector in North America, having successfully closed many transactions now considered templates for infrastructure finance. He has been involved in the financial closing of more than 75 infrastructure and natural resources transaction worldwide. "Kent Rowey is a leading light of the US PPP legal market and is described as 'one of the truly great project finance deal attorneys: he has great knowledge and always achieves his goal.'" Chambers USA 2011

Person.Publications: Marine Money International, “Ship Finance in Australia - A Home Game?”, August/September 2011 Marine Money Asia, Update on the Australian Shipping reforms: “Ship Finance in Australia - A Level Playing Field?”, November 2011

Person.Experience: Sadi is an experienced finance and corporate associate. She has experience in advising clients (banks and borrowers) on many project financings, structured and acquisition financings, several headline mergers and acquisitions and general financing matters. Prior to qualifying as a solicitor, she spent a number of years as a paralegal working primarily on power projects.

Janna, a specialist in employment law, is an associate working in the Employment and Benefits group. She advises German and international companies in individual and collective employment law, in particular with regard to temporary agency work, drafting of employment contracts, employment litigation and transactions. Janna is experienced in dealing with works councils and trade unions. As a former member of the integrity compliance team of a listed company, Janna also focusses on HR Compliance.

Person.Experience: Anunciada has expertise regarding banking disputes relating to financial products. She has advised various financial institutions on claims raised by investors that purchased structured financial products. In addition, Anunciada has experience in IP matters. During the past three years, she has acted as counsel in both litigious and non-litigious matters relating to trademark, patent and plant varieties rights.

Mario, a German Rechsanwalt, joined the Frankfurt office of Allen & Overy LLP in October 2012. He previously worked as senior research assistant with Leibniz University of Hanover and as legal trainee with business law firms in Berlin and New York. He advises in corporate law and M&A transactions.
Ksenia is a German Rechtsanwältin and a Russian qualified lawyer in the International Capital Markets practice of Allen & Overy LLP. She primarily advises on banking regulatory law.

Andreas Fertig is a German Certified Tax Adviser, advising in all national and international tax matters with a special focus on tax (re-)structuring of multinational groups. Prior to joining Allen & Overy in October 2012 he spent 2 years as an inhouse tax adviser for a US-based multinational chemical company, focussing on tax structuring and planning, and 5 years at the corporate tax department of an international audit firm.

Claire is an associate in the Projects, Energy & Infrastructure Group in our New York office. She has experience representing sponsors, lenders and public authorities in connection with a range of major energy and infrastructure projects.
Sabrina advises on employment, immigration and general banking law matters. She joined Allen & Overy in 2012.
Person.Publications: "Immigration et droit du travail", Entreprises Magazine, Janvier/Février 2013 (co-author) "Remuneration policies: a trool expressing the increasing global scrutiny in the financial services sector", Newsletter of the International Bar Association Legal Practice Division, Vol 22 NO1 March 2012.
Co-author of a series of PLC practice notes covering shareholders' agreements and joint ventures in Hong Kong.

Person.Experience: Mary Katherine is an associate in the Projects, Energy & Infrastructure Group in our New York office.

Marc advises registered investment companies, private funds, money managers and other companies on regulatory and transactional issues. Marc represents clients in all aspects of the formation and operation of registered and private investment companies and investment advisers, and has extensive experience assisting pre-IPO and public operating companies, specialty finance companies, investment banks, financial product sponsors and other entities in determining their investment company status or the status of the products they sponsor, including the ability to qualify for exemptions from the Investment Company Act, in connection with securities offerings, financial product launches and other transactions. Marc also regularly advises money managers, family offices and other companies on investment adviser registration issues , exemptions from registration under the Investment Advisers Act and operational and compliance issues under the Investment Advisers Act. Prior to entering private practice, Marc spent over five years at the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission in the Division of Investment Management where he handled exemptive applications for registered investment companies and their advisers and sponsors.

Olaf is head of the public law group in Germany. Before joining Allen & Overy he was Partner in a leading German practice. He dealt with a wide range of projects and transactions in the public sector. Olaf has specific experience and expertise in public procurement, real estate and environmental law. He is the chairman of the Public Procurement Committee of the German Bar Association (DeutscherAnwaltVerein).

Person.Experience: Quy has over 12 years of experience advising on a wide range of matters including securities, banking & finance, debt capital market, corporate finance, M&A transactions, general commercial and other aspects of investment and corporate law in Vietnam. He represents issuers and arrangers on domestic and international bond issuance. He also acts for corporate borrowers, banks and other financial institutions on debt financing transactions including bilateral, syndicated and convertible loans.

Ines Litzenberger is a German-qualified lawyer who specialises in German and European competition law with particular experience in cartels, merger control, restrictive practices and abuse of dominance. Prior to joining Allen & Overy, she practised competition law with a large European-focused law firm in Brussels. Ines is admitted to the Düsseldorf bar and the Brussels bar (listed as a European lawyer). She is also a member of the Studienvereinigung Kartellrecht and the German-American Lawyers Association.

Person.Experience: Patrycja Sałacińska advises on all phases of concentration proceedings. She also prepares legal analyses concerning restrictive agreements, abuse of dominant position, violations of collective interests of consumers, unfair market practices and unfair competition. She represents clients before the Polish Competition Authority in investigations and antimonopoly and concentration proceedings. She participates in appeals against decisions of the President of the Polish Competition Authority before the Court of Competition and Consumer Protection.

Udo advises on administrative law, public procurement law and state aid, including aspects relating to European and constitutional law. His practice includes advising companies and local authorities on urban planning projects. He also specialises in the organisation and commissioning of public transport services by rail and road.

Person.Experience: Wiland advises clients on all aspects of administrative law. He specialises in public procurement, privatization and public private partnerships. He assists both contracting entities and bidders, with an emphasis on the public transport, building and civil engineering, logistics/IT, safety engineering, energy and insurance sectors, as well as in connection with public services of general interest.

Laena’s practice focuses on complex commercial disputes and regulatory and antitrust investigations. She has experience working with multinational corporations and major financial institutions involved in litigation at the trial and appellate levels and also has experience in internal investigations relating to potential regulatory violations.

Jonathan has experience representing commercial lenders and borrowers in connection with mortgage and mezzanine financing secured by commercial real estate, repurchase and warehouse financing, loan modifications and the acquisition and disposition of all debt tranches including participation interests, whole loans, mezzanine loans and B-notes.

Derek is an associate in the International Capital Markets group at Allen & Overy’s New York office. Derek has experience advising financial institutions and companies in global funds transactions, SEC-registered debt offerings and structured products transactions. He also has experience in regulatory projects undertaken in connection with the CFTC's commodity pool regulations (as amended by the Dodd-Frank Act) for a number of global banks. Derek was previously an associate in the firm’s project finance practice. Derek is a native English speaker and is conversant in Cantonese and Mandarin Chinese.
Julianne is an associate at Allen & Overy LLP.

Alex is currently an associate in the Banking-General Lending group. He has experience in both domestic and cross-border financing transactions representing both borrowers and lenders. These transactions include asset-backed aircraft and ship financing, restructuring facilities, bridge loans, distressed lending and general lending to energy companies.

Roger is an associate in the Projects, Energy & Infrastructure Group in our New York office. He has experience advising developers, utilities, lenders and lessors in a wide range of project finance, structured finance and leveraged leasing transactions.
Pedro De Miguel is a consultant at Allen & Overy. If you would like to receive a current CV please email webmaster@allenovery.com

Professor Lucian Mihai is an Of Counsel of RTPR in association with Allen & Overy LLP. He specialises in intellectual property and litigation area, including arbitration, having represented a number of high-profile foreign clients doing business in Romania. Dr. Lucian Mihai has over 30 years of experience as professor at the University of Bucharest, Faculty of Law, where he holds classes on civil law and intellectual property law. Professor Lucian Mihai is a former chairman of the Commission for drafting the New Civil Code and the Law for its Enactment, former President of the Romanian Constitutional Court (the highest legal position in Romania), member of the Venice Commission, as well as General Secretary of the Chamber of Deputies. Professor Lucian Mihai is listed as arbitrator of the Court of International Commercial Arbitration, attached to the Romanian Chamber of Commerce and Industry since 1993, the Romanian Copyright Office since 1998 and LCIA since 2011. He has taken part in numerous international cases as counsel, arbitrator or expert-witness. Professor Lucian Mihai acted also as ad-hoc judge of the European Court of Human Rights. For more than 18 years Professor Lucian Mihai has been the "Honorary Legal Adviser" to the Ambassador of the United Kingdom in Bucharest. In the 2012 edition of "Chambers Europe", Professor Lucian Mihai is described as “probably the most experienced guy in the Romanian IP sector". Over the past decade he was constantly ranked in "Band 1" as a leading individual in the fields of Intellectual Property and Dispute Resolution by "Chambers Europe" and "Legal 500".

Person.Experience: David advises registered funds, private funds and their investment advisers, registered fund and private fund investors, and other companies on asset management issues arising under the Investment Company Act of 1940 and the Investment Advisers Act of 1940. He also counsels clients on the establishment and ongoing operation of registered funds (open-end and closed-end), exemptions from regulatory requirements, new product development and alternative fund structures (including registered and unregistered master/feeder and fund-of-funds structures and business development companies), and on structuring, negotiating, and documenting fund and adviser mergers, acquisitions, and reorganizations.
Person.Publications: "SEC Staff Permits Streamlined Registration for Some Investment Advisers," The Investment Lawyer, April 2012, Volume 19, Number 4. "SEC Proposes New Anti-Fraud Rule under the Investment Advisers Act of 1940," The Investment Lawyer, April 2007, Volume 14, Number 4.

Person.Experience: Ann has experience representing lenders in international project financings in a variety of sectors. At her previous firm she worked on a variety of tax issues with a focus on international tax disputes, including the representation of taxpayers before the Internal Revenue Service and foreign tax authorities on tax treaty issues and transfer pricing matters, such as advance pricing agreements and competent authority proceedings. Ann is a native English speaker, fluent in Spanish and proficient in French.

Person.Experience: Meghan is an associate in the international capital markets practice.

Sophie has experience in both litigation and transactional work. In litigation, she has experience in antitrust investigations, the extraterritorial application of U.S. law, conspiracy liability, bankruptcy and intellectual property. Sophie’s transactional experience includes advising clients on a variety of corporate matters, including domestic and cross-border mergers and acquisitions. Sophie is fluent in French.
Loren is an associate in the corporate group.

Poliana Naum joined RTPR Allen & Overy in 2007 as a law student. She is a qualified lawyer registered with the National Union of Romanian Bar Associations and the Bucharest Bar since 2009. Poliana has experience and knowledge in various areas of law, such as banking & finance and general corporate and real estate aspects. She specializes mainly in advising international banks and borrowers on banking & finance matters, such as corporate finance, leveraged finance and real estate finance. Poliana was a member of the legal teams which advised several international banks in syndicated and bilateral finance transactions and in relation to real estate projects financing granted to reputed real estate developers and restructuring of the finance documents, as well as in relation to the Romanian law matters in connection with the issuance of bonds and the security package in connection thereto and related intercreditor arrangements. She also advised on the issue by the Romanian Ministry of Public Finance of notes under a MTN Programme, was a member of the legal team that advised a major Romanian bank in relation to the sale of the Romanian retail and royal preferred banking business (the largest sale to date) and was a member of various legal teams handling the due diligence aspects in relation to Romanian companies. Poliana also has experience in drafting memoranda and performing various legal analysis on different legal issues on banking, corporate or real estate aspects.

Benjamin specialises in the structuring, setting up, and registration of regulated funds (UCITS, Part II funds and SIFs) and SICARs for institutional and non-institutional investors in a variety of areas such as private equity, real estate, equity, bonds and derivatives. He also specialises in insurance and reinsurance regulatory matters. Benjamin joined Allen & Overy in 2012.

"Les directives de coordination du droit des sociétés", in N. Thirion (coord.) et alii, Droit européen et international des sociétés, Bruxelles, Larcier, 2009, pp. 103-156.

Person.Experience: Allia Skalli is specialised in international arbitration and A.D.R. (Alternative Dispute Resolutions). She worked with international law firms and arbitrators. She also participated to several international competitions in mediation (ICC Mediation Competition) and arbitration (Will Vis Moot). Admitted to the New York Bar.

Kurt is experienced in representing financial services firms, accounting firms, public companies, and their officers, directors and employees in securities and financial institution enforcement investigations conducted by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), Financial Industry Regulatory Authority (FINRA), the U.S. Department of Justice (DOJ), and court-appointed receivers. Kurt is also experienced in advising clients in connection with, securities law compliance, internal investigations, and civil and criminal litigation. In particular, Kurt has represented clients in matters involving alleged securities or financial fraud, insider trading, FCPA compliance, and Ponzi schemes allegations.

Person.Experience: Duc advises both multinational and domestic clients in a variety of areas of banking and corporate law. He has led numerous landmark project finance, M&A and capital market transactions both in Vietnam and on behalf of Vietnamese clients in other markets. With 19 years of legal practice (including 12 years as managing partner of VILAF), Duc is recommended as one of the leading lawyers in Vietnam by the major international legal guides. ALB Magazine (2013) named Duc as one of Asia's best 75 lawyers and one of two from Vietnam. Chambers Asia 2008 notes, “The outstanding Tran Anh Duc is increasingly involved in corporate law, in addition to his flagship banking practice. He applies his foreign law firm experience with panache, and peers laud his 'extremely commercial approach'”. He is “knowledgeable and able to perform to international standards” (IFLR1000 2006) and "is regarded as a 'trailblazer' by his peers" (Chambers Asia 2012). According to Chambers Asia 2012, “Tran Anh Duc is a well-established name in Vietnam with sought-after expertise on international transactions and a wealth of experience in high-value deals”. Legal 500 2013 also confirms "Tran Anh Duc is one of Vietnam’s leading corporate lawyers".

Dennis joined Allen & Overy in 2013. He has gained experience in financial supervisory law in general and investment law as well as securitisation in particluar. Before joining Allen & Overy, he was an Advisor at the German Federal Financial Supervisory Authority (BaFin) and, prior to that, he worked at a leading international law firm in Munich.

Person.Experience: Sebastian Schulz joined A&O's Employment & Benefits team in 2013. He studied law in Kiel and Hamburg. Under the supervision of Prof. Dr. Nolte, he wrote his doctorial dissertation on "Grundrechtskollisionen im Berufssport" (Conflicting fundamental rights of professional sport persons). Since being admitted as a German Rechtsanwalt, Sebastian has worked exclusively in the field of employment law. He advises international and national companies in individual and collective employment law. Sebastian focuses on all employment law aspects in relation to restructurings and transfer of businesses as well as outsourcing and offshoring projects. Furthermore, he frequently advises on reconciliation of interests and social plans, employment due diligence matters, employment compliance (including internal investigations) and on the implementation of codes of conduct.

He has advised on civil, commercial and public law areas, primarily litigation on product liability, insolvency proceedings and claims against countries. José Manuel has experience acting for major financial institutions and investment banks, on contentious and non-contentious matters, as well as major national and international companies in the pharmaceutical, media and energy sectors.

Person.Experience: David, a German Rechtsanwalt, joined Allen & Overy LLP in February 2013 after his studies at the Philipps-University of Marburg and Second German Law Degree. He works in the Banking & Finance group in Frankfurt and provides German banking and finance law advice.

Madeleine is an associate in the Projects, Energy and Infrastructure Group in our New York office and has a broad range of experience as a transactional finance lawyer, specializing in project finance, corporate finance, real estate finance and acquisition finance. Madeleine primarily works in the U.S. domestic infrastructure space, advising on greenfield and brownfield projects on behalf of sponsors and lenders. She also has considerable experience in the Australian corporate finance market, acting for lenders, including the major trading banks and foreign and local investment banks as well as borrowers, including ASX 500 listed companies and private equity firms.

Maxim practices in the areas of corporate, commercial and energy and resources law and has advised on a number of commercial transactions, including takeovers, mergers, acquisitions, disposals and capital raisings.

Thomas has worked in Hong Kong, Bangkok and Tokyo. His asset finance experience covers aircraft, ships, FPSOs and other equipment, financed through a variety of lease or off-balance sheet structures. With regard to project finance, he has advised banks, export credit agencies and sponsors in a number of sectors, including power, oil and gas and telecommunications.

Dr Wolf Bussian is a partner in the Frankfurt office of Allen & Overy. The focus of his work is on financial services litigation. He represents banks, insurers, accounting firms and other companies, advisors and investors in disputes both in and out of court. Wolf has extensive experience in defending investor class actions and professional investor claims. He also frequently advises on capital market disputes and capital market-related professional indemnity claims as well as disputes in the field of payment services. In this context, he regularly deals with international civil procedural law issues, in particular in relation to the UK and the United States. Wolf also conducts internal investigations, typically in multi-jurisdictional teams from several practice groups (e.g. regulatory, tax, corporate). He furthermore has extensive experience with corporate law proceedings, e.g. following up on M&A and property transactions or relating to structural measures, as well as complex and frequently multi-jurisdictional disputes arising under contracts. Wolf publishes regularly on procedural, capital market and banking issues.

Person.Experience: Dr Marc Zimmerling is a partner in the dispute resolution practice of Allen & Overy. Before joining Allen & Overy, he worked for another renowned international law firm for 16 years (eleven years as a partner), specialising in litigation and dispute resolution. He represents clients in all types of national and cross-border disputes before state and arbitration courts. Marc regularly acts for national and international companies from the financial services, insurance, IT, retail and professional services sectors. He has extensive experience in complex commercial and corporate as well as insurance disputes. A particular focus of his work is on professional indemnity and directors' liability. Marc also advises on all D&O issues. Furthermore, he has broad experience in the area of risk prevention and risk management as well as in various fields of alternative dispute resolution. Marc has repeatedly been named by Juve as frequently recommended lawyer in conflict resolution and corporate disputes. His corporate litigation, post-M&A, class action and professional indemnity and D&O practice was recognised as a "highly regarded practice" in PLC Which Lawyer 2009.

Person.Experience: Dr Charlotte Willemer has been working as a dispute resolution lawyer since 2007 and is a senior associate at Allen & Overy in Frankfurt. She specializes in commercial and corporate litigation as well as in professional indemnity matters. A further focus of her work are insurance related disputes. In this context, she advises national and international clients in all areas of dispute resolution and in national and international arbitrations. She regularly deals with matters of private international law and international civil procedure law.

Person.Experience: Dr. Mirka Sagemann qualified as a German Rechtsanwältin in 2012 and joined the Hamburg corporate department of Allen & Overy LLP in 2013. Since then, Mirka has gained experience in connection with a range of corporate transactions, in particular M&A and joint ventures. She advises German and international corporations in all areas of corporate law including restructurings and distressed transactions.

Fabian specialises in real estate, construction and environmental law. He has experience across a wide range of areas, including real estate development, lease and construction agreements and environmental disputes. Fabian joined Allen & Overy in June 2012 after graduating in 2012 from the Erasmus School of Law.

For over 20 years, Jane has been looking after the interests of property investors, corporate occupiers, retailers, developers, lenders and others on a full spectrum of contentious or potentially contentious property issues, often at a strategic level. Jane's experience includes all manner of landlord and tenant related disputes (whether lease breach, rent reviews, dilapidations, service charge disputes or renewals), development issues, including disputes over overage or third party interests, and insolvency related property issues. She also has a particular expertise in the Telecoms Code. Jane is recognised as a leading individual in her field by Legal 500 and Chambers UK. Jane is described by sources as "a seriously bright lady who is enthusiastic for the law" : Chambers 2013 The "sharp" and "highly respected" Jane Fox-Edwards: Legal 500 2012

Thyl, a German Rechtsanwalt, joined Allen & Overy LLP in 2013 as an associate in the Düsseldorf Corporate Department. Prior to joining Allen & Overy LLP, Thyl worked for other renowned international law firms among others in Duesseldorf and London as Research Fellow/Trainee. He advises national and international organisations on all matters regarding corporate law, with focus on stock corporation law, limited liability company law, group law, and transformation law. This includes in particular matters regarding Corporate Governance, national and cross-border M&A transactions, international joint ventures and restructurings. Furthermore, he is specialised in corporate litigation.

Person.Experience: Maciej is a senior associate in Allen & Overy's Global Projects, Energy and Infrastructure Group based in Warsaw. He has broad experience in advising clients on cross-border financings, especially in the energy sector. His wider banking experience includes restructurings, real estate finance, asset finance, acquisition finance and general lending. He has advised borrowers, project companies, investors and lenders on transactions throughout Europe.

Tomasz Ciećwierz specialises in corporate and capital markets law. He has an extensive experience in cross-border M&A transactions, restructuring projects and project finance. He advises private equity investors and hedge funds in FDIs and capital market investments.

Adriana joined RTPR Allen & Overy in 2011. She is a member of the Bucharest Bar and of the National Union of Romanian Bar Associations. Starting with 2008 Adriana represented domestic and international companies in various litigation matters. Adriana has extensive experience with respect to commercial, competition, tax, employment, public procurement, real estate and IP litigation. Adriana provided representation before the Romanian courts and jurisdictional authorities to major companies, but also provided legal assistance in the settlement of disputes in order to avoid litigation. Adriana successfully represented a renowned Greek bank with respect to the insolvency proceedings of a business partner during which the client recovered almost entirely the receivable (exceeding EUR 2 million) and the association led by the international corporation Hamon Research Cottrell in relation to successive complaints and applications related to public procurement procedures. Adriana was part of the legal team which successfully represented Greif Flexibles Romania SRL (formerly Storsack Romania) in challenging a tax decision imposing on the client the obligation to pay an amount exceeding EUR 2 million and Profi Rom Food in challenging the Competition Council decision sanctioning the company for an alleged price fixing agreement.

Alina Stăvaru joined RTPR Allen & Overy in 2009. She is is a qualified lawyer, member of the Bucharest Bar and of the National Union of Romanian Bar Associations. Alina is primarily involved in mergers and acquisitions, particularly private equity, complex corporate and capital restructurings, spin-offs, capital markets and other corporate matters, as well as energy related matters.

Tudor Naftica joined RTPR Allen & Overy in 2012. Tudor is a member of the Bucharest Bar Association and the National Union of Romanian Bar Associations. He has experience in advising on mergers and acquisitions, corporate and commercial law, as well as environment protection legislation in Romania. Tudor is primarily involved in mainstream corporate transactions (both M&A and advisory work), finance and capital markets transactions (including restructurings, mandatory takeover offers, public purchase offers, squeeze-out procedures) as well as real estate transactions (including land acquisitions, construction and retail development). He is experienced in advising international private equity houses, investment funds and investment banks in various types of acquisitions on the Romanian market.

Anca Rusu joined RTPR Allen & Overy in 2012. She is a qualified lawyer, member of the Bucharest Bar and of the National Union of Romanian Bar Associations. Anca’s experience includes advising many investors on the acquisition of some of the largest wind farms and solar plants developed in Romania, as well as major financing institutions on regulatory matters related to renewable projects seeking for financing. She also assisted a leader group in the European electricity market in connection with the acquisition of a company operating micro hydropower plants in Romania and the acquisition of a wind farm in Dobrogea region, part of the largest onshore wind farm project in Europe.

Jerzy Zdrojewski specialises in banking and real estate law. He has extensive experience in banking and payment services law and practice. His work involves advising major banks, institutional investors and corporate clients on a wide range of banking and derivatives transactions. He also has substantial experience of regulatory law and practice. He has advised banks on standard documentation of banking products designed for both consumers and companies and particularly focuses on cash pooling structures. Jerzy also advised on many export credit facilities granted by a Polish banks to foreign investors conducting projects in Russia and Thailand. He has also experience in consumer finance and regulatory aspects of banking services.

Person.Experience: Nadja works in the investment funds department advising clients on the structuring and implementation of UCITS funds and AIF. She also provides legal counsel to clients on their overall opportunities in dealing with their funds business in Luxembourg. She specialises in European law matters with a particular focus on the fulfilment of the ongoing European regulatory framework applicable to investment funds. Nadja is a German qualified lawyer with three years of experience dealing with international and European law matters. She joined Allen & Overy in 2013.

Lorenz initially joined the Frankfurt banking department as a banking associate in 2013. He has experience advising in the field of banking law including project financings and cross-border transactions.

Antonio is an Associate Lawyer in Allen and Overy office in Madrid since September 2013. Having finished his Bachelor in Laws and his Bachelor in Business Administration he is a fully registered Lawyer and Economist. Antonio has gained experience working in international mergers and acquisitions as well as restructuring projects. Likewise, he has broad experience in different kind of areas and business as well as in Public Administration. Antonio is a member of the Spanish Bar Association and a member of the Spanish Economist Scholar Association.
Alexei is a German Rechtsanwalt in the International Capital Markets practice of Allen & Overy LLP.

Adrian Cazan joined RTPR Allen & Overy in 2013. He is a qualified lawyer, member of the Bucharest Bar and of the National Union of Romanian Bar Associations. Adrian has extensive experience in all aspects of real estate and M&A transactions, with a focus on renewable energy projects and public procurement. These include the sale and purchase of investment properties; development and urban regeneration; property finance; leasing and letting activities. His practice areas also include general commercial and contract law, construction law, energy law and projects.

Friederike is member of the corporate practice. Before joining Allen & Overy LLP in 2013, she worked in the Corporate Department of another international law firm. Friederike advises national and international companies on corporate and capital markets law as well as on M&A transactions. This includes in particular advice on annual general meetings, corporate reorganisations and general corporate law advice as well as matters regarding Corporate Governance.
