Person.Experience: Dorothée is a German Rechtsanwältin und member of the corporate practice. Before she joined Allen & Overy LLP in 2013, she had worked for another international law firm. Dorothée advises national and international companies regarding corporate law, capital markets law and M&A transactions.

Hans joined Allen & Overy LLP in May 2013 as a corporate partner in the Düsseldorf office. He primarily advises on corporate and capital markets law as well as on M&A transactions including public takeovers. German DAX and MDAX companies, financial institutions and large listed companies count among his regular client base. In addition to his M&A work Hans advises his clients inter alia on annual general meetings, initial public offerings, corporate reorganisations as well as on general corporate law advice and on financing issues. He also regularly advises executives and board members on matters relating to corporate compliance. Hans regularly publishes on corporate and stock corporation law issues. In his former career Hans worked for more than seven years in the central legal department of Deutsche Bank in Frankfurt as well as a partner in another international law firm. Independent German and international legal directories frequently rank him among the leading lawyers in the areas of corporate and capital markets law.

Alasdair advises clients involved in EU and UK competition and regulatory investigations and litigation as well as coordinating local counsel on multi-jurisdictional matters. His practice spans merger control, cartel and other antitrust infringements, market/sector investigations and general antitrust regulatory and EU law counselling, across many industry sectors including financial services, aviation, life sciences, manufacturing, leisure, retail, energy and TMT. Alasdair has been practising antitrust for over 15 years, is a regular author and speaker on competition law matters and has taught competition law in the UK and the United States. He has secured EC, UK and international merger clearances for many clients, including "phase II" and "remedies" cases before the EC and UK authorities. Alasdair has defended clients involved in the air cargo, automotive components, window fittings and construction cartel investigations and litigation. He has also advised clients involved in the European Commission financial services and energy sector investigations and the UK SME banking, British airports and pharmacy market investigations. Alasdair is recognised as a 'leading individual' in his field in both the Chambers and Legal 500 legal directories. "Alasdair Balfour is highly recommended for his ability to see to the core of a problem and explain issues simply" (Chambers and Partners Global 2013 and Chambers and Partners UK 2013), and "Alasdair Balfour is outstanding" (Legal 500 UK 2012). He is also recognised by Super Lawyers 2013 for EU Law. "Alasdair Balfour is viewed as 'very analytical' as well as a 'practical thinker'. He adds to the team's strengths in cross-border competition work and both domestic and European level market investigations." Chambers UK 2014 (Competition and European Law).

Jens Heneweer, a German Rechtsanwalt, is a member of the corporate practice. Before joining Allen & Overy LLP in 2013, he worked in the corporate / M&A department of another international law firm. Jens Heneweer advises national and international companies on all matters of corporate and capital markets law and in M&A transactions. This includes in particular questions of corporate governance, transformation and group law as well as corporate compliance.
Person.Publications: Heneweer, Jens (2009) „Das forum shopping einer GmbH unter der deutschen Insolvenzordnung und der Europäischen Insolvenzverordnung”, dissertation at Düsseldorf University

Person.Experience: Nicole is an associate in the Frankfurt Public and Environmental Law Group. Prior to her career as a lawyer, she was a research assistant in the Frankfurt Public and Environmental Law Group. With Allen & Overy Nicole gained practical experience in procurement law, planning and environmental law.

Brian advises and drafts documents in connection with corporate transactions including mergers & acquisitions, LBOs, spin-offs and IPOs; advises public and private companies regarding the design, implementation and administration of annual and long-term incentive compensation plans, equity incentive compensation arrangements, deferred compensation plans, and other employee benefit plans; drafts employment, change in control, severance and retention arrangements; advises regarding taxation (including sections 162(m), 280G and 409A), ERISA, securities and regulatory laws regarding compensation and employee benefits; advises compensation committees; drafts proxy and related securities filings regarding employee benefits; advises on TARP and other banking regulatory laws. Brian advises private equity funds on executive compensation and ERISA issues in transactions. Brian advises on ERISA issues in credit agreements, transactions and plan asset issues in venture capital arrangements. He also advises in relation to shareholder advisory group issues.

Mark is a senior litigation partner with extensive experience in complex and strategically significant litigation, international arbitration and contentious regulatory work. He has acted for leading corporations in the energy and resources sector in Australia on matters ranging from major engineering and project disputes, joint venture disputes and arbitrations, through to responding to regulatory investigations and associated civil penalty proceedings. He also acts regularly in director and shareholder disputes. He has more than 20 years’ experience advising key clients including Fortescue Metals Group (FMG), China Metallurgical Corporation, Minara Resources, Norilsk Nickel and Resolute Mining. Mark has been voted by his peers as one of Australia’s Best Lawyers for Litigation since its inception in 2009 and in Alternative Dispute Resolution and International Arbitration in 2013.

Mike focuses on patent litigation as well as other intellectual property matters. He has represented clients at all stages in jury trials and ITC investigations, from pre-suit investigations to post-trial motion practice. Mike has significant experience litigating patents related to electrical engineering and computer science, particularly technology used in modern smartphones. The technologies in these matters includes detection circuitry, analog and digital coding and decoding, optical switching and networking, error correction codes, user interfaces, windowing systems, and human-computer interaction. Mike also has experience in trademark and copyright disputes.
Person.Publications: Michael Sadowitz, 2008, “Who Determines Post-Verdict Damage Awards for Patent Infringement in a Post-eBay World?,” MTTLR Blog, http://blog.mttlr.org/2008/10/who-determines-post-verdict-damage.html Michael Sadowitz, Shahram Latifi, and David Walker, 2008, “An Iris and Retina Multimodal Biometric System,”, 3 International Journal of Security and Networks 4

Person.Experience: Adam is an associate in the Banking team. Adam joined the Bangkok office from another magic circle firm’s London office in June 2013, where he was an associate specialising in real estate matters. He has experience in advising a range of clients on all aspects of commercial property work including acquisitions, disposals and financing and on the commercial property aspects of corporate M&A, financing, restructuring and insolvency matters. He has also advised on major property development projects in London and other infrastructure development projects in the Middle East. His recent finance, projects and M&A experience includes advising:

Camilla, a German Rechtsanwältin, joined Allen & Overy LLP in 2008 as an associate in the Frankfurt corporate department. Camilla advises stock corporations and investment banks in capital market and corporate law matters and gained experience in connection with capital market transactions, e.g. IPOs, rights issues, convertible and exchange bond issues.

Person.Experience: Victor specialises in international arbitration. He has long experience acting as counsel or as arbitral secretary in both ad hoc and institutional arbitration proceedings conducted under the most important arbitral institutions (ICC, LCIA, ICSID, Madrid Court of Arbitration…). His experience covers both investment and commercial arbitration and in multiple venues such as Paris, Madrid, London, Frankfurt, Geneva or Bucharest, among others. He advises in a variety of industries and sectors, including corporate, oil & gas, renewable energies and international commercial transactions. In addition he currently serves as sole arbitration in an ICC arbitration case. Victor collaborates very frequently with educational entities and universities lecturing on international arbitration matters. At present he is a member of the Global Advisory Board of the ICDR Y&I of the American Arbitration Association.

Person.Experience: David Lewis has been a partner in the tax department since 1982. He obtained an LLB from Exeter University and qualified as a solicitor in 1976. He deals with all aspects of UK and international corporate tax work including UK and cross-border mergers and acquisitions and group reorganisations and reconstructions. He also has wide experience of a range of banking and capital markets transactions.

Person.Experience: Joachim has practised complex patent litigation since more than 20 years and across all technical fields, with a particular focus on pharmaceuticals and biotechnology. He has experience developing and implementing international patent litigation strategies in numerous European jurisdictions, including on the requirements arising from parallel patent litigation in the United States. He represents clients in infringement and validity cases before all major patent courts, the Federal Supreme Court and the Federal Patent Court. He has acted in arbitration proceedings on patent disputes as well as a mediator to settle such disputes. Joachim regularly represents clients in opposition proceedings before the European Patent Office. He also has advised on various technology transfer agreements in Europe and the United States, as well as in CIS countries such as Belarus and Uzbekistan, and has had frequent involvement in dispute resolution regarding such agreements. In addition, he is involved in the preparatory work for setting up a Unified Patent Court in Europe.

Person.Experience: Gregor joined Allen & Overy in 2013 after completing his Second State Exam in Law. He advises multi-national corporations and financial institutions on a wide range of transactions, including acquisitions, restructurings and financing transactions, as well as on tax audits.

Carl is a senior litigator who acts in complex litigation, arbitrations and contentious regulatory work. Carl has acted in a variety of disputes related to the Energy and Resources sector including major contractual disputes, defence of contractor claims, banking &finance related disputes, and director & shareholder disputes. In recent years, Carl has acted on major litigation for Fortescue Metals Group(FMG), China Metallurgical Corporation, Resolute Mining Ltd and Rothschilds.

Adrianus is a financial services lawyer who has also spent significant time working as a financial services regulator in the Middle East, Europe and North America. As a result Adrianus combines an in-depth understanding of commercial realities and global regulatory developments, benefiting his client base comprising of the world's leading financial institutions, government entities, regulators and market operators. In the past 8 years he has advised a large number of financial services clients in the GCC and has been at the forefront of creating innovative regulatory frameworks.

David has expertise regarding banking disputes relating to financial products. He has advised various financial institutions on claims raised by investors that purchased structured financial products. In addition, David has experience in construction matters. During the past years, he has acted as counsel in litigious matters relating to claims seeking indemnifications due to construction defects or delays in the delivery of a construction. David has also intervened as counsel in disputes between shareholders with regards to company resolutions, giving advice to shareholders in both litigious and pre-litigious or negotiation stages.

Roman, a German Rechtsanwalt, joined Allen & Overy LLP's Frankfurt office in August 2013 as an associate in the Corporate/M&A practice. He specialises in cross-border and domestic M&A transactions with a focus on private equity transactions and in corporate law. Roman has previously worked with two other international major law firms where he has advised a broad range of German and international clients mainly on IPOs, capital measures and corporate law. Further, he has worked as a Secondee for an international investment bank in 2012. Before his legal studies he worked as a qualified bank clerk.

Person.Experience: Pongphon is an associate in the banking and finance practice of the Bangkok office. His practice includes capital market, corporate and mergers and acquisitions transactions. He has experience advising clients on both equity-linked and debt securities offerings and public companies law, corporate registrations, domestic and cross-border mergers and acquisitions as well as advising clients on the Securities and Exchange law and regulations, including Thai SEC and the SET.

Johanna, a German Rechtsanwältin, is member of the corporate group. Before she joined Allen & Overy LLP in the Duesseldorf office in 2013 she worked as a lawyer for other renowned international law firms. Predominantly, Johanna advises on M&A transactions and general company law matters.

Patricio has gained experience advising in Corporate and M&A Law. He has participated in several corporate transactions in relation to mergers, spin-off, segregation and acquisition processes, as well as corporate restructuring, advising both domestic and international clients. Moreover, he has a wide experience in the drafting and coordination of legal due diligence in connection with domestic and cross-border transactions. Likewise, Patricio has experience in performing Board secretary duties at all kinds of companies.

Álvaro has a broad experience in the Public and Zoning Law fields. During his career he has advised both private and public entities in Public and Zoning Law matters. He has taken part in the elaboration of legal opinions and reports and has recurrently advised entities which operate in diverse economic sectors. Likewise, he has recurrently advised in zoning elaboration and land management, as well as planning permission. He has also a broad experience in administrative and contentious-administrative procedures of any kind and has taken part in both the strategic decisions and its implementation.

Person.Publications: Creating Policy Space? : The Inclusion of the General Exception in the ASEAN Investment Agreements. Presented at the Soochow 2010 Conference on International and Comparative Law, Taipei, Taiwan. Joint paper with Assoc Prof. Michael Ewing-Chow of NUS-Centre for International Law.

Person.Experience: Vanessa has a broad practice advising her clients on merger clearance, cartels and other antitrust matters before the European Commission and other regulators. Prior to joining Allen & Overy, Vanessa was General Counsel and Executive Vice President, Company Secretary at Visa Europe, and a member of the Cabinet of the European Commissioner for Competition. She has a wealth of experience from the European Commission and the financial services sector and also has particular experience in the IT and air transport sectors, having been involved in important cases in these areas. Before joining the Commission, Vanessa spent eight years as a partner in a leading Brussels antitrust practice. Vanessa is regularly invited to speak at high-profile conferences on antitrust and competition matters. Relevant former experience includes advising Neelie Kroes, the former EU Commissioner for competition policy, on a range of antitrust and merger cases and policy, including the Microsoft browser case and other leading IT cases, airline mergers, cartels and cooperation with other competition authorities around the world, in particular the U.S. FTC and DOJ.

Rolfe has a broad range of securitization experience, primarily representing issuers and underwriters in public and private offerings of debt and equity backed by a wide variety of assets, including residential mortgages, auto loans, student loans and credit card receivables. He has also worked on various warehouse financings, servicing rights transfers and agency transactions.
Blanca has a degree in law from ICADE University.

Pablo has gained experience taking part in a number of transactions related with continued tax advice to multinational corporations and specific advice with tax implications concerning M&A transactions and asset restructurings. He has also participated in the regularisation of earnings process that started with the Royal Decree-Law 12/2012 of 30 of March, which introduced the Special Tax Declaration.

Blanca has experience in advising corporations and financial institutions on domestic and cross-border finance transactions. She has participated in bank financing transactions, including debt restructurings and project finance, and in capital markets transactions. Moreover, she has participated in the drafting and coordination of legal due diligence in connection with domestic and cross-border transactions. She also has experience in Corporate, Real Estate, and Antitrust Law.

Denise has recently re-joined the London banking team after spending two and a half years in the debt underwriting group at Goldman Sachs. Denise specialises in leveraged finance and has extensive knowledge of leveraged loan and high yield bond products and the leveraged finance market more generally. Her practice also covers event-driven financings in the growth markets for which clients recognise her aptitude for dealing with complex structuring and execution challenges. Prior to her move to Goldman, Denise was a senior associate in the London banking team during which time she also spent time on secondment with the leveraged finance team at Credit Suisse.

Jochen, LL.M. (University of Michigan), a German Rechtsanwalt and Notar, is partner and a real estate specialist who enjoys an outstanding reputation. He has advised various Middle East, U.S., UK and German investors on the sale, purchase and development of commercial, retail and real estate portfolios and works very closely with our leading experts from the financing, M&A, funds, tax and private equity practices. Jochen joined Allen & Overy LLP from a leading international law firm, where he built up the real estate practice, heading it as a partner for the past nine years. He also teaches as a lecturer at the law faculties of Heidelberg and Münster universities.

John Scriven was a partner in Allen & Overy's corporate department from 1988 and became a consultant in May 2002. While a partner, he led the Construction Law Group which is an integral part of the Projects Group. John specialises in advising on major projects worldwide, acting for project sponsors, banks and contractors. These projects include defence, road, rail, bridge, water treatment, power, refinery and other infrastructure projects. He worked on some of the first PPP projects, including the Second Severn Crossing and numerous health projects, including the Greenwich, St George's and King's hospital projects. More recently, he has acted for Barts and The London NHS Trust on their £1.1 bn development and for the funders on the St Luke's and Southmead hospital projects. His energy projects include SELCHP and Kirklees waste to energy projects, the Humber and Keadby power projects and the ISAB and Sarlux gasification and combined cycle power projects in Italy. He has also acted on numerous water projects for the UK company Biwater and for other clients over some twenty-five years. He has lectured at conferences on procurement procedures, including to government authorities. He is editor and co-author of "A Contractual Guide to Major Construction Projects", (Sweet & Maxwell 1999), and a contributor to "Future Directions in Construction Law" (1992) and "Risk Management and Procurement" (1995) published by King's College, London, and to the ICE "Construction Law Handbook" (2009). John has recently completed (with Nigel Pritchard) "EPC Contracts and Major Projects", a guide to construction and other project contracts, (Sweet & Maxwell 2011). He lectures in construction law at Reading University.

Person.Experience: Philip has extensive experience in handling domestic and international financial services investigations, and in conducting internal investigations. He was previously at the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA), and formerly the Financial Services Authority (FSA), where he worked in both the Enforcement and Supervision Divisions. Philip has particular experience of advising on market abuse/manipulation issues including benchmarks and commodities, and on supervisory matters including senior management issues. He previously oversaw the referral of Wholesale-related cases to the Enforcement Division and was the FCA Enforcement liaison with the City of London Police and the Serious Fraud Office.
Alex is in the Projects, Energy & Infrastructure Group in our New York office. For his level of seniority Alex has significant experience with international PPP projects and general banking.
Molly is an associate in the Project Finance group.

Graham was head of the Firm's Structured and Asset Finance Group for 10 years, having joined Allen & Overy LLP at the end of 1998. Previously he was a banking partner at another major City of London firm. Graham has specialised in banking, structured and asset finance for over 25 years and is recognised as one of its leading practitioners. Throughout his career he has been involved in a wide variety of banking, restructuring, M&A and structured finance transactions. He regularly lectures on banking and knowledge management topics both within the Firm and externally.

Patrick, a German Rechtsanwalt, joined the Allen & Overy LLP’s Frankfurt office in October 2013. Patrick’s main practice area comprise advising clients on the issuance of structured products and securitisation transactions. He also advises on banking regulatory law.

Dr Tim Schaper has joined Allen & Overy’s German Antitrust practice, an integral part of the Global Antitrust Group, in October 2013 as a senior associate. He advises on all aspects of German and European competition law, including cartel investigations and litigation matters, merger control and dominance cases as well as horizontal and vertical agreements. He has particular expertise in advising multinational conglomerates, such as ThyssenKrupp, on their long term antitrust strategy in their mergers & acquisitions and behavioural investigation cases including subsequent court scrutiny.

Person.Experience: Paul is a junior associate in the Litigation & Contracts department. Prior to joining Allen & Overy, Paul has worked as a consultant at a leading global provider of consulting services.

Victor has significant experience in notifying merger filing to the European Commission and the Spanish Competition Authority. He also has substantial experience defending companies in infringement proceedings dealing with collusive behaviour (cartels) and abuses of dominance. Victor has also advised multinational companies in state aid matters. Moreover, Victor has a significant experience in corporate law, in particular in matters related to M&A, commercial agreements, distribution law and unfair competition. Vcitor has advised in several sectors such as cosmetics, foodstuff, retail, power industry as well as paper sector.
Person.Publications: "Ayudas de Estado a los bancos en tiempos de crisis", Revista Derecho y Empresa (2009).

Person.Experience: Michael is an Associate in the International Capital Markets practice of our Frankfurt office. His principal areas of practice include structured finance, derivatives and financial services regulation. He acts for a range of financial institutions and alternative investment funds on both transactional and advisory matters. Prior to joining Allen & Overy LLP, Michael worked in the London based derivatives team of a major US law firm where his practice focused on a range of cross-border transactional and regulatory matters. Prior to that Michael completed his legal training with the legal and regulatory department of a major UK banking group. He is a bilingual English and German native speaker as well as fluent in French. Michael is qualified in England & Wales as well as in the Republic of Ireland. He is admitted to the Frankfurt Bar as a Registered European Lawyer.

Sebastian joined the Hamburg corporate team as a German Rechtsanwalt in 2013. He advises international and domestic companies in all areas of corporate law, with an emphasis on M&A transactions, joint ventures and restructurings.

Person.Experience: Marco has broad experience in advising clients on all areas of domestic and cross-border M&A. He has specialised on corporate, takeover and securities law advice for strategic and institutional investors, in particular listed companies as well as private equity clients. Marco also frequently advises on domestic and cross-border reorganisation projects and inter-company restructuring as well as joint ventures, capital market transactions, company successions and foundations. Marco has earned an LL.M. degree in commercial law at Cambridge University as well as a doctorate and an LL.M. Eur. degree at Goethe University of Frankfurt. He is a lecturer and speaker in M&A and company law and regularly publishes articles in all areas of commercial and corporate law.

Person.Experience: Christoph joined Allen & Overy LLP in November 2013. He has extensive experience in the field of real estate law, in particular in real estate transactions, both asset and share deals, and tenancy law.

Louise is a highly pragmatic and responsive lawyer who provides practical, commercial advice on all aspects of employment law. Experienced in Employment Tribunal and High Court litigation, Louise has acted for high profile clients across the board in claims including unfair and constructive dismissal, whistleblowing, discrimination and contractual disputes. Louise's key strength is developing close client relationships and an in-depth commercial understanding of their challenges, ensuring she is well placed to assist on any employment related issue, whether litigious, advisory or transactional. Louise has particular experience in the financial services sector, having recently advised on the employment aspects of a number of complex regulatory investigations.

Nawal focuses in capital markets and mergers and acquisitions. Before joining Allen & Overy, she was involved in various IPO projects, issues of bonds, capital increases in the NYSE Euronext Paris market and in other international markets. She also participated in mergers and acquisitions, joint ventures and restructuring projects, in particular in the banking sector in France, in the telecommunications sector in the United States and in the oil and gas sector in the Middle East.

Kate is a Counsel in the firm’s International Arbitration Group with experience in both institutional and ad hoc arbitrations sited in common and civil law jurisdictions. She has expertise in commercial disputes across a range of different industries (including the energy, telecommunications, automotive, technology, construction and pharmaceutical sectors) and arising out of a number of bespoke and industry specific agreements, including joint venture, shareholder, licensing, distribution, technology transfer, patent and construction agreements. Kate’s practice also includes representation in public international law matters, including most notably in the Abyei Arbitration (which lead to the independence of South Sudan). Kate has been recognised by Chambers & Partners for two years running as a “Star Associate”. Clients and peers describe her as “excellent,” “truly brilliant” and “very sensible and highly pragmatic”. She has also been recognised in Thomson Reuters SuperLawyers 2013 as a “Rising Star” in commercial dispute resolution.

Manal specializes in arbitration law. As such, Manal performs regularly on arbitration proceedings. She is also competent in corporate law and intervenes in corporate transactions and mergers and acquisitions.

Peter specialises in challenging competition law, consumer and regulatory issues. His expertise encompasses transactional advice, merger clearances, joint ventures and collaborations, access to infrastructure, and enforcement responses and defence. Peter has extensive experience in mining, energy and resources and a wide range of other sectors, and has advised leading organisations such as BHP Billiton, DuluxGroup, Caltex, BUPA, EnergyAustralia, National Australia Bank, North West Shelf Venture, Chevron, Singapore Power, Orica and Woodside. Prior to joining the firm, Peter worked as a senior officer at the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission (ACCC), where he developed strong relationships with key economic regulators. He is a member of the Competition and Consumer Committee of the Law Council of Australia. Peter has advised on the application of the competition provisions of the Trade Practices Act 1974 (Cth) to a wide variety of commercial arrangements and transactions and has assisted businesses in their dealings with the ACCC and other regulators.

Scott has significant experience in a wide range of projects and financings, in particular in the oil & gas, LNG, mining, power and infrastructure industries. He has particular experience advising on projects and financing involving JBIC and NEXI. Prior to joining the Tokyo office, he worked in the London and the Amsterdam offices of Allen & Overy. Scott is currently on client secondment in Sydney.
David is an associate the in the real estate team, based in New York.
Krisztian predominantly advises on corporate transactions including private acquisitions and disposals, joint ventures and private equity deals and general corporate law matters.

Person.Experience: Ianita Tui joined RTPR Allen & Overy in 2008. She is a qualified lawyer and has experience in advising domestic and international banks in different credit transactions and/or different perfection of guarantees and securities, in PPPs, procurement, concessions, governmental public debt and municipal finance, as well as general corporate and commercial law, real estate and state aid. Ianita is also involved in advising an international financial institution in numerous financings extended to Romanian municipalities and to local utilities sectors (water, district heating, solid waste, local transport).

Patrick is an associate working in the Düsseldorf employment and benefits group. Prior to joining Allen & Overy LLP in 2014 Patrick worked for several other renowned international law firms as a research fellow/trainee and as an assistant at the University of Cologne (Institut für Arbeits- und Wirtschaftsrecht, Prof. Dr. Martin Henssler). He focusses on providing employment advice in transactions, restructurings and reorganisations at both company and shop level. Furthermore, he advises German and international companies on all employment law matters and on collective bargaining and works constitution law as well as on board-level employee co-determination. Additionally, Patrick advises in company pension matters.

Person.Experience: Heath heads Allen & Overy’s U.S. bank regulatory group. A dual-qualified U.S.-UK lawyer, Heath is also a member of the UK-EU financial services regulatory practice based in London and other European offices. Heath is recognized for his transactional and regulatory expertise involving banks and other financial institutions. In particular, Heath is known for his work involving capital and liquidity requirements under Basel III, recovery and resolution planning, systemic risk regulation, acquisitions and divestments under the U.S. Bank Holding Company Act, and structuring and compliance activities in connection with the Volcker Rule. He also has significant private and public sector experience in crisis management, congressional inquiries, and regulatory investigations. Prior to joining Allen & Overy, Heath was a partner at another leading international law firm. Before that, he served as Special Counsel to the U.S. Senate Banking Committee, where he was a lead expert and negotiator on the various legislative proposals that culminated in the historic and sweeping Dodd-Frank Act. Additionally, from 2008 to 2009, Heath was appointed Associate Counsel to the President of the United States. During his tenure at the White House, Heath oversaw the financial markets portfolio and worked with senior officials at the Treasury Department, the Federal Reserve, and other Executive Branch agencies to develop the emergency measures taken by the U.S. Government during the global financial crisis. Earlier in his career, Heath served as a law clerk to Justice Clarence Thomas of the Supreme Court of the United States and to Chief Judge Douglas H. Ginsburg of the U.S. Court of Appeals for the D.C. Circuit. Several leading industry publications have highlighted Heath’s banking and financial regulatory expertise. Law 360 recently named him a “Rising Star,” noting that he has “a fluency in the changing regulatory landscape shared by few in his field” and is “a sought-after banking regulatory lawyer at a time when the industry is undergoing the most sweeping changes it has seen in generations.” Heath also has been named a “Leading Lawyer” in both banking and financial services regulation by IFLR 1000, a “Recommended Lawyer” for financial institutions by The Legal 500 USA, and a Washington, D.C. Rising Star by Super Lawyers. In addition, Heath has been recognized in the Lawdragon Guide to World-Class Lawyers and is the recipient of a Burton Award for Legal Writing. Heath has made numerous media appearances and is a frequent speaker and author on financial regulation and other issues of import to the financial services industry. Heath currently serves on the Board of Editors of the Banking Law Journal and on the Board of Advisors of the Review of Banking and Financial Services. In addition, he is the Vice Chairman of the Subcommittee on Systemically Important Financial Institutions of the Banking Law Committee of the American Bar Association. He has been elected to the Banking Committee Executive Council of the Federal Bar Association and to the Exchequer Club of Washington, D.C. Heath combines his extensive background in banking law with finance and accounting expertise. He is a member of the CFA Institute and the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants. In addition, Heath is a member of the American Enterprise Institute, the Atlantic Council, The Bretton Woods Committee, and the Sovereign Military Order of Malta. Heath is also a Term Member of the Council on Foreign Relations.

Person.Experience: Claire Toumieux heads the Paris employment law department. She advises businesses seeking to define, implement and/or improve their human resource management strategies. She has built up a strong reputation in assisting corporate groups, both listed and unlisted, and investment funds through strategic operations such as mergers and acquisitions, collective bargaining agreements and reorganizations.She also represents them both on sensitive individual and collective disputes. Last September Claire was re-elected for a second two-year term as Vice Chair of the European Employment Lawyers Association, the European body for lawyers specialising in employment law. Claire is winner of the 2011 ILO Client Choice Award for Labour & Employment in France.
Person.Publications: Claire is the national correspondent for the European Employment Law Cases publication.

Person.Experience: Sofia graduated in Law and in Business Administration and Management at Colegio Universitario de Estudios Financieros of Madrid (CUNEF), adjacent school to Universidad Complutense of Madrid and founded through the initiative of the Spanish Banking Association (Asociación Española de Banca, AEB).
Brian is an associate in our Litigation team.
Ric is an associate in our global IP team, based in Washington, D.C.

Gordon has more than 25 years of experience in handling financial regulatory matters. Gordon previously served as an attorney and counsel for the Federal Reserve, where he advised on a variety of matters related to the Bank Holding Company Act, including the supervision of the Reserve’s review and approval of the largest divestiture ever required for competitive purposes under that Act. Gordon also handled matters regarding the Change in Bank Control Act, corporate control, affiliate transactions and insider lending, and anti-competitive practices.

Vincent is a specialist in domestic and cross-border litigation, commercial litigation, and national and international arbitration. He has extensive experience in corporate litigation, M&A disputes, fraud and white collar crime. He regularly advises investment funds, investors and service providers in relation to litigation and pre-litigation issues. Vincent has more than 10 years of experience working in these areas.

Person.Experience: Stephen is the firm's Global Markets Partner with overall responsibility for leading and co-ordinating our approach to markets in which we do not yet have an established presence and for co-ordinating our relationships with associated firms and with firms in new markets with whom we may wish to establish formal ties (referral firms). In addition, he is A&O's global representative with regulatory and professional bodies such as the IBA. From 2007 until 2009 he was International Development partner with a wide ranging role relating to the global development of the firm. From 1997 until 2007, he was Regional Managing Partner for Europe, with overall responsibility for the firm's Continental European offices. From 2003 to 2006 he was co-managing partner of the Italian offices of the firm. From 1990 until 1997, he was the partner in charge of co-ordinating the activities of the firm's Central and Eastern European practice group and had overall responsibility for its offices in Warsaw, Prague, Budapest and Moscow. He headed the Warsaw office from 1995 - 1997 and the Frankfurt office from 1998 to 2000. His professional work has included M&A, privatisations, flotations and take-over bids in many parts of Europe. He frequently chairs and speaks at conferences on a range of topics relating to law firm development and management.
